description: TRENTON, July 3 The New Jersey Legislature's Joint Committee on Ethical Standards, which has yet to take action against any legislator, is beginning to come under criticism.

title: Getting a Big Bang Out of Things That Go Boom in the Night
description: IN Medieval Spain, the Moorish rulers used fireworks to delight the peons of Valencia and Murcia. In 18thcentury France, King Louis XV dazzled his subjects with pyrotechnic disc plays at Versailles. In 20thcentury New York, it can be revealed here, Mayor Beame has decreed that the fireworks commissioner is one of our most important official positions.

title: Food Stamp Mail Date
description: Supplemental Security Income participants who live alone or as couples and who are unable to appear in person at foodstamp centers will be allowed to recertify themselves for the stamps by mail up to July 31. Philip L. Toia, State Commissioner of Social Servi,:es, said the Agriculture Department had given permission for mail recertification.

title: EDYTHE C. H. TOWNSEND
description: Edythe C, H. Townsend, a trustee emeritus of the New York School for the Deaf and chairman, during World War II, of Farm for Freedom, an organization that recruited school and college girls to help farmers harvest their crops in Columbia and Dutchess Counties, died Saturday in Clermont, N.Y. She was 91 years Mrs, Townsend was chairman of the Unemployment Commission in Irvington and Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., during the Depression, and an honorary member of the Garden Club.

title: FRED W. DICKSON, AT 64, EXCOCACOLA OFFICIAL
description: Fred W. Dickson, a retired senior vice president of the CocaCola Bottling Company, died in Atlanta yesterday after a short illness. He was 64.

title: Italian Reds, Back From Soviet, Tell of Differences
description: ROME, July 3An Italian Communist delegation returned today from talks with Soviet leaders in Moscow and indicated that the two parties differences on Eurocommunism were continuing.

title: DRIVE IS MOUNTED FOR LANDMARK UNITS
description: MORRISTOWN, July 3  Historians, educators and environmentalists are pressing New Jersey's 567 mtmicipalities to set up landmarks commissions to protect historic sites.

title: Police Use Blanket to Catch Girl At SixthStory Fire Fatal to
description: As two police detectives and two by on the sidewalk below stretched out a blanket, a terrified 4yearold girl was dropped to safety by her stepfather yesterday from the window of a blazing sixthfloor Bronx apartment where her mother and her twin sister were fatally burned.

title: Houston Opera Offers Capital Mice and Men
description: WASHINGTON, July 3For many Americans, a casual reference to Houston is likely to conjure up instant thoughts of oil, money, space flights and Texas money men operating at full tilt. If things keep going as they have for the last two years, however, Washingtonians may begip to think of Houston as a principal supplier of operatic fare for the nation's capital.

title: Turtle Racing, Slow Versus Slower
description: As racetime drew near at the third annual racing championships in Chester, Robert LeFrancis, and his sisters, Kerry, center, and Noel, stretched their entrants legs, allowing the last nibble of green grass before start of the run (?) for glory. Below, a difficult decision for judges as sail attached Henry, the eventual winner, was termed legal and allowable.

title: NANTUCKET OIL SPILL COST TO U.S. PUT AT $5.2 MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (UPI)  Government investigators say that the massive oil spill that resulted when the tanker Argo Merchant ran aground off Nantucket Island, Mass., last December cost taxpayers more than $5.2 million.

title: Two Copper Producers and Unions Reach Pact, Indicating Short Strike
description: PHOENIX, July 3 (UPI)About 38,000 striking copper workers will be back on the job soon after the Fourth of July weekend as a result of a contract settlement with two of the industry's biggest producers, union officials predicted today.

title: Chart of the Swaps Stakes
description: Copyright 1977 by Daily Racing Form. Inc.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: EXPORT FREEDOM (A.E.L.). Naples July 12 and Genoa 24; sails from Howland Hook, Staten island, N.Y. Letters, prints and parcel post for Italy, Malta and Vatican City State; Parcel post for Genoa, Torino and 1dente.

title: Auto Racing
description: FRENCH GRAND PRIX THE LEADERS 1Mario Andretti, Nazareth, Pa., PSLotus, 1 hour 39 minutes 40.13 seconds; average speed, 113.715 miles Der hour.

title: Kathleen McCahey Is Bride of Larry Lechner
description: Kathleen McCahey and Larry Allan Lechner were married yesterday in the SS. Faith Hope and Charity Roman Catholic Church in Winnetka, Ill. The Rev. Roger Sullivan performed the ceremony.

title: Bridge:
description: Length signals by the defenders normally apply only when the declaring side has led the suit. The most common situation arises when the declarer leads toward a strong suit in the dummy: A defender will play low with an odd number of cards, high with an even number of cards, to help his partner decide whether to play a key honor.

title: Albany Bill on Cadavers Causes Protest From Medical,Examiners
description: A bill that was supposed to make it easier for medical schools to obtain cadavers is under attack by medical examiners around New York State, who contend that a lastminute rider added surreptitiously will make it difficult for them to conduct autopsies.

title: HARD LINE EXPECTED FROM CITY UNIONS
description: During its extended fiscal crisis, New York City receivedand the city administration has acknowledgedsignificant cOoperation and assistance from its municipal unions, but Mayor Boame or new mayor may face difficult contract neeotiations next year.

title: Dubuque Enriched by Role in New Movie
description: DUBUQUE, Iowa, July 3Dubuque's little old lady has fallen in love with Hollywood, and things may never be the same after her whirlwind twomonth affair with Sylvester Stallone and about 100 of his friends.

title: Guidry's 20 Victory Offsets106 Defeat
description: The Yankees ran out of pitchers yesterday about the same time the Tigers found some hitters, and the result was a split of their doubleheader at the Stadium.

title: Huntington Wins in Polo
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., July 3Ted Brinkman's goal in suddendeath overtime, his fifth of the game, gave the Huntington polo team a 65 victory over Jericho today at Bethpage State Park.

title: Carey Assailed at. Brooklyn Rally By Supporters of Death Penalty
description: Advocates of stronger penalties for criminals railed in support of the state's deathpenalty bill yesterday at a Brooklyn street rally in which Governor Carey, who has promised to veto the measure, was criticized.

title: Glen Gardner Unit, First StateRun Nursing Home, Delivers Psychological as Well as Physical Care
description: GLEN GARDNER, July 3 The mist swirled in the hollows of the aretes of Mount Kipp, and the sparkling new hospital nestled under the crest of the small mountain is the perfect place from which to watch the changing patterns of one of the most beautiful vistas in New Jersey.

title: Dispute Over TruthinLending Act Grows
description: A major conflict is taking shape between the financial industry, and consumer activists over Congressional initiatives to simplify the Federal TruthinLending Act.

title: A Sampling of Events To Mark The Fourth
description: The Mr Force Thunderbirds, a precision flying team, will swoop over the Statue of Liberty and head up the Hudson River at 10:30 A.M. today.

title: Seattle Slew 4th In Race on Coast, His First Defeat
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., July 3 Seattle Slew's phenomenal record of nine successive victories, including racing's Triple Crown, came to an abrupt end today as he ran a sorry. fourth, 16 lengths back, In the fourth running of the $316,400 Swaps Sweepstakes for 3yearolds at Hollywood Park.

title: South's Economic Boom Attracts Industry and Banks From Abroad
description: ATLANTA, July 3  The booming Southern economy is taking on an increasingly international tone.

title: New York State Is Shortchanged On Federal Aid, New Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON, July 3  Fortyfour Federal aid programs distributing $24 billion a year are gravely shortchanging New York and other states of the Northeast and Middle West, according to a new income study released by a coalition of 204 Congressmen from those states.

title: Marylin Girard Wed To Dr. J.D. Robinson
description: Marylin Eve Girard, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert. A. Girard of Palm Beach, Fla., and Gastonia, N.C., was married yesterday to Dr. Joseph Daniel Robinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Robinson. of Beach. Haven, N.J. Rabbi Asher Bar Zev performed the ceremony at the Breakers in Palm RAS161

title: Canadian Union Supporters  Favor a Homegrown Charter
description: MONTREAL, July 3Proposals for new constitution to modify Canada's political institutions and to enhance the coexistence of the Frenchspeaking and Englishspeaking populations appear to be gaining throughout the country as one answer to Quebec's drive for independence.

title: ENDURGEDTOSECRECY IN PLEA BARGAINING
description: WASHINGTON, July 3  A study commissioned by the Department of Justice has recommended an end to the secrecy surrounding plea bargaining in the nation's courts, both to help end public skepticism of the process and to curb some of the abuses the practice has led to.

title: Commodities
description: Next to a margin call, nothing unsettles the average small trader in commodity futures as much as an early morning call from his broker declaring You have been hit with delivery noflees. Shall we stop them or liquidate the affected contracts?

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed in order of post positions. Letter designates OTB. listing. FIRST58,500, trot, Class C2, mile.

title: JAMES JACKSON STORROW
description: James Jackson Storrow, long.a consen'ationist, died yesterday at his home, in Marblehead, Mass. He was 84 years old.

title: Smith, on Graffiti, Wins Aachen Equestrian Title
description: AACHEN, West Germany, July 3 (AP)Harvey Smith, of Britain, won the $14,500 grand prix at the Aachen international equestrian championships today ahead of Luis AlvarezCervera of Spain.

title: Dr. Sharon London Is Bride
description: Dr. Sharon Donna London, daughter of Mrs. William Bander of Flushing, Queens, and the late Harry Morris London of Brooklyn, was married in Brooklyn yesterday to Alexander Dunbar Person, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Person of New York. Rabbi Fredric S. Dworkin performed the ceremony at the Deauville. The bride is a psychologist. Her husband is president of Aladdin Associates Inc., a publishing and printing concern in the Bronx. His previous marriage ended in divorce.

title: Aides to Hughes Reported As Doubtful He Left Will
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 3 (AP)Some aides to Howard R. Hughes have said in sworn documents that they believe the industrialist never left a valid will, The Philadelphia Inauirer reported today.

title: Police Sergeant Struck By Car and Bystander Is Shot in Wild Chase
description: A police sergeant was struck by a car and thrown 150 feet in an incident near Yankee Stadium last evening that left one bystander wounded by a stray bullet and ended when the wayward auto struck a barrier and a mole.

title: All Vienna Dances to  Time As Festival Waltzes to Close
description: VIENNA  If this is the year of the waltz, as fashionable people are telling us, what better place to be than Vienna, where even the traffic moves to  time and every, 17th male looks like Johann Strauss the Younger.

title: Health Fund Charged
description: Arthur Levitt, New York State Comptroller, charged that the Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene was improperly retaining as much as $1 million in funds that rightfully belong to the state. The 25yearold foundation was set up by the state to administerresearch grants from various sources on behalf of the Department of Mental Hygiene. In the threeyearperiod ended March 31, 1975, covered by Mr. Levitt's audit, the foundation administered $15.8 million in grants.

title: OUTLOOK FOR HIRING BETTER AROUND U. S.
description: The intentions of employers in the New York City area to hire more people have gone up significantly, according to two separate surveys just released.

title: The Weather Here Last Month
description: The Weather Here Last Month

title: T.V.A., a Major Polluter, Faces Suit to Cut Sulfur Dioxide Fumes
description: ATLANTA, July 3After years of almost futile legal battling on its own, the Environmental Protection Agency is now considering joining private citizens in a suit against the nation's No. 1 sulfur dioxide polluter, the Tennessee Valley Authority, another Federal agency.

title: JUST CE SAYPOL.EULOGIZED AS VAN :OF MDEPENDENCE
description: JhstIce lrving H Saypol was eulogized by friends and colleagues yesterday as an independent man whose career in State Supreme Court was characterized by compassion and fairness..

title: Letters
description: To the Editor Adm. Stanfield Turner, the Director of C.I.A. as well as the Director of Central Intelligence, has proposed to President Carter that the intelligence community have a single chief unaffiliated with any of the component agencies, such as C.I.A.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HOW IT WAS It's one thing to watch today's briny, panoramic sweep of the New York Harbor Festival, as vessels ply waters in a holiday salute. It's another to step in close and learn how sailors lived during the early days of American shipping aboard clippers, whalers and cargo, military and fishing boats.

title: In Philadelphia, Pride in the City Grows
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 2Making life imitate romantic fancy, early morning joggers have been puffing up the steps of the city's Art Museum, raising their arms and doing a short championdance, like the one that Sylvester Stallone, who used to live in Philadelphia, did in Rocky, the movie he made here.

title: Inmate, 25, Found Hanged in Cell
description: COMSTOCK, N.Y., July 3 (AP)A 25yearold inmate at Great Meadows prison hanged himself in his cell, authorities said today. The Department of Correctional Services identified the inmate as Donald Knuckles of Albany, who was serving 25 years to life on murder and robbery charges.

title: Soviet Sharpens Criticism of U.S. Plans for Missile
description: MOSCOW, July 3Following President Carter's decision to cancel production of the supersonic B1 bomber, the Soviet Union has sharpened its criticism of the White House for pushing ahead with the development of another weapons system the low.flvine cruise missile.

title: Soviet Warns Against Criticism
description: MOSCOW, July 3 (AP) A Soviet specialist on Marxist ideology has warned mavericks in foreign Communist parties that any criticism of the Soviet Union will boomerang on Communist parties around the world.

title: Saharan Guerrillas Raid Capital Of Mauritania for 2d Time in Year
description: NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, July 3 (AP) Guerrillas fighting for the independence of the former Spanish Sahara attacked Nouakchott, the capital of Mauritania, with mortars and automatic weapons tonight, Mauritanian sources said.

title: Saudis See the Light
description: TEHERAN, July 3Iran's chief oil negotiator expressed strong satisfaction today that the twotier OPEC price system would end.

title: Soviet Sharpens Criticism of U.S. Plans for Missile
description: MOSCOW, July 3Following President Carter's decision to cancel production of the supersonic B1 bomber, the Soviet Union has sharpened its criticism of the White House for pushing ahead with the development of another weapons system the lowflying cruise missile.

title: G. NARASIMHAN, 62, HEAD OF DAILY PAPER IN INDIA
description: MADRAS, India, July 3 (Reuters) Gopalan Narasimhan, managing editor of The Hindu, o'e of India's leading Englishlanguage newspapers, died here today following a heart attack. He was 62 years old.

title: Nuclear Plant Got U.S. Contracts Despite Many Security Violations
description: WASHINGTON, July 2A small nuclear materials processing plant in Pennsylvania has continued to receive Government contracts worth millions of dollars even though inspectors have repeatedly found the facility violating stringent safety and security regulations.

title: Navy Seeks New Devices to Fight Submarines
description: In a drive by the United States Navy to counter Soviet advances in submarines, new American weapons and devices will include underwater sensors so delicate they detect noises generated by the flow of water around fast submarines, highspeed aircushion ships capable of pursuing submarines, at 50 to 80 miles an hour and encapsulated torpedoes that can detect, classify and attack the most advanced underwater craft.

title: Forego, at Impost of 138, Races at Belmont Today
description: Forego, noted for his explosive stretch drives, and Hunza Dancer, a Kentuckybred horse, who has found the grass greener on this side of the Atlantic after campaigning in Europe, will mark the Fourth of July in stakes on both coasts.

title: EichelbergerTriumphs in Milwaukee Golf; Mrs. Rankin, With 212, Wins by 3 in Canada
description: MILWAUKEE, July 3 (AP)Dave Eichelberger broke a fourman tie with a birdie on his 34th hole today and held on for a twostroke victory over Morris Hatalsky, Gary McCord and Mike Morley in the rainplagued $130,000 Greater Milwaukee open golf tournament.

title: Golden King of the Courts
description: WIMBLEDON, England, July 3 There was no way Bjorn Borg could win Wimbledon this year, the insiders said. He was too involved with team tennis, his fiancee and his countless commercial endorsements to get matchtough on Man grass courts in time. The centennial Wimblein the don fortnight ended News yesterday at the All England. Lawn Tennis Club. When the Duke of Kent presented the gold trophy to the men's singles champion, the recipient for the second consecutive year was not Jimmy Connors, Ilie Nastase or any of the socalled big guns on grass, but Bjorn Borg.

title: Sioux in Indian Education Post
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (AP)Gerald E. Gipp, a Standing Rock Sioux, has been appointed deputy commissioner of Indian education in the Office of Education, was announced yesterday. Mr. Gipp, 36 years old, a native of Fort Yates, S.D., has been assistant professor of education administration at Pennsylvania State University. He will administer the Indian Education Act of 1972.

title: Bratits
description: ANDERSONGustav A., 70, ofj 513.1 Lincoln Ave Pine Beach. NaJ: on July 2, 1977, beloved husband of Julia, devotedfather of Norman, Joseph, Mrs. Karen Ahern, Miss Ellen Anderson and Mrs. Grace Ryan, brother of Mrs. Evelyn. Harobine. Friends may call Tuesday from 24 and 79 P.M. at O'Connell's Home for Funerals, 706 Rte. 9, Sayville, N. J.

title: Soviet HighJumper Sets World Record of 7734
description: RICHMOND, July 3Vladimir Ilyich Yashchenko, an 18yearold Ukrainian, broke the world highjump record today Competing for the Soviet Union in the annual jumor dual meet against the United States, Yashchenko cleared 7 feet 7 inches. The previous record, set by Dwight Stones at Franklin Field, Philadelphia, last year, was 77.

title: New CharchliecgiPromises ;to Streps, Populise Approcich
description: WASHINGTON, July 3The new presi; dent of the United Church of Christ, the Rev. Dr. Avery Denison Post, one of the country's most outspoken voices of liberal Protestantism,. promised today to be a populiSt pastor to his 1.8 million constitutents.

title: Foyt Rallies to Victory
description: MOSPORT, Ontario, July 3 (UPI)A. J. Foyt rallied today to win the $25,000 United States Automobile Club Championship race over the twisting 2.45mile course here. Gary Bettenhausen and Tom Sneva were second and third, respectively, in the 186mile race, the only U.S.A.C. race not run on a oval track.

title: Issue and Debate
description: One of the givens of public debate is that there will be experts to testify on all sides of nearly every issue. For every set of statistics, theories and reasonable hunches that supports one point of view, there is usually an equally appealing collection of data that supports the opposite.

title: Cherchez a Horsethief Who Reads
description: Dick Francis is a slight, talented Englishman who rode enough winners in steeplechases to gain fame in his homeland, and fell on his head often enough to become a writer. He turns out eminently successful thrillers, ingeniously plotted tales with a racing background, that have spread his reputation far beyond his native country, perhaps even as far as the boondocks of eastcentral Kentucky. Assuming that horsenappers in the vicinity of Paris, Ky., can read, it is conceivable that Blood Sport, one of Mr. Francis's novels, gave them the idea for the Sports.

title: Remund's Hydroplane Takes Cup in Indiana
description: MADISON, Ind., July 3 (AP)  Mickey Remund, driving the RollsRoycepowered Miss Budweiser, won both qualifying heats today and then beat Tom Sheehy's Natural Light for the Indiana Governor's Cup in the 30th annual Madison Regatta for unlimited hydroplanes.

title: Case of the Language Laboratory Illustrates Credit Law Controversy
description: Depending on your point of view, the case of Emerito Morales vs the Arkay Electromatic Corporation demonstrates a perverted use of the TruthinLending Act or an outstanding example of how it can be used in defense of consumers.

title: Phantom Takes Lead In TransPacific Sail
description: LOS ANGELES, July 3 (AP)Phantom, a 66foot sloop skippered by Tony Delfino of Marina Del Rey, Calif., took over the elapsedtime lead today after 19 hours of sailing in the 29th biannual transPacific yacht race.

title: Army Engineers Store Water in the Ohio Basin
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., July 3 (UPI)The Army Corps of Engineers is storing extra water in its Ohio Basin reservoirs in case of drought, the corps has announced.

title: A Message to Chile, and Beyond
description: By delaying two small nonmilitary loans to Chile for a month or two, the Carter Administration has begun to deal with an unavoidable choice. To aid regimes that grossly violate human rights, particularly in this hemisphere, is to be perceived as endorsing repression. To cut off the aid is to be blamed for punishing the victims as much as their rulers. The President now stands with one foot on each of these propositions, which is where he must remain.

title: 20 West Bank Arabs Under Death Sentence
description: AMMAN. Jordan, July 3 (Reuters)More than 20 Arabs on the Israelioccupied West Bank of the Jordan are living under a Jordanian sentence of death for selling property to Israelis.

title: 2 Murderers Escape
description: Authorities searched for two convicted murderers who walked away from a minimumsecurity camp at Rahway State Prison over the weekend, correction officials said.

title: Mother and Son Hurt In a Boat Explosion
description: An explosion and fire aboard a pleasure boat near a City Island dock critically injured a woman and her 2yearold son yesterday afternoon shortly after the craft had been refueled. The police said one other passenger suffered lesser injuries and three were rescued unharmed.

title: Dance: Season Finale for Stuttgart and City Ballets
description: The, season's curtain came down for two ballet companies this weekend and both had a novelty to offer. The New York City Ballet, which closed last night at the State Theater, presented Jorge Donn in his debut in George Balanchine's Bugaku on Saturday afternoon. The same evening, the Stuttgart Ballet closed its season at the Metropolitan Opera House with a mixed bill that included a new ballet, William Forsythe's Daphne.

title: Two Kidnapped Girls Freed
description: FRESNO, Calif., July 3 (AP)Two girls kidnapped last week from a shopping cbnter by a man who enticed them into his automobile by a ruse have been freed, tne police said today. After telephoning their parents with news of their release late yesterday from Bakersfield, 100 miles south of here, the girls were returned here and received medical examinations. Norma Milligan, 15 years old, of Santa Cruz and Christina Alcorn, 7, of Reedley appeared to be uninjured, the police said.

title: Bicentennial, Plus One
description: After the glories of last year's Fourth of July, this one was bound to be a shade anticlimactic. Yet there is a pleasant Bicentennial to be marked this year, not the creation but the start, of a nation's settling in.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Marcia Haydee and Richard Cragun performing in Daphne.

title: MaryElizabeth Farley Wed to F. J. Carnabuci
description: MaryElizabeth Farley. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leo A. Farley of Loudonville, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Frank Joseph Carnabuci, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank J. Carnabuci of Mount Kisco, N. Y.

title: Individuality of Style Cymbalized In HaynesBlakeyRoach Show
description: Conventional wisdom has it that jazz drumming is largely a matter of dexJerky and swing, but the Newport Jazz rettival's Salute to the Drum Leaders, held Saturday night at Avery Fisher Hall, demonstrated that drumming is also, and perhaps even primarily, matter of sound. One usually thinks first of saxophonists or trumpeters when one thinks of personal sounds in jazz, but Roy Haynes, Art Blakey and Max Roach were easily identifiable on Saturday night solely by the timbres and textures of their drum kits.

title: Hatfield Denies Loan Impropriety
description: WASHINGTON, July 3Senator Mark O. Hatfield dismissed as sewer journalism today a published report in which a $420,000 loan he received from a West Coast bank to buy a house here wall linked with help his office gave to the bank shortly afterward in dealing with a Federal agency.

title: Expos Triumph, 42 Swan Is Victim
description: MONTREAL, July 3  The Mets plunge continued unabated today. Besides losing their fourth game in a row to the. Montreal Expos, 42, for their 10th defeat in 12 games, the few little positive things they had going for them were also wiped out.

title: Problems for New Leader of N.A.A.C.P.
description: ST. LOUIS, July. 3In the middle of news conference the other day, Nathaniel R. Jones, general counsel of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, was interrupted by Margaret Bush Wilson, board chairman of the orNews Analysis ganization, as she brought Roy Wilkins in by the arm News to pose for pictures to prove AnalYsls that we're united. The fact that Mrs. Wilson felt disposed to prove that we're united was indicative of the state of affairs of the oldest, largest and most effective civil rights organization in. the country, and, by projection, of the problems besetting the civil rights movement.

title: Washington Workshop Helps Women Hone Their Political Skills
description: WASHINGTON, July 3  One is a mother of eight, another worked as a blackjack dealer and another was her Congressman's executive secretary. Now they are all prospective Congresswomen.

title: Her 4th 77 Victory Is Worth $12,000
description: LACHUTE, Quebec, July 3 (AP)Judy Rankin, the leading money winner on this year's Ladies Professional Golf Association tour, overcame a shaky putting effort in the early going today to win the Pet Jackson Classic.

title: South's Economic Boom Attracts Industry and Banks From Abroad
description: ATLANTA, July 3  The booming Southern economy is taking on an increasingly international tone.

title: U.S. Trade Envoy Seeks to Spur Progress in Geneva Negotiations
description: GENEVA, July 3President Carter's Special Trade Negotiator, Robert S. Strauss, will visit the European Common Market Commission in Brussels on July 12 in a bid to inject new life into the longstalled Geneva trade negotiations, according to diplomatic sources.

title: In Philadelphia, Pride in the City Grows
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 2Making life imitate romantic fancy, early morning joggers have been puffing.up the steps of the city's Art Museum, raising their arms and doing a short championdance, like the one that Sylvester Stallone, who used to live in Philadelphia, did in Rocky, the movie he made here.

title: Supreme Court's Year Is Marked By Changes in Patterns of Voting
description: WASHINGTON, July 2The Supreme Court in its justcompleted court year handed a number of major setbacks to the drive for women's rights and to the efforts of civil rights groups to combat racial discrimination.

title: Japan Sweeps 6 Events At Karate Championships
description: TOKYO, July 3 (UPI)Japan swept the second world karate championships today, retaining all of the six titles.

title: 2D DAY OF PORT FETE SPARKLES WITH SAIL
description: With four sleek Navy yawls leading the way and dozens of tiny sailboats darting like gnats amid a caravan of lumbering brigantines and antique sloops, a 100craft Parade of Sail rounded the tip of Manhattan Island yesterday.

title: Up a Jazzy River, Bourbon Street
description: The jazz fans who packed a Staten Island ferryboat Saturday for the Newport Jazz Festival's annual River Boat Ride came to enjoy. As the ferryboat made three trips from the Battery to the George Washington Bridge and rack, they crowded around the improvised bandstands where Wallace Davenport's New Orleans Band and the Dukes of Dixieland took turns playing, and they cheered and applauded enthusiasticallly every number and every solo.

title: That They Are Endowed
description: Human rights, for a change, are a weekday concern in America this year, not just Independence Day gruel. And thanks to this country, the issue reverberates through the world this July 4.

title: Rebellious Bishop Reports Followers Are Harassed
description: NICE, France, July 3 (AP) Archbishop Marcel Lefebvre, who has defied Pope Paul VI in a traditionalist rebellion, told more than 3,000 people gathered in gambling casino for a mass today that his followers were being harassed.

title: Pressure to Admit Blacks Worries Michigan Town
description: LIVONIA, Mich.There is perhaps no more obvious fact of urban life in America than that black and white families live separately, blacks mostly in the cities, whites usually in the surrounding ring of suburbs. And all the complex reasons why this is so hard to change are summed up well in this 99.96 percent white suburb 15 miles west of Detroit's teeming black ghetto.

title: Watching What Watchers Do While They Wait to Watch
description: As four Naval Academy yawls led the Parade of Sail beneath the Triborough bridge heading south through the East River, a woman watching them from a bench in Carl Schurz park held a radio tuned to an allnews station close to her ear. When the announcer confirmed that the parade was passing under the Triborough bridge, she turned to a stranger standing with her on the bench. They're passing under the Triborough bridge, she said.

title: Disputes Overshadowing Strategy At Conference of African Leaders
description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon, July 3 Questions involving disputes among African nations overshadowed discussion of strategies for liberating southern Africa as the heads of state and government of the Organization of African Unity began their first full session today.

title: Aid Is Offered to Driver
description: AMERICUS, Ga., July 4 (AP)Buddy Cochran, accused of ramming his sports car into a speaker's platform full of Ku Klux Klansmen, has received several offers of financial and legal aid from around the country, the Sumter County sheriff's office said today.

title: Soviet Bars TV Talk by U.S. Envoy
description: MOSCOW, July 4The United States ambassador to the Soviet Union was not allowed to deliver a traditional Fourth of July speech over Soviet television today after he had declined to delete section alluding to the human rights policy of the Carter Administration.

title: Dole Says Delegates in Belgrade Should Fully Discuss Rights Issue
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, July 4 (UPI) Senator Robert Dole said today that the United States must insist on a full discussion of human rights at the conference to be held here to review the Helsinki accords, because he wants to see if President Carter's commitment to the issue is for real.

title: Desai T ells of an Understanding Reached in Secret With Carter
description: NEW DELHI, July 4 (AP)Prime Minister Morarji R. Desai said today that in a secret: exchange of letters he and President Carter had achieved understanding on a wide range of world issues. The leader of India also said in an inI terview that the United States, as the world's most powerful nation, had both a privilege and a duty to promote disarmament.

title: Americans Have Adopted Soccer, No Longer an Immigrant Sport
description: Fourteen years ago, when Pat McComiskey was asked by a priest to start a youth soccer league in Massapequa, L.I., he had to travel across town to the football coach at Our Lady of Lourdes grammar school and plead for players who had been cut from the football team. He had no choice; he needed 11 players for a team, and he could get only eight or nine on his own.

title: Haitian Is Being Returned Home After He Is Accused in Brazil Killing
description: BRASILIA, July 4 (UPI)The Foreign Ministry said today that the Haitian Government was sending three men to take custody of a Haitian diplomat accused of Ordering the assassination of his country's ambassador to Brazil.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: The Internal Revenue Servicenever knOwn for its popularity among the nation's taxpayersmay have bitten off more than it bargained for when it decided recently to go after the venerable American institution of televised college football.

title: Attempts to Replace U.S Attorney Stirring Dispute
description: An effort by powerful New Jersey Democrats to replace Jonathan L. Goldstein as United States Attorney for the state with a Newark bankruptcy lawyer has led to a heated dispute over political patronage in one of the most acclaimed Federal law enforcement offices in the country.

title: College Desegregation Guidelines Will Be Issued by H.E.W. Today
description: WASHINGTON, July 4 (UPI)College desegregation guidelines that take into account the unique importance of black colleges will be announced tomorrow by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: In the Shadow of Southern History
description: Some years ago, during my first few days in New York, I was driving up Third Avenue when a car forced me over to the curb. I prickled with that rush of fear of random violence that new arrivals instinctively feel in the big city. The window rolled down so that. I could see a black couple with kids piled in the back seat. The man hollered in an unmistakable accent, Hey, man, where in North Carolina y'all from? Durham, I answered, relieved to know that it was only my license plate.that had attracted his attention. We're from Rocky Mount, he said. Sure is good.to see some home folks. We laughed and the kids waved goodbye.

title: Mother Says She Was Raped and Children Were Kidnapped, but Police Are Skeptical
description: An apparently fictitious report by Bronx woman that she had been raped and her two small children abducted by a group of eight men yesterday sent police on a pointless eighthour search by land, air and water.

title: CARTER'S AIDES FEAR HOUSE ENERGY SHIFTS WILL COST $30 BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, July 4Changes that House committees made in President Carter's energy plan over the last two weeks could produce $30 billion to $40 billion in additional budget deficits between now and 1985, according to Administration officials.

title: Holiday Death Toll in New York: How First 2 Died
description: Besides the sun, the fireworks and the celebrations, there is also a grim tradition associated with the annual Fourth of July weekend holiday: As we count our nation's birthdays, we also count our traffic dead.

title: 6 Die in a Bombing Near Damascus School
description: DAMASCUS, Syria. July 4 (AP)A car apparently packed with explosives exploded today in the street between the Syrian Air Defense Command headquarters and the American School in Damascus, killing at least six persons and wounding 11, authorities and witnesses reported.

title: Common Market Boosts the Working Woman
description: WASHINGTONThe European working woman is beginning to demand her share of the economic pie. And the Common Market, the organization that binds nine western European countries together in an economic entity, is giving a helping hand. ference on equal pay and equal opportunity to be held next spring at Wellesley College.

title: Women's Meeting Friday in Albany Will Have a National Focus
description: The battle over two national issuesabortion and the equal rights amendment to the Constitutionshifts to Albany this weekend, where more than 3,000 persons are expected to attend the New York State Women's Meeting.

title: Thais and Malaysians Attack an Area Jointly
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, July 4 (AP) Thai and Malaysian aircraft bombed and strafed suspected Communist camps and hideouts in southern Thailand today five hours after about 4,000 Malaysian troops crossed into the area for joint military operations, security officials said.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: If you want to know all about the materials, tools and artistry that go into a fine bamboo fly rod, you cannot do better than to purchase A Master's Guide to a Bamboo Fly Rod by Everett Garrison and Hoagy B. Carmichael (Martha's Glen Publishing Company, Todd Road, Katonah, N.Y. 10536, 296 pages, illustrated, $20).

title: Changes by House in Energy Plan Seen Causing Deficit of $30 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, July 4Changes that House committees made in President Carter's energy plan over the last two weeks could produce $30 billion to $40 billion in additional budget deficits between now and 1985, according to Administration officials.

title: Forego, 138, Loses by Neck to Quiet Little Table, 114
description: Horse players received another major shock to their wallets yesterday when the great Forego was beaten at Belmont Park a day after Seattle Slew suffered a first defeat in California.

title: Rumania Tells of Outburst
description: VIENNA, July 4 (Reuters)Several persons died when thousands of angry Rumanian youths stormed an oversold pop concert and soccer match in a Bucharest stadium last month, the Rumanian Government news agency. Agerpress, said today. Informed sources said a policemen was one of those killed June 13 when thousands of teenagers attacked the police and caused serious damage after discovering that tickets had been sold well in excess of the 70,000 capacity.

title: High Winds Hit Wisconsin Woods;, Falling Tree Kills 5YearOld
description: PHILLIPS, Wis., July 4 (AP)High winds and driving rains hit the northwoods area of central Wisconsin today, killing a 5yearold girl and injuring perhaps scores of people, the authorities said.

title: No Excuses Given for Seattle Slew's Defeat
description: After the biggest bubble in racing had burst, with Seattle Slew finally beaten after nine straight scores, Billy Turner conceded yesterday that they had gambled once too often: We tried to carry the Impossible Dream one act too much.

title: ANALYSTS SEE GAINS BY RATES OVER LONG AND SHORT TERMS
description: Basically, said Joseph Bench, economist for the First Pennsylvania Corporation, we think short rates are going to be a lot higher and long rates a little higher.

title: TAXES FOUND CRUCIAL IN RISE IN LIVING COSTS
description: Rises in personal income taxes caused a major part of the increase in living costs last year in the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey metropolitan area, according to the latest budget calculations of the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: East Harlem Market Burns
description: A fire yesterday burned out the Middle structure of the five buildings of La Marqueta, a fiveblock group of stores on Park Avenue in East Harlem. Because the building that burned was under the Conrail tracks,.service on the tracks to. Grand Central Terminal was cut off for two hours starting at 10:30 A.M.

title: Report of Threats Denied
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 4A South Korean Cabinet member today denied charges that he had threatened Kim Hyung Wook, a former director of the South Korean Central Intelligence Agency, in warning him not to testify before a Congressional committee investigating tte lobbying scandal.

description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing First58,000,. cl., 3Y0., 6f Prob.

title: The Hijacker's Victims: Two Die, One Critical and One a Miracle
description: John Mctavern, the 51yearold head librarian at the University of Hartford, became the first victim of yesterday's bus hijacking when the hijacker shot him in the neck.

title: Events Today
description: AMERICA'S YOUTH IN CONCERT, Carnegie Hail, 1:30.

title: Kahane Calls Violence Necessary
description: SKOKIE, Ill., July 4Rabbi Meir Kahane told a rally here today that violence by Jews was necessary if the Nazi Party was to be destroyed.

title: jazz Picnic in Jersey Ranges From OldTime to SwingTime
description: WATERLOO VILLAGE, NJ., July 4For a second year, the Newport Jazz Festival reached out from its base in New York to the grounds of this restored colonial village during the holiday weekend. Yesterday, the New Jersey Jazz Society presented a Jazz Picnic that ranged, musically, from the oldtimev to the swingtimey.

title: 3,500 Teachers in New York City To Be Rehired for 197778 Year
description: After two years of dismissing teachers, the Board of Education in New York City plans to rehire for the September term more than 3,500 who were laid off as a result of the fiscal crisis.

title: Philadelphia Mezzo Wins Paris Contest
description: PARIS (AP)Katherine Ciensinski, 26yearold mezzosoprano from Philadelphia, has won the 11th International Singing Contest of Paris, gaining $4,000 prize.

title: Britain's Official Reserves in June Soared to a Record $11.57 Billion
description: LONDON, July 4 (AP)Britain's official reserves soared in June to a record $11.57 billion, the Treasury said today.

title: Y. & R. Is Setting Up New Brazilian Group
description: Now that it's winter in Rio (What a fetching introduction!) it is appropriate to announce that Young & Rubicam, the well known international advertising agency, is on the verge of forming a new Brazilian company that will be sort of a holding company. Sort of a Latin American Interpublico.

description: Yanks Drop Wynn And Add Alston

title: State Headquarters
description: Mary Burke Nicholas is chairman of the New York State Women's Meeting. Headquarters for the meeting until the conference begins in Albany this Friday are at 9 West 57th Street, 12th floor, New York, N.Y. 10019. Telephone (212) 5935516 or 9859931.

title: Lost Fly Ball Helps Mets Lose by 31
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 4A batted ball that started out as a high fly and wound up as a lost cause was the pivot of the Mets' latest traveling disaster tonight, and the major leagues' largest crowd of the season was at Veterans Stadium to watch the untidy results.

title: 3Alarmer Injures 13 Firemen In Bronx's Morris Heights Area
description: Thirteen firemen were injured yesterday in a threealarm fire on the top floor of a sixstory apartment house on Macombs Road, in the Morris Heights section of the Bronx.

title: Case of a Unique House and a Suit to Keep It That Way
description: DANVILLE, Calif.Last September, Robert and Judith Kretz moved into new house on Piedras Circle in White Gate, a development of expensive houses in this town east of San Francisco Bay. Their house, which was valued at about $250,000, looks fairly similar to many other houses in White Gate  comfortable, sprawling ranch houses of standard design, often fancied up with a few Spanish, Georgian or French details.

title: In Small Town, All Know How To Mark the 4th
description: LEBANON, N.J., July 4At precisely 8 o'clock this morning, volunteer fire trucks of this borough roared out of their station on Main Street, their sirens shattering the silence of a Warm summer day in the country, and telling everyone to get out of bed and prepare for the Fourth of July parade.

title: Meyer Liberman Jr. Weds Dr. Roni Cohen
description: Dr. Roni Olivia Cohen, a psychologist on the staff of the New York HospitalCornell Medical Center, was married yesterday to Meyer Liberman Jr., president of KLR International Inc New York tour operators. The ceremony was performed at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Koerner in Rye. N.Y., by Rabbi Peter Weintraub of Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Ethnicity Puts Holiday Roots Into Wall StreetArea Fair
description: Lower Manhattan teemed with the hungry, the curious, the friendly and, before it was over, the weary and the indigestive as the Fourth of July in Old New York/1977 celebration turned the Wall Street area into an ethnic cornucopia.

description: The bus had crashed through a metal fence near the Port Authority police building at the side of the main runway, then rolled along the runway to point near the T.W.A buildinE.

title: Bill Is Sent to Seoul Assembly Proposing Amnesty for Dissidents
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 4Opposition and proGovernment legislators submitted a bill to the National Assembly today asking the Government to pardon imprisoned dissidents and religious leaders.

title: A Pizza Parlor's David Is Snub to Philistines
description: A touch of Italy in downtown Glens Falls, N.Y., was all Lorenzo Amato had in mind when he installed a fivefoot copy of Michelangelo's David outside his pizza parlor in May.

title: BUS HIJACKER SEIZED AT KENNEDY AIRPORT AFTER HE SLAYS TWO
description: A Vermontbound bus carrying a score of passengers was diverted from the Bronx to Kennedy International Airport yesterday by a gunman who shot and killed two hostages, wounded at least two others, rode wildly around on the runways and held off the police in a tense siege that continued until 11:33 P.M., when the gunman was captured. His 11 remaining hostages were freed unharmed, the police said.

title: Wall St. Expects A Summer Rally In Stock Prices
description: The professionals on Wall Street who usually predict a summer rally are anticipating another one this yearwhich should bring joy to harried tapewatchers who have been suffering from declining prices through most of 1977's first half.

title: About Newyork
description: Roosevelt Island had been theirs for years, theirs to claim in shadowy preeminence from the windows of their hospital wards looking out on the lively city across the water. And so it is a matter of justice now to see the quadriplegics moving out of the hospital and going down the road in powered wheelchairs to their new homes in the pleasant apartment village of Roosevelt Island being newly settled by all sorts of people from across the water.

title: The Residents of Lebanon Know How to Serve Up a July Fourth
description: LEBANON, July 4  At precisely 8 o'clock this morning, volunteer fire trucks of this borough roared out of their station on Main Street, their sirens shattering the silence of a warm summer day in the country, and telling everyone to get out of bed and Prepare for the Fourth of July.parade.
