title: Mabel Greene Bean, 79
description: Mabel Greene Bean, a feature writer and fashion editor of The New York Sun. died of cancer yesterday in the Ozanam Hall Nursing Home in Bayside, Queens, at the age of 79. She was the widow of Edgar R. Bean, who was acting managing editor of The Daily News when he died in 1942.

title: Young Says Most Cabinet Members Want U.S. to Remain in the ILO.
description: GENEVA, July 4 (UPI)Most members of President Carter's Cabinet want the United States to remain a member of the International Labor Organization, Andrew Young said today.

title: The New York Times/Larry Morris
description: GRAND FINALE TO PORT FESTIVAL: View from R.C.A. Building of wireworks bursting over Hudson River. Harbor Festival 77 included Sunfish sailing race, air display and Battery Park July 4th festival on final day. PageThe final day of the city's Harbor Festival 77 began yesterday morning with tiny multicolored sailboats scurrying about the base of the Statue of Liberty, and wound up last night with one mile of swirling, exploding fireworks 1,000 feet above the Hudson and with exuberant, extemporaneous bursts of rockets and flares all over the city.

title: Texas Rangers Owner Says He Is Selling Out
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., July 4 (AP)Brad Corbett, the owner of the Texas Rangers said tonight that he intends to sell his majority interest in the American League team.

title: CABINET REFLECTS FIRST SUAREZ YEAR
description: MADRID, July 4Prime Minister Adolto Suarez tonight unveiled his postelection Cabinet, whose makeup was a mixture of the continuity and reformism that has characterized his year in office.

title: Market Place
description: Those who would buy shares in a mutual fund designed to reflect the ups and downs of leading market averages may first wish to reflect on the success such a fund would have had in the last six months.

title: 3 Mauritanian Soldiers Are Hurt In a Guerrilla Attack on Capital
description: NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, July 4 (AP) A guerrilla attack here last night left three soldiers injured and caused some slight damage to buildings, residents reported today.

title: Deaths
description: ARONOFFAttie (nee Appleton), beloved wife of Max, devoted mother of Tulle, Jonah and Roselle Buchan, loving grandmother of five grandchildren. Services today, 9:30 A.M., at Hirsch's, 167th St, and Jerome Ave., Bronx. Shiva will be observed at 460 Audubon Ave., Apt. A7.

title: Antwerp'sRubensCelebrationProves Impressive Tribute to Man and Artist
description: Rubens has one of the great utddterable reputations. As painter, draftsman, decorator and diplomat, he was regarded during his lifetime as one of the most remarkable men who ever lived, and for once posterity has, if anything, reinforced that judgment. No negotiation could be called hopeless while Rutiens was engaged upon it. No or could touch him when it came to the ennoblement in paint of thoughts that in themselves were quite commonplace: Hurry back! for one and Look What I Shot Today! for another. And when it came to an allegorical scheme that looked to be half as long as a city block, it often seemed as if Jupiter himself had come down the chimney and insisted on guiding the brush. Rubens at top form had no equal.

title: Puzzlemaker or Titan?
description: I have never seen a more lucid, more lonely, better balanced mad mind than mine, Vladimir Nabokov said of himself with typical perverse.elegance. But other opinions varied. To some he seemed decadent: They would say of his writing what Humbert Humbert said of his own story: It has bits of An marrow sticking to it, and Appraisal blood, and beautiful brightgreen flies. To others Mr. Nabokov was an endlessly diverting puzzlemaker. And to a majority of critics and an increasing number of scholars now mining his work, he was a literary titan equal in stature to Kafka, Proust, Mann and Joyce.

title: Sadat Welcomes Proposal On Resuming Geneva Talks
description: CAIRO, July 4 (AP)President Anirar clSadat of Egypt has indicated a willingness to accept a reported offer by Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel to reconvene the Geneva conference on peace in the Middle East in October, the Cairo radio said today.

title: Quick Card Triumphs
description: CHICAGO, July 4 (AP)Quick Card, owned by John. M. Schiff of New York, closed with a rush today to win the $59,400 Stars and Stripet Handicap before a crowd of 21,849 at Arlington Park..

title: 16 Killed in Brazil Air Crash
description: BRASILIA, July 4 (AP)A Brazilian Air Force passenger plane crashed shortly after takeoff yesterday from an airport in Natal in northeast Brazil, killing 16 persons, the air force announced today. The plane was taking off for Rio de Janeiro.

title: Yugoslav Town Struck by Quake
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, July 5 (UPI)A moderately strong earthquake struck the town of Kragujevac early today, driving residents into the streets. The Belgrade seismological station said the quake struck at 6:51 A.M. and measured 4.5 degrees on the 12degree Mercalli scale, corresponding to 3.3 on the openended Richter scale.

title: Events Today
description: Films

title: Time and BookoftheMonth Club Disclose an Agreement to Merge
description: The BookoftheMonth Club and Time Inc. announced yesterday that they had agreed to merge.

title: AntiMonopoly Games Destroyed After Suit
description: MANKATO, Minn., July 5 (UPI)Parker Brothers, which markets the game of Monopoly, supervised the dumping of at least 7,000 AntiMonoploy games and materials at a landfill here today.

title: Hanafi Hostage Reported Shot at a Close Range
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (UPI)A police firearms expert told the Hanafi Moslem murderkidnapping trial today that a shotgun blast that left a hostage at the District Building paralyzed was fired from a range of six feet or less.

title: Holiday Death Toll
description: The state police reported that seven persons were killed in six accidents on Jersey highways over the threeday Fourth of July weekend. Five persons drowned during the weekend. Last year, the police said, 18 persons died in 16 crashes during the Independence Day weekend.

title: Iraq Is Passing Up 5% Rise in Oil Price
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, July 5, (Reuters)Iraq has decided to forgo a 5 percent increase in the price of crude oil scheduled for July 1, the Iraq press agency said today.

title: PROTESTANT GROUPS ARE STUDYING MERGER
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The 1.8millionmember United Church of Christ gave the Protestant unity movement renewed hope here today in the final hours of its fiveday, biennial general synod.

title: Argentina Has Not Agreed To Extradite Nazi Suspect
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 5 (AP)The military Goverment said today that it had not agreed to extradite a German accused of Nazi war crimesa day after issuing a statement sarvine it would do so.

title: Wine Talk
description: FIVE years ago this week, the first Wine Talk appeared in this newspaper. The column has not changed much but the world of wine has.

title: Turkish Islamic Faction Offers Aid to Demirel
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 5 (Reuters)Former Prime Minister Suleyman Demirel, trying to form a new government, was offered support today from the party that holds the balance of power in the divided Parliament.

title: And Now the Sunday Green Laws
description: And God blessed the seventh day and sanctified it because that in it He had rested from all His work except for the sale of food arid foodstuffs, drugs, medicine, health and beauty aids, gasoline, auto parts and accessories, sporting goods and recreational equipment.

title: Impresions of Cuba, Photo Display, to Open
description: Seven American photographers who spent three week in Cuba last March, will show their pictures in Impressions of Cuba, an exhibition that will run from July 21 to Aug. 31 at the Gallery of the Parsons School, 2 West 13th Street.

title: Notes on People
description: THE general who earned PresPresident Carter's wrath and an official dressingdown in the Oval Office for his remarks about United States plans in Korea assumed his new assignment yesterday as the thirdranking officer in the Army's largest command. I'm very pleased to be back in Georgia, said Maj. Gen. John K. Singlaub, explaining that he began his active duty career in Georgia 35 years ago. He will be stationed as chief of staff of the Army Forces Command at Fort MacPherson, near Atlanta. Late last May he was called to.

title: Futures Prices Of Corn Climb; Soybeans Slide
description: CHICAGO, July 5 (AP)Corn futures prices were sharply higher on the Chicago Board of Trade today, some advancing to the daily allowable limit, as hot, dry weather blanketed the Middle West at a crucial time for corn crop development.

title: Technology
description: A controversial inventor from Michigan, Stanford Ovshinsky, announced at a scientific conference in Edinbugh last week and a news conference in London yesterday a technical advance he asserted could dramatically reduce the cost of electricitygenerating solar cells.

title: 12 Tall Ships Will Race To Newport This Week
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 5 (UPI) Twelve big sailing vessels will race from New York to Newport this weekend in a sprint reminiscent of last year's EnglandtoUnited States Tall Ships race.

title: For One Author, Rebirth in Georgetown
description: WASHINGTON IT APPEARS to be a rather simple, twostory townhouse perched on the sidewalk of a narrow Georgetown street. But when one walks through the door, it is another world of peach and tangerines and shades of cocoa, opening to a spectacular vista of a fourstoried, glassenclosed rear addition with decks and balconies at each level and a 40foot spiral staircase overlooking the everchanging panorain of the otomae River.

title: TEXAS JUDGE TELLS ABOUT WRONGDOING
description: AUSTIN, Tex., July 5Justice Donald B. Yarbrough of the State Supreme Court, who was indicted last week on perjury and forgery charges, called newsmen to his chambers today to confess his wrongdoing. The conference preceded an announcement that the Texas House of Representatives would meet to consider his removal.

title: ROLLIN C. BUSH
description: Rollin C. Bush, a securities specialist, died yesterday at his Princeton, N.J., home. He was 65 years old.

title: Experiments in Cooperation Of Workers and Management
description: WASHINGTONWith much groaning of governmental gears, the Carter Administration and Congress are slowly fitting together their designs for federally financed experiments in labormanagement cooperation to give workers a greater voice in the conduct, efficiency and preservation of their jobs. No one in the White House or on Capitol Hill is thinking in terms of any fundamental restructueng of industrial authority along the lines of the codetermination systems that guarantee employees representation on the top policymaking boards of West European corporations.

title: Loopholes Found in U.S. Disability Pension Plan
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (AP)A former Federal clerk, drawing a pension because he was classified as totally disabled, opened a jiujitsu school and was allowed to keep his Government stipend.

title: Mental Hygiene Measure Gaining
description: ALBANY, July 5Legislation to reshape the state's vast Department of Mental Hygienestalled since the beginning of the session because of conflicting demands of special interestshas been worked out and legislative leaders, once doubtful that any reorganization could be accomplished this year, are hopeful now of quick approval.

title: Abdullah's Party Adds to Majority In Capture of Kashmir Elections
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir, July 5 (Reuters) Sheik Mohammed Abdullah's National Conference Party consolidated its sweeping election victory in the sensitive state of Kashmir as more results were announced today.

title: Foreign Stock Tables Updated
description: The New York Times has updated the listing in its Foreign Stock Exchange tables, effective today, to incorporate stocks of current interest. The number of quotations for the Japanese issues has been increased, for example, while the number of London quotations has been reduced.

title: Jump Horse Falls, Snaps Leg in Race
description: Wing Commandbr, the favorite in the first steeplechase race of the thoroughbred season, suffered multiple fractures of the left knee yesterday when he failed to clear the 10th hurdle in the fourth race at Belmont Park. He was immediately operated At the on by Dr. William Reed at his hospital near the track Race in Elmont, L.I. The 5yearTracks old horse slid onto his left shoulder and pinned the leg of Jonathan Ruhsam, his rider, underneath.

title: 553 Died on Highways Over Holiday Weekend
description: The National Safety Council said that 553 persons died cn the nation's highways over the threeday Fourth of July weekend, 90 more than died in the like holiday period a year ago, The Associated Press reported yesterday.

title: International
description: Pakistan's army, having seized power in a bloodless coup, imposed martial law and promised new elections in October, The chief of staff, Gen, Mohammad Zia ulHaq, announced the end of the regime of Prime Minister Zulfika Ali Bhutto in a nationwide broadcast. The army acted to end four months of political violence that took more than 300 lives. A military spokesman said Mr. Bhutto, his Cabinet ministers and leaders of the opposition Pakistan National Alliance had been taken into temporary protective custody. General Zia said he was taking over as chief martial law administrator but that President Zazal Elahi Chaudhry would remain head of state and that the 1973 constitution would remain in effect.. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: World Team Tennis
description: LAST NIGHT'S MATCHES Nev York 30, Golden Gate 16. Boston 29, Indiana 16.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article in The Times last Thursday on a challenge to the renewal of licenses for a number of radio stations based on alleged underemployment of women and minorities, it was reported that the McGrawHill broadcast headquarters in New York had been named in the complaint. The complaint against McGrawHill was withdrawn, with apologies, tartly after it was filed.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: LIBRARY FUNDS GROW: Barbara Thiele, director Franklin Lakes Free Library with George Voss, right, the cochairman of a furniture fund drive, and Bob Thornton, community relations manager at IBM, whose office products division made a grant to the fund. The new building, under construction in background, is three times the size of the previous library. It is, hoped that donations from the community will enable it to open in time for school.

title: INDUSTRIALIZED NATIONS TRAIL U.S. ECONOMIC RISE
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (AP)Economic growth in the rest of the industrialized world continues to trail the strong growth of the United States economy, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Christians Report Israeli Plan to Push Into South Lebanon
description: BEIRUT Lebanon, July 5Christian sources said today that Israel was preparing for a military operation in southern Lebanon to drive Palestinian guerrillas out of the area.

title: Puerto Rico Telephone Names Salomon as Agent
description: Salomon Brothers, the international investment banking firm, has been appointed by the Puerto Rico Telephone Authority as its financial consultant and sales agent in connection with the sale of the Puerto Rico Telephone Company. The company, now owned and operated by the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, was acquired from the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation in 1974. On April 5, Carlos Romero Barcelo, Governor of the Commonwealth, signed a law authorizing the return of the telephone system to private ownership.

title: Consolidated Foods Offer
description: The Consolidated Foods Corporation said it had offered to buy 65 percent of the stock in Douwe Egberts, of Utrecht, the Netherlands, a coffee, tea and tobacco company. Consolidated said its cash offer, contingent on obtaining more than 50 percent of outstanding shares, called for a maximum investment of $156 million.

title: The New York Times/Paul Hosefros
description: At Kennedy Airport, a workman tries to straighten out fender of police van that crashed into the hijacked bus Monday night, forcing it to a halt.

title: 924th Cosmos Satellite Launched
description: MOSCOW, July 5 (Reuters)The Soviet Union launched the 924th satellite in its Cosmos series into orbit around the earth today. Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Newport Dances Off The Scene
description: THE NEWPORTNew York Jazz Festival's Farewell Dance, held, as in previous years, at Rose land on the Fourth of July, could have taken on a poignant tone, because the festival is officially moving to Saratoga Springs, N.Y., next summer. But there will still be a jazz festival during the same period, and apparently it Will be more or less the same as NewsportNew York. There will still be, it is to be hoped, a farewell dance. In any event, this one was anything but poignant.

title: A Table at Joe's
description: SO STRONG is tradition in the Italian neighborhood in which I live, around Houston Street and Avenue of the Americas in Greenwich Village; that there is still a sign at the southeast corner of Houston and Macdougal that says, Biaggi For Mayor.

title: In Memoriam
description: COHENDavid. 11 years today. Beloved. husband of the late Rose Cohen. Devoted father of the late Sylvia Mint??? zer and Mildred Malin. Dear grandfather of Lewis and Stephen Malin. and Freya Mintzer. You are always, and forever in our hearts.

title: Pakistan at a Glance
description: HISTORYThe region that Is now Pakistan has been plagued by strife and violence. It was fought over by Arabs, Greeks, Persians, Turks and other invaders before coming under British control in 1800's. When the British Indian Empire was granted independence, it was partitioned, on religious grounds, into two nations, India, which was mostly Hindu, and Pakistan which was mostly Moslem. Communal fighting erupted, and according to some accounts, one million people were killed. Pakistan was made up of two sections, Fast Pakistan and West Pakistan.

title: EGYPTIANS WHO ABDUCTED EXAIDE TRY TO KILL POLICE
description: CAIRO, July 5 (Reuters)Moslem extremists tried to lure the police into boobytrapped apartment by telling them the body of a kidnapped former Cabinetminister was there, police sources said today.

title: Flaccid Camp
description: STAGE BLOOD, written and directed by Charles Ludlam. Setting by Bobjack Coileio; lighting by Richard Currie; costumes and graphics by Arthur Brady; production stage manager, Richard Gibbs. Presented by the Ridiculous Theatrical Company. At the Truck and Warehouse Theater, 79 East Fourth Street.

title: Fisher Calls L.I.R.R. the Best, But Riders Beg to Differ
description: Long Island Rail Road commuters, accustomed as they are to vicissitudes of service, were startled the other evening at Penn Station to hear the disembodied voice of the public address system announce scattered delays due to lost air.

title: Bridge:
description: About 8 percent of the members of the Greater New York Bridge Association have reached the lofty rank of life master. For the remaining 92 percent, struggling to join the minority, the prestige event each year is the Harter Cup, a double knockout team contest that is spread over a ninemonth period.

title: Mismanagement of the City's School System
description: To the Editor. The continuing revelations of waste running into millions of dollars due to the mismanagement of the public school system make this a matter of the gravest importance. The urgent need for reorganization is clear.

title: Says He's Sorry for Those on Bus Who Were Slain
description: Luis Robinson, a 26yearold Panamanian enlisted man in the United States Navy charged with hijacking a bus to Kennedy International Airport and killing two hostages during a 10hour chase and siege was remanded yesterday to Kings County Hospital for psychiatric examination.

title: New Bond Issues
description: UTILITY BONDS

title: Employers Told to Hire Alcoholics And Drug Abusers Able to Work
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The Labor Department directed employers with Federal contracts today to take affirmative action to hire alcoholics and drug abusers, provided they are able to perform their work.

title: Of Walks and Water and Tokens of Love
description: One night recently, Anton Griscom was ambling along Madison Avenue. Anton Griscom's real name is Antoinette, just so you know.

title: League Leaders
description: By The Associated Press

title: 2 From Connecticut Hurt in Fall
description: LOURDES, France, July 5 (Reuters)Two students from Stafford, Conn., were injured in a fall today while climbing the 3,900foot high Pic du Pebeste near here, the police said. The students were identified as William Tosteam, 18 years old, and Patrick Debroux, 20. They were flown by helicopter to a hosiptal.

title: The Standings
description: Wednesday, July 6, 1977

title: What to Do About Woes in the Woods
description: Planning a camping trip this year? Or a weekend hike in the mountains? If so, and particularly if you're a novice at that sort of thing, you'll want to pack along the answers to some tough questions, the kind that begin with What if

title: Maddox Associate Given Probation
description: Lester G. Maddox's Vice Presidential running mate on the 1976 American Party's New Jersey ticket was sentenced to three years probation yesterday for Federal income tax evasion.

title: Beame Calls for Tougher Laws On Death Penalty and On Paroles
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that he favored the death penalty for certain types of murder and the abolition of parole for l convicted felons.

title: DISCOVERIESI
description: Hang It All

title: S.E.C. Alleges Allied Chemical Kickbacks
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (UPI)The Allied Chemical Corporation allowed Canadian and European subsidiaries to kick back more than $4 million to foreign customers over a fiveyear period, previously secret government records showed today.

title: BANK LANCE HEADED HAS FIRSTHALF LOSS ON PROBLEM LOANS
description: DIVIDENDS TO BE CUT OR ENDED National of Georgia Sees Serious Deterioration in Some Credits but Stresses Strength.

title: Chess:
description: One strategic conflict that is sure to produce exciting difficult play whenever it arises is that between superior pawn play and allowing the opponent to exchange off your best minor piece.

title: U.S. Affirms Its Opposition
description: WASHINGTON, July 5A State Department spokesman said today that the United States remained opposed to premature entry into a plutoniumbased nuclear energy economy despite the steps taken in Western Europe.

title: Claridge Hotel Sale Offers Memorabilia
description: ATLANTIC CITY, July 5 (UPI)The Claridge Hotel is inviting prospective buyers to inspect hotel furnishings for three days beginning tomorrow, in hopes that they will be ready for the goods at auction Saturday.

title: Albany Education Head Says Goal Is the Improvement of City Pupils
description: ALBANY, July 5Gordon M. Ambach, the new State Education Commissioner, said today that the top priority of his administration would be the improvement of student performance in the New York City public schools.

title: Carter Reported To Plan to Name Woman to S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The White House has decided to nominate Roberta S. Karmel as the first woman to serve on the Securities and Exchange Commission, Administration sources said. The decision was made today, they added, but is not expected to be announced for about three weeks.

title: Review of CampaignFinance Rule Is Sought by ElectionLaw Panel
description: TRENTON, July 5The State Election Law Enforcement Commission decided today to ask the New Jersey Supreme Court to review an Appellate Court decision that could make fundraising more difficult for the state's gubernatorial candidates.

title: GERSH BUDKER DEAD; TOP SOVIET PHYSICIST
description: Gersh L Budker, widely regarded as among the most innovative designers of highenergy physics experiments, has died in the Soviet Union at the age of 59, according to a report by the Soviet press agency Tass.

title: Bail Set in Queens Attacks
description: Justice John J. Leahy of State Supreme Court in Queens, set $20,000 bail for Kenneth Herman, a 21yearold member of the Queens College basketball team accused of sexual attacks on six teenaged boys. Mr. Herman, of 3240 89th Street in Jackson Heights, was arrested June 16 near a Forest Hills youth center for allegedly menacing a 14yearold boy with a knife.

title: National
description: President Carter told his energy adviser, James R. Schlesinger, to prepare a comprehensive standby gasoline rationing proposal for presentation shortly to Congress, according to an Administration source. They met as White House and Congressional officials raised the possibility that Congress might not complete action on Mr. Carter's energy package until its next session beginning in January. His action on gasoline was apparently not linked to the reported slippage in Congressional action on energy. An Administration source said Mr. Schlesinger had been asked to prepare to cope with a reduction of probably 25 percent in gasoline consumption in an emergency such as a new foreign embargo or a disruption of the sea lanes. [A1:1.]

title: Walking Tall
description: In New York where the sidewalks are playgrounds and the parks serve also as beaches, dog litter is a health problem, not just an Inconvenience. Knowing this, the State Legislature has moved in where City Hall has long feared to tread and passed a law to force dog owners in New York City and in Buffalo to clean up what their pets leave behind. (Had the city of Buffalo not been added to the bill, the New York City Council would have had to pass on it under the homerule requirement.)

title: FORMER AIDE AT PAN AM IS INDICTED FOR FRAUD
description: William E. Hasenstab, a former office supply supervisor for Pan American Word Airways Inc., was indicted yesterday on charges that he had accepted $45,000 in secret cash kickbacks from a company that supplied Pan Am with computer paper and other paper products.

title: Cromartie and Zisk Voted Tops for Week
description: Warren Cromartie of the Montreal Expos has been selected National League player of the week for the period ending July 4. The Expos outfielder batted 432 for the week with 16 hits in 37 times at bat, including six extrabase hits.

title: Gunman, Always a Loner, Fed Up With Life
description: A loner with an excellent mind, a black man obsessed with racism, a dutiful son, a failed scholarship student and a former psychiatric patient  those are some of the available pieces that make up Luis Robinson's troubled life.

title: State Wins Suit in Deaths
description: The Appellate Division of Superior Court ruled that the parents of two men who drowned in Round Valley Reservoir in Hunterdon County cannot sue: the state.

title: Suit by U.S. Seeks to Bar Babock & Wilcox Takeover
description: The Department of Justice, in its biggest antitrust challenge in any years, filed a suit yesterday to block the $510 million takeover of the Babcock & Wilcox Company by the United Technologies Corporation.

title: The New York Times/Larry Morrls
description: Freed hostages boarding a car at Kennedy airport early yesterday after their ordeal ended

title: Judge Demands A Parking Plan Within 10 Days
description: A Federal judge yesterday gave New York City 10 days to come up with specific plans to carry out a controversial parking ban aimed at combating air pollution in Manhattan.

title: Books of The Times
description: STUDENTS of Soviet affairs often comment on the remarkable continuity in Russian life, whether under czars or commisars. Then and now, ordinary people have shown a characteristically patient endurance in the face of adversity; then and now, foreigners have been treated with a paradoxical mixture of suspicion and privilege.

title: Quiet Tourist Refuge Is Suddenly Brazil's Nuclear Capital
description: ANGRA DOS REIS, BrazilThe stunning scenery that surrounds this historic colonial port town, which is crammed between lush green mountains and the tranquil sea of Brazil's South Atlantic coast, has always been nnp of its major attractions.

title: Lewis. Mumford I.emembers
description: AMEN1A, N.Y. IN a frame house on a country lane, far from the cities that so intrigued him as a younger man, Lewis Mumford lives with his wife, Sophia, and cultivates his garden. He also does what he has been doing for a lot more than half a century reading, writing and letting his mind range where it will, without regard to fashion or disciplinary boundaries, touching now on philosophy, now on urban planning, art, architecture, cultural history, literature.

title: A Time of Plenty Home Canning Heyday
description: WITH GARDENS fairly bursting with the good produce of summer, what this country needs is good book on home canning and preserving. What this country soon will have is the 30th edition of what I consider the definitive work, the bible canning and preserving for home kitchens.

title: Alaska Pipeline Shut Down By Faulty Plug and Leak
description: ANCHORAGE, July 5 (AP)The $7.7 billion transAlaska pipeline has been shut down, the result of a glas leak apparently caused by failure of a 1inch drain plug.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: George J. Keegan Jr., former chief of Air Force intelligence, is executive vice president of the United States Strategic Institute, a private organization.

title: White Foes of Smith Oppose Black Rule Now
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, July 5(AP)Twelve white legislators who split with Prime Minister Ian D. Smith to form a new rightwing party said today they envisioned a multiracial government for Rhodesia in the future, but completely reject the principle of black majority rule at this stage.

title: Mets Records
description: BATTING

title: U.S. Says Company Mislabeled Its Fish
description: Federal lawyers have charged that the Carnation Seafood Inc., of Magnolia, Mass., has been mislabeling fiveounce packages of frozen fish fillets in court papers filed in Brooklyn on July 1. The papers moved to impound 550 pounds of the fillets.

title: British Open to Tee Off With Nicklaus Favored
description: TURNBERRY, Scotland, July 5Now that the tennis action at Wimbledon has settled down to the growing of grass, it is golf's turn the 1974 United States Open champion, and Ben Crenshaw, 16 to 1.

title: Gunman, Always a Loner, Fed. Up With Life
description: A loner with an excellent mind, a black man obsessed with racism, a dutiful son, a failed scholarship student and a former psychiatric patient  those are some of the available pieces that make up Luis Robinson's troubled life.

title: Cubs Lose Again
description: Herman Franks, the manager of the slumping Chicago Cubs, is an optimist either that or he's whistling in the dark.

title: MICHAEL DOMINICO
description: Michael Dominico, a dancersingeractor, died yesterday at Veterans Hospital in Buffalo after a long illness. He was 48 years old.

title: VATICAN URGES HELP FOR CHURCH SCHOOLS
description: ROME, July 5The Vatican for the first time called today for government financial support of the world's Roman Catholic schools.

title: M.A.C. Acts to Sell Bonds to Public
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation has proposed a $2.5 billion refinancing of outstanding city and M.A.C. securities held by the major banks and municipal pension fundsa step designed to ease the city's budget problems and speed its ability to sell its own securities to the public for the first time since 1975.

title: Scientists Seek to Influence Legislation on Gene Research
description: WASHINGTON, July 5Scientists and their organizations are making a strong effort to influence pending legislation under which the Federal Government would, for the first time, regulate an important field of basic biological research.

title: Chilean Jet Hijacked And Diverted to Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, July 5 (UPI)Four Chileans hijacked a domestic Chilean jetliner to Lima today and surrendered and released their 60 hostages for the promise of political asylum in the Venezuelan Embassy.

title: National
description: President Carter told his energy adviser, James R. Schlesinger, to prepare a comprehensive standby gasoline rationing proposal for presentation shortly to Congress, according to an Administration source. They met as White House and Congressional officials raised the possibility that Congress might not complete action on Mr. Carter's energy package until its next session beginning in January. His action on gasoline was apparently not linked to the reported slippage in Congressional action on energy. An Administration source said Mr. Schlesinger had been asked to prepare to cope with a reduction of probably 25 percent in gasoline consumption in an emergency such as a new foreign embargo or a disruption of the sea lanes. [A1:1]

title: Best Buys
description: THIS IS THE time of year that fosters belief in the existence a character named Al Fresco. His avocation is outdoor cook ing. His vocation is arranging meat sales.

title: A Lazy Bus Trip on the 4th of July That Became 10 Hours of Terror
description: The following article was written by Maurice Carroll with the assistance of E. J. Dionne Jr., Charles Kaiser, Pranay Gupte and Emanuel Perlmutter.

title: Head of Martial Law in Pakistan
description: Led the coup that toppled government of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto  a short, dapper, cavalry officer, described by a senior Pakistani diplomat as a very professional person, with no sort of political vices  very much a technical man

title: People in Sports
description: While this decision is probably the toughest one I ever had to make, I decided to stay at Louisville. So said Denny Crum yesterday in announcing he had turned down the offer to return to his alma mater, the University of California, Los Angeles, as bead basketball coach. Thirigs that were instrumental were my love for the state of Kentucky, the city of Louisville and the University of Louisville, but most of all, the love for the people and fans of Louisville.

title: Letters
description: The Ice Cream Junkie

title: Britons Accept Suspension to Avoid Handling a Struck Company's Mail
description: LONDON, July 5Post Office workers chose to be suspended without pay today rather than handle mail for a private company that is in a bitter dispute over union recognition.

title: Trudeau Willing to Consider Aid For Canada's Language Minorities
description: OTTAWA, July 5  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, declaring in the Parliament that the country's integrity has come under severe threat from proindependence forces in Quebec Province, said today that his Government was willing to consider constitutional changes, among other measures, to advance the cultural aspirations of the disaffected Frenchspeaking minorities in predominantly Englishspeaking provinces.

title: Technology
description: Stanford Ovshinsky, a controversial inventor from Michigan, has announced a technical advance that he said could reduce the cost of solar cells. The reported advance is an increased ability to alter the chemical composition of socalled amorphous materials. Page D5.

title: All of Washington Is Writing Books About All of Washington
description: WASHINGTON PEOPLE AROUND town are employing a new gambit for awkward lulls in cocktail and dinnertable conversations. They simply ask, And how is the book coming?

title: Sonatrach Signs Contracts With European Gas Units
description: Ruhrgas AG, Salzgitter Fernagas AG, and NV Nederlandse Gasunie have signed contracts with the stateowned Sonatrach of Algeria for delivery of liquefied natural gas over a 20year period beginning in 1984, Ruhrgas announced in Essen, West Germany. The contracts call for delivery of liquefied natural gas currently valued at $3.4 billion.

title: Careers
description: A former teacher, a housewife and a former brokerage firm clerk all have careers in a new field after completing a training program at New York University for medical assistants.

title: Changing The Way We Play
description: LOS ANGELES FRIDAY AFTERNOON arrives, and whether it is the Long Island Expressway or the Hollywood Freeway, the queues of outbound cars these days soon become as solid, and seemingly as mobile, as a glacier.

title: Pakistan's Military Takes Over
description: Military takeovers of civilian governments are never a cause for rejoicing. But in Pakistan, the Government of Prime Minister Zulfikar All Bhutto that was overthrown on Monday had itself become increasingly dependent upon armed force to retain power. The new interim Executive Government of Gen. Mohammad Zia ulHaq says that it seized power only to assure free and fair elections next October.

title: Gabon Puts On a Show of Pomp for Top Africans
description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon, July 5 Twentythree African heads of state, numerous government representatives and leaders of many competing liberation movements were welcomed to their summit meeting here with a pomp seldom seen anywhere on this continent.

title: Yachts at Record Pace In Race to Honolulu
description: LOS ANGELES, July 5 (UPI)The six leaders in the 2,225mile Los AngelesHonolulu yacht race got the benefit of brisk winds today and reported averages of better than 200 miles a day, which could mean a new elapsedtime record.

title: Looking Up
description: Before last year's Bicentennial, the Fourth of July was a time of sullen heat and the sputter of occasional illegal firecrackers in a joyless city from which everyone who could manage it would flee. What New Yorkers learned from the Bicentennial and remembered this year was not only how to celebrate the holiday but also how to celebrate their city. As they watched the sailboats on the rivers, or the fireworks that framed both shores, they discovered Manhattan as an island. People flocked to the tops of skyscrapers for the spectacular views. They rode on ferries and walked and sat at the water's edge.

title: Wave Wipes Out Controversy
description: LONG BEACH, L.I., July 5A controversy over the legality and esthetics of a sexually segregated beach in this City was settledat least temporarilyover the Fourth of July weekend.

title: No R.I.P. for the C.E.Q.
description: Citizens who are most concerned with protection of the American environment are rightly disturbed by a threat to the. Council on Environmental Quality. President Carter's reorganization crew is about to submit a list of options that includes a proposal to transfer the council's major functions  and perhaps the council itself  to other agencies of government.

title: CARTER SAID TO ORDER A STANDBY PROPOSAL TO RATION GASOLINE
description: WASHINGTON, July 5  President Carter met today with James R. Schlesinger, his energy adviser, and ordered the preparation of a comprehensive, standby gasoline rationing proposal to be presented soon to Congress, according to an Administration source.

title: Streets Open Avenues of Imagination for Games
description: Dennis the Menace, John Tricoche of South Brooklyn was explaining with patience, is a very simple game, sort of like hideandseek backwards.

title: 18,000 State Employees Strike in Wisconsin
description: MADISON, Wis., July 5 (AP)Thousands of state office workers joined an illegal public employees strike today, but public safety was largely unaffected as nearly all state police reported for work and National Guardsmen were on duty at prisons and mental hospitals.

title: SADAT PARLEY STAND IS GREETED BY BEGIN
description: TEL AVIV, July 5Prime Minister Menahem Begin today welcomed a statement by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt accepting an Israeli proposal to convene the Middle East peace talks at Geneva in October.

title: Preserving Foods Safely
description: HOME CANNING has become a big American business, not just among farm familieswho have traditionally put, up homegrown fruits and vegetables for yearround consumptionbut also among urbanites and suburbanites with access to backyard gardens, pickityourself fields and orchards or baskets of produce purchased from the local market.

title: Injuries to Pele and Beckenbauer Are Threatening Cosmos Lineup
description: While the Cosmos practiced on the burning AstroTurf at Giants Stadium yesterday, Pele and Franz Beckenbauer spent the morning In the trainer's room, each nursing a groin muscle pull and questionable for tonight's North American Soccer League game agairist San Jose.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: Widespread numbers of resident Greek nationalseven during the period when Nasser was chasing tens of thousands of the latter from Egypt.

title: Business / Finance
description: The biggest antitrust challenge in many years was filed by the Department of Justice to block the takeover of the Babcock & Wilcox Company by. United Technologies Corporation for $510 million. The diversified aerospace company was accused of embarking on course that might substantially reduce competition or tend to create monopoly. (D1:56.)

title: Johannes U. Hoeber; Had a Long Career In Social Programs
description: Johannes U. Hoeber, one of the founding members of the Americans for Democratic Action who also served with the Agency for International Development in directing its programs for refugees and social welfare activities in South Vietnam, died. June 26 at his home in Washington. He was 72 years old.

title: Most Antinuclear Demonstrators Released From Jail in Tacoma
description: TACOMA, Wash., July 5 (AP)Most of 29 persons arrested for allegedly trespassing on the Trident submarine base were released today, but at least one refused to leave jail, the authorities said.

title: Stage: TwoWay Hamlet Parody
description: STAGE BLOOD is a parody of Hamlet, and of itself making a parody of Hamlet. It is sporadically amusing, deliberately flaccid and tediously and unsparingly campedup.

title: Rumania Backs Autonomy Of West Europe's Reds
description: VIENNA, July 5 (Reuters)The Rumanian Communist Party today issued spirited defense of independence for Western Europe's Conununist parties in disagreement with Soviet views.

title: Doubling of Water Called Possible in Great Basin
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (AP)The United States Geological Survey reports that the use of underground water could be more than doubled in the droughtplagued Great Basin region of Nevada and Utah.

title: Chinese Speaks Firmly To Zumwalt About Taiwan
description: HONG KONG, July 5 (UPI)China's Deputy Prime Minister says the nation will not renounce the use of force in resolving the Taiwan issue and that it is no other nation's business how the issue is settled.

title: Four Medical Examiners Block Autopsy Bill in Albany
description: ALBANY, June 5The opposition of four of the state's chief medical examiners has effectively killed a bill that the physicians warned would place cumbersome restrictions on the conduct of autopsies in cases of suspicious or unexplained deaths.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, July 5Residential tenantsrenters of most apartments and onefamily homesmay begin as early as Aug. 1 to share in the realestate tax benefits granted property owners under the state incometax law, the state's Department of Community Affairs announced today.

title: GypsyCab Driver Is Shot
description: A gypsycab driver was shot in the head at about 11:50 last night at 155th Street and Bradhurst Avenue in Harlem in an apparent holdup attempt, the police reported. The driver was taken to Harlem Hospital, where his condition was reported critical. His identity was withheld.

title: VATICAN URGES HELP FOR CHURCH SCHOOLS
description: ROME, July 5The Vatican for the first time called today for government financial support of the world's Roman Catholic schools.

title: A Troupe of and for Dancers
description: SPOLETO. Italy THE SPOLETO FESTIVAL of Two Worlds is now 20 years old. Time it seems, waits for no man and certainly for no festival, and what started as a dream in Gian Carlo Menotti's eye has now become a dream 20 times fulfilled.

title: VW FirstHalf Deliveries Up 11.1% to 1.2 Million
description: Volkswagen, West Germany's leading auto producer, announced that its motor vehicle deliveries in the first half of the year amounted to 1,225,000 units, up 11.1 percent over deliveries for the yearago period. For all of 1977, Toni Schmuecker, VW chairman, predicted a sales volume of 2,315,000 units, an increase of 9.6 percent.

title: New Products: Sauces, Pastries, Peanuts, Pans
description: As heretical as it might be to suggest this possibility to the most serious of cooks, it is nonetheless true that there are some perfectly nice people the world who do not simmer down their own stocks and sauces bases, but who would still like to be able to serve gussied up French, sauces to family and guests. For those people, and even for more dedicated cooks who are occasionally caught short, the new line of saucier sauce bases will prove welcome.

title: Algoma to Raise Price Of Structural Steel
description: Algoma Steel Corporation announced that it would raise the base price for structural steel by $15 a ton, in terms of Canadian dollars, effective July 31.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TODAY, July 6 MIKHAIL LERMONTOV (March). Left Leningrad June 22; due 7 A.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: Ship Designed to Fight Oil Well Fires at Sea Is Christened in Japan
description: TOKYO, July 5An oil rig service vessel designed to revolutionize the fighting of major oilwell fires at sea was christened today at the Hiroshima shipyard of Mitsubishi Heavy Industries.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: AVOIDING TRAFFIC TIEUPS: Paving crews resurfacing 16th Street near Fairmont Avenue in Newark at night. The city has repaved five and a half miles of streets at night in order to avoid traffic incidents and interference with businesses. The crews start at 8 P.M. and work until 4:30 A.M. The firm that is doing the work is able to cover the surfaces more quickly and for that reason has not charged the city a premium for night work.

title: Phils Crush Mets, 121, On 4 Clouts
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 5Last night, the. Philadelphia Phillies had skyrockets and fireworks at Veterans Stadium for the Independence Day holiday. Tonight, against the Mets, they had cannon shots as they buried the New York visitors, 121, under a barrage of long homers.

title: Rhodesian Guerrillas Front Wins Backing of O.A.U. as Parley Ends
description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon, July 5African leaders today bestowed something just short of exclusive recognition upon the Patriotic Front, the Rhodesian nationalist movement headed by Joshua Nkomo and Robert Mugabe, as they ended the annuai summit meeting of the Organizaton of African Unity.

title: Dollar Off and Gold Revives
description: The dollar declined again yesterday in foreign exchange trading in New York and abroad. The price of gold, which dropped as much as $1.50 an ounce Monday, made a slight recovery in the major European bullion trading centers.

title: $100 Million VIASA Loan
description: VIASA, the Venezuelan airline, announced that it had been granted $100 million loan by Citibank and the Chase Manhattan Bank to buy three DC10 jet aircraft, The Venezuelan Government holds a 75 percent interest in VIASA.

title: Pro Transactions
description: MONTREAL (NL)Signed one amateur draft choice: John Willis, pitcher, Hampton, Va.; Signed two free agents: Kevin Rupp, Pitcher, Baytown, Tex.; Fred Wren Jr., outfielder, St. Petersburg, Fla.

title: Market Place
description: After several years of poor results for casualty insurers brought on by rapid inflation and limits on rate increases, a number of specialty insurance companies are leading the way to higher profits.

title: The Clouded Crystal Ball on July 4
description: For 50 years it was an article of faith in baseball that although the unexpected might happen in the early stages of a pennant race, class would assert itself before the Fourth of July and the teams would probably finish in or near the positions they occupied on Independence Day, the traditional midpoint if not the arithmetical one. It would require research by somebody like Seymour Siwoff, the demon statistician, to determine just how valid this belief was, but in the first half of this century the only notable exception cited was Boston's Miracle Braves of 1914, who were last in July, first in OctoSports ber, and swept the Philadelphia Athletics of in the World Series, four games to zilch. The Times None but the Braves, the traditionalists said, until they were contradicted by the New York Giants of 1951, the New York Mets of 1969 and again by the Mets in 1973. Still, baseball changes slowly, like most institutions, and baseball men still attach significance to the standings of July 4, especially if their team on top.

title: Canadian Court Decides I.B.M. Infringed on Five Xerox Patents
description: TORONTO, July 5 (AP)The Canadian Federal Court ruled today that the International Business Machines Corporation had infringed on five Xerox Corporation copier patents, Xerox announced.

title: Byrne Insists That Port Authority Lower Tolls or Aid Mass Transit
description: TRENTON. July 5Governor Byrne, comparing the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to a candystore owner who takes a child's quarter and refuses to hand over the ice cream, vowed today to continue vetoing actions of the bistate body until it either sbopped taking higher motorist tolls or handed over a new rail masstransit plan.

description: Trading on four New York commodity exchanges took place yesterday in a redribbon, redcarpet setting as they shared for the first time the same floor in a new $10 million facility at No. 4 World Trade Center.

title: New Head of Board of Education To Reevaluate Promotion Policies
description: Stephen R. Aiello, a 34yearold former social studies teacher from Brooklyn, who became the president of the Board of Education yesterday, said he would seek to reevaluate the entire process by which students are promoted from grade to grade in New York City.

title: Books: Recalling a Legend
description: Gene Fowler was a newspaperman who started in his home town of Denver and, by dint of his feats as star reporter, drinker, salopn brawler, roisterer, womanizer and socializer, created a constant stir and excitment in his adopted home town of New York, where he rose, often grudgingly, from reporter to managing editor in the Hearst organization. He wrote books, among them wellreceived biographies of John Barrymore (Good Night, Sweet Prince) and Jimmie Walker (Beau James), and spent his last years as a screen writer in Hollywood.

title: J. WALTER SWENSON
description: J. Walter Swenson, a recently retired partner in the New York Stock Exchange firm of Vilas & Hickey, died Monday in ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Centel. He was 79 years old and lived at 127 Heller Way, Upper Montclair, N.J.

description: Ronald E. Spath, a 34yearold Pleasantville Republican, announced his candidacy for his party's nomination for the seat in Westchester County's 24th Congressional District now held by Richard L. Ottinger, a Democrat.

description: Borough President Donald R. Manes asked that Queens be allotted $45 million of the city's next federally financed Public Works Act budget of $190 million, Mr. Manes proposed to use $8 million to improve schools and community colleges, $2.2 million to make the College Point Industrial Park more attractive to businesses, more than $15 million for sewer projects and various other amounts for street lighting, municipal parking lots and similar public works projects.

title: Portuguese Communist Leader Firm in His Support of Moscow
description: LISBON, July 3In neighboring Spain, Santiago Carrillo, head of the Communist Party, has been excommunicated by the Kremlin for preaching the heresy of Eurocommunism. But there seems no danger of the doctrine spreading across the frontier, for Alvaro Cunhal, secretary general of the Portuguese Communists, remains the Soviet Union's best friend in Western Europe.

title: Business/Finance
description: The biggest antitrust challenge in many years was filed by the Department of Justice to block the takeover of the Babcock & Wilcox Company by United Technologieg Corporation for $510 million. The diversified aerospace company was accused of embarking on a course that might substantially reduce competition or tend to create a monopoly. [D1:56.]

title: JUDGE DISMISSES SUIT CHARGING PHILLIPS DEAL
description: TULSA, Okla., July 5 (UPI)A Federal judge today dismissed a Watergaterelated conspiracy indictment against the Phillips Petroleum Company, its board chairman and two former officers, saying the Government had violated its own pleabargaining agreement.

title: Solar Energy Found Practical for Homes in 2 Decades
description: A federally sponsored study of smallscale solar energy units for use in homes and other buildings indicates that within the next two decades such equipment may be able to provide energy as efficiently and cheaply as energy from many of the large centralized utility stations that provide most of today's power in the United States.

title: Judge Demands A. Parking Plan Within 10 Days
description: A Federal judge yesterday gave New York City 10 days to come up with specific plans to carry out a controversial parking ban aimed at combating air pollution in Manhattan.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: THERE IS THIS plot, foisted on us by people who may even mean well, that spreads, grows and adds to the daily discomfort those citizens who, persistent in their crankiness, refuse to have anything to do with it. Basically, the plot has to do with our health and well being, which once was considered nil one's business but your own, but which now is a matter of importance if you are to be truly chic. It is now chic, for example, to drink only Perrier water or white wine lunch, to say that you do not smoke, to eat a salad instead of pasta, and to think that Ralph Nader has done more for us all than, say, W. C. Fields. People who drink Perrier, refuse to smoke, eat salads and love Ralph Nader are also big on exercise, and is here that they are most unbearable for everyone else. They all play tennis or jog, and then they go around talking about it. They suffer from the sin of pride, and they make everyone else feel guilty.

title: H.E.W Withholds School Funds For New York Over Rights Issue

title: International
description: Pakistan's army, having seized power in a bloodless coup, imposed martial law and promised new elections in October. The chief of staff, Gen. Mohammad Zia ulHaq, announced the end of the regime of Prime Minister Zulfika Ali Bhutto in a nationwide broadcast. The army acted to end four months of political violence that took more than 300 lives. A military spokesman said Mr. Bhutto, his Cabinet ministers and leaders of the opposition Pakistan National Alliance had been taken into temporary protective custody. General Zia said he was taking over as chief martial law administrator but that President Zazal Elahi Choudry would remain head of state and that the 1973 constitution would remain in effect. [Page A1, Column 6.]

description: MADRID, July 5 (AP)King Juan Carlos swore in the new Cabinet of Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez today and abandoned the practice of having the members kneel when pledging loyalty to the crown.

title: Shotgun Captures Horse Show Event
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., July 5Shotgun, a mount of undistinguished credentials, was the class of the field in the intermediate jumper competition, the feature event of the opening day of the Lake Placid horse show today. The show, at the Lake Placid show grounds, runs through Sunday.

title: TV: Fernwood 2Night a Little 2 Much
description: MARY HARTMAN; Mary Hartman is dead but her spinoffs have begun to linger. Mary is being replaced on WNEW/Channel 5, week nights at 11, with Fernwood 2Night, a summer series described as the first totally fictional talkvariety show on television. This latest Norman Lear production is set in Femwood, Ohio, home of Mary Hartman, but most of the guests passing through the talk show studio have not appeared on theing, say, Jerry Lester and Milton DeLugg. Rattling off the names of the guests as the show opens is the sincerely dimwitted announcer, my Hubbard (Fred Willard), a possibly strong runnerup in a Tom Brokaw lookalike contest. Jerry's brother happens to be the manager of the station.

Mr. DiGiovanni was issued summonses for unauthorized landing, unauthorized advertising (a Ban the SST poster hung from the balloon), flying over congested areas and reckless endangerment. They have already sponsored trips to Nova Scotia and to Israel, and yesterday they went to Broadway, which was nearly as great an expedition, as far as they were concerned.

title: Mets Lead Survives Rain But Not Phils in 53 Loss
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 6The Mets, who have had trouble playing on dry fields lately, found tonight that they do no better on a wet one as they lost again to the Philadelphia Phillies, 53, at Veterans Stadium.

title: Big Changes in Water Act Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, July 6A new and novel coalition that includes environmentalists, state and city officials and sewer builders urged Congress today to forgo sweeping changes in the Water Pollution Act this year and to concentrate instead on emergency clean water measures.

title: Andrus Moves to Nullify Permit For Exxon Unit off West Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, July 6Secretary of the Interior Cecil D. Andrus has taken a step toward nullifying a permit his predecessor granted the Exxon Corporation to operate a controversial floating oilprocessing facility and shipping terminal off Santa Barbara.

title: Jazz: Peck Finds the Big Sound
description: ICHARD PECK, a saxophonist from Louisiana, plays in the ensemble of Philip Glass, the composer. One would never have suspected from his contributions to Mr. Glass's minimalist music that Mr. Peck is a voluble improviser with the technique of a jazz musician and something of the sensibility of a rocker.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. on Djibouti membership.

title: Wisconsin and Strikers Bargaining
description: MADISON, Wis. July 6Negotiators for thousands of striking state employees and for the state returned to the bargaining table here this afternoon for the first time since the strikebegan four days ago. Meanwhile, 2,300 National Guard officers remained on duty throughout the state and striking workers continued to man their picket lines.

title: Ox's Eye and Farmer's Curse
description: Summer wouldn't be summer without daisies, though the common field daisy, known to almost every man, woman and child, is sometimes called Farmer's Curse. Ask any farmer and he'll tell you why. Daisies beautify rural roadsides, but they invade meadows, pastures and all kinds of cultivated fields. Most farmers smile picnicking youngsters who gather handfuls of daisies, but they gasp in utter bafflement at summer visitors who actually pick them to arrange in vases.

title: Sweden Holds 2 Soviet Trawlers
description: CARLSKRONA, Sweden, July 6 (Reuters)Police officials here said today they were questioning the crews of two Soviet trawlers intercepted in the Baltic Sea eight miles inside Sweden's 12mile fishing limit. The interception took place near this goutheast Swedish naval port.

title: FirstClass Rate Of 16c Proposed On Business Mail Postal Chief Backs 13c Stamp for Individuals BUSINESS MAIL RATE MAY RISE TO 16 CENTS
description: WASHINGTON, July 6  Postmaster General Benjamin F. Bailar proposed today to increase firstclass postage rates to 16 cents for businesses, but to allow individuals to continue paying 13 cents.

title: JAY GRODMAN
description: Jay Grodman of 277 Moore Avenue Freeport, L.I., an account executive with the Allstate Insurance Company for 2; years, died Monday at South Nassau Corn munities Hospital after a brief illness He was 56 years old.

title: NEW CLEANAIR PLAN TO CURB AUTO FUMES IS SUBMITTED BY CITY
description: New York City's longdelayed alternative airpollutioncontrol plan, based on stricter enforcement of existing parking regulations and relying on the auto industry and the Federal Government to produce cleaner cars, was submitted to the state yesterday.

title: Letter From Home
description: NEW HAVEN

title: Calendar of Events
description: Some events of interest for enthusiasts of the house and home.

title: Facing Up to Inflation
description: The Carter Administration is finally showing signs life in facing up to inflation. The Secretaries of Treasury, Labor and Commerce and the chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers have held the first major meeting with the LaborManagement Group created by the White House last April to shape a national antiinflation policy. It is far from certain that very much can be done to reduce the pace of inflation, but at least the President's emissaries recognized that the judgment could not be left to the LaborManagement Group alone.

title: BILL PRICES CLOSE MOSTLY UNCHANGED
description: The broad decline in prices of public and private debt issues that began one week ago seemed to dissipate yesterday, more out of market inertia than any improved sentiment, according to dealers.

title: Home Beat
description: ILL PUBLIC relations people never run out of stunts? Promotions like this really shouldn't be encouraged, but, be that as it may, the hypeoftheyear award goes to Horizon Carpet Company of Calhoun, Ga.

title: Pro Transactions
description: CHICAGO (NL)Called un Pete Broberg, righthanded licher, from Wichita, Kan., of American Association. Optioned Bobby Darwin, outfielder, to Wichita.

title: Film: Cuba Si U.S. No
description: INA LA REPUBLICA! which opened at the Jean Renoir Cinema yesterday, is an effective, hardhitting Marxist history of Cuba from the SpanishAmerican War, by which the United States came to dominate Cuban affairs, until the successfid 1959 revolution led by Fidel Castro. The film is composed of newsreel footage supplemented by political cartoons, footage from fiction films and from television films and commercials.

title: Philadelphia Guild Set Back
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 6 (AP)The Na tional Labor Relations Board has rejected charges of unfair labor practices made against The Philadelphia Evening ant;1 Sunday Bulletin by the Newspaper Guild. The union had charged that The Bulletin had taken several steps to discourage employees from voting to join the union, but the board ruled that the newspaper had acted within the permissible.

title: People in Sports
description: Bob Pulford, who recently resigned as coach of the Los Angeles Kings, was named coach and general manager of the Chicago Black Hawks yesterday. The 41yearold Pulford, who led the Kings to the hockey playoffs the last four seasons, replaced the interim coach, Bill White, who took over in midseason after the dismissal of Billy Reay.

title: Ohio Votes $235,000 To Improve Thistledown
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, July 6 (AP)The Ohio Racing Commission approved a $235,000 capital improvement project today for Thistledown, Cleveland's thoroughbred track.

title: Maj. Gen. Wilcox, Was Commander of Marine Division
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif. July 6 (AP) Maj. Gen. Edward A. Wilcox, 53 years old, commander of the. First Marine Division, died of a heart attack yesterday.

title: New CasinoTheater
description: Plans for Atlantic City's first casinotheater will be submitted to the State Division of Housing as soon as possible, according to an official for Resorts. International Inc.

title: Draft's
description: ALEXANDERIsabel, beloved wife of Waiter, devoted mother of iris and Lawrence Wolison and Gloria and Bernard Stubofsky, dearest sister of Lillian Hecht, adored grandmother of Glenn, Ilene, Jay and Lynn. Services today 10:45 A.M. at The Colonial Chapels of I. J. Morris, Inc., 46 Greenwich St., Hempstead, L.I.

description: FIRST39,000, Pace, ch., mile.

title: At Your Service:
description: HE Lombardo home was the last one on the block to be equipped with an intercom. A system was not installed at the time of construction five years ago because, as Nancy Lombardo admitted frankly, We ran out of money.

title: PRISCILLA DOWD REILLY
description: Priscilla Dowd Reilly, a retired junior high school teacher, died Tuesday at the home of her daughter in Manlius, N.Y. She was 79 years old and a resident of Manlius.

title: Indian Trial Witness Says Testimony Was Forced
description: LOS ANGELES, July 6 (UPI)A prosecution witness in the murder trial of two American Indian Movement members, Paul Skyhorse and Richard Mohawk, testified yesterday that she was forced into making statements against the defendants.

title: Action on Dr. DeMarco
description: The State Attorney General's office recommended that Dr. Peter T. DeMarco be stripped of his medical license because of 95 reported cases of hepatitis among his patients.

title: SALES OF U.S. AUTOS SET RECORD IN JUNE; G.M. VOLUME AT HIGH
description: DETROIT, July 6American newcar sales set a record in June, according to reports released by the domestic companies today. Domestic sales were up 10.9 nercent from June 1976.

title: Gold
description: Selected World gold prices Wednesday. London: morning fixing $141.05, oil $0.20; afternoon fixing $140.55, off $0.70. Paris: afternoon fining $116.40, UP $0.17. Frankfurt: $141.05.

title: Moscow Unlikely to Raise Arms Outlay, Warnke Says
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (Reuters)The chief United States disarmament negotiator Paul C. Warnke, said today that President Carter's decision to deploy the cruise missile in place of the abandoned B1 bomber was unlikely to provoke heavier Soviet spending on air defense.

title: Singles Heed Call Of HomeOwning
description: HERE is a new kind of customer knocking on the doors of home sellers these daysAmericans who aren't married.

title: Mobutu Appoints a Prime Minister
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, July 6 (Reuters)President Mobutu Sese Seko of Zaire has appointed Mpinga Kasenga to the new post of Prime Minister, Zaire's official presCagency reported today. The President announced last week that he was establishing the post of prime minister. He also announced the resignation of all members of the Executive Council, or cabinet, pending political and economic reforms including parliamentary and presidential elections.

title: Kershner to Direct Eyes for Columbia
description: Irvin Kershner, known for his direction of such films as The Luck of Ginger Coffey, A Fine Madness and the recent Raid on Entebbe, has been signed to direct Eyes, which will be on Peters's first production for Columbia Pictures. Mr. Peters, who made his debut as a producer with the remake of A Star Is Born, with Barbra Streisand and Kris Kristofferson, plans to start filming Eyes on location in New York in the fall.

title: Connors Playing Today W.C.T. Austin Event
description: AUSTIN, Tex., July 6 (AP)Eight players, including Jimmy Connors, will start competition tomorrow for a top prize of $30,000 in the World Championship Tennis Tournament of Champions.

title: Letters
description: To THE HOME SECTION As a senior girl who did go to the prom mentioned in Lois Gould's Hers column [June 23] I feel I mutt point out a few facts that were. not. correctly conveyed by, her son or his friends.

description: Major League Box Scores NATIONAL LEAGUE PITCHING RUNS BATTED IN HOME RUNS RUNS BATTED IN PITCHING League. Leaders,

title: CleanestDirtiest Streets Listed
description: The Department of Sanitation has mounted a War on Litter in New York City streets, and to implement its campaign has issued a list of the cleanest and dirtiest streets in the five boroughs.

title: Beanie Criticizes Abzug and Koch, And Two G.O.P. Rivals Trade Gibes
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that two of his Democratic challengers, for the mayoral nomination, Bella S, Abzug and Representative Edward L Koch, had hindered the city's efforts to obtain construction and Jobs.

title: Sports Today
description: National Hot Rod Association Summernationals, at Englishtown, N.J., 7 A.M.

title: Eban Won't Be Prosecuted Under Currency Rules
description: TEL AVIV, July 6The state ruled today that former Foreign Minister Abba Eban could not be prosecuted for breaches of foreign currency regulations in connection with bank accounts he maintained in New York.

title: Carey Sees Gain on NoFault. Bill, But an Accords Still Seems Elusive
description: ALBANY, July 6Governor Carey said today that Senate Republican leaders had ccepted his definition of when an accident victim could bring suit for pain and suffering under the state's nofault automobile insurance law, bringing all sides very close to an agreement.

title: Nets, Seeking to Move to Jersey, Sue Knicks Over Effort to Block It
description: The New York Nets' basketball team, intent on moving to New Jersey, filed a Jawsuit against the Knicks yesterday, challenging a key part in the structure of professional sports that allocates franchises and protects, territories.

title: Improvement Found In Coastal Waters
description: Environmental conditions in the ocean off New Jersey have improved since last year when 70 percent of the surf clams died, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration said yesterday. The agency called the situation cautiously encouraging.

title: Pro Rodeo League Slated In Six Cities Next Year
description: KANSAS CITY, July 6 (AP)The formation of a sixcity professional rodeo circuit was announced today at a news conference in Kansas City. The league will begin operation next year in Los Angeles Denver, Kansas City, Mo., Tulsa, Okla., Salt Lake City and San Antonio. Tex.

title: LOS ANGELES BUS PLAN ON SCHOOLS REJECTED
description: LOS ANGELES, July 6The Los Angeles school district's integration plan was held unconstitutional today by a Superiod Court judge who said that it was too modest to desegregate effectively the 593,000pupil district.

title: Rate of Consumer Price Growth In Industrial Nations Up in May
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (Reuters)The increase in consumer prices in the industrial world rose to an annual rate of 8.1 percent in May from 8 percent in April, the International Monetary Fund said today.

title: News Summary
description: President Carter reassured leaders of American Jewish organizations at a White House meeting that the Arab states should establish full diplomatic relations with Israel as part of an overall Middle East settlement. He said there would have to be a real sense of peace. He sought to allay concern that the White House was demanding more of the Israelis than of the Arabs. [Page A1, Column 4].

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, JULY 7, 1977

title: Artillery Duels in South
description: SAIDA, Lebanon, July 6 (Reuters)  Are tillery duels were reported today from three fronts in southern Lebanon.

title: Books
description: MEAR JOB, one of the series in the adventures of David Callan, a sometime member of British Intelligence, is made up of equal elements from The Man From U. N. C. L. E. and a game of ticktacktoe. In one way, Callan is part of a shadowy, complicated espionage network anchored in London, but an interchangeable part. In another way, he is very much on his own, and every move is an N put down to his opponent's o until he is home free. Watching him at work is an aficionado's delight.

title: INMONT IN A NEW BID TO BLOCK TAKEOVER
description: Taking advantage of an. increasingly popular delaying tactic, the Inmont Corporation, a large printing ink company, succeeded yesterday in further putting off an unwanted takeover bid from Esmark Inc. for nearly $200 million.

title: Bonn Indicates Moscow Is Displeased With Carter
description: BONN, July 6  The West German Government has reportedly received new evidence of Soviet displeasure with the Carter Administration's stress on human rights, adding to the concern here over the possible effect of SovietAmerican frictions on straegic arms talks and dtente in general.

title: Design Notebook
description: OMPLAINING about new luxury housing in New York has tended to give one the feeling that he is like the old club bore, deA Recycled Factory Loft Restores the Luxury To City's Luxury Housing nouncing the new because it seems insistent on breaking with the values of the old. But in the making of apartments, the old values really were better there was more concern with both quantity and quality of space, with movement through space, with visual variety, with all of those aspects that contribute to the quality of the physical environment.

title: CARTER ADVISERS ASK REVISION AND 30% CUT IN WHITE HOUSE STAFF
description: WASHINGTON, July 6  President Carter's advisers on government reorganization have suggested to him that the White House staff be partly restructured and cut 30 percent by Sept. 30, and that officials developing domestic policy emulate the machinery already in use to prepare foreign and defense policy.

title: Bid Table Errors Led to Overcharge On U.S. Securities
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The Federal Home Lean Mortgage Corporation said today it had in effect overcharged purchasers of its securities by $2 million to $10 million during the last five years and was planning to make restitution to some 1,400 institutional investors.

title: New York's HardWon Lessons
description: The final report of the Temporary Commission on City Financesestablished by the New. York City Council 1975 and headed by Owen MoGivern, former presiding justice of the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Courttells us how New York got into financial trouble, how it can get out of trouble, and how it can stay out of trouble.

title: Tree] of Knowledge Grows in Brooklyn
description: If you need some help with your trees and plants once you take them home, consider a quickie course at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

title: U.S. Again Blocks Israeli Sale of Jets to Ecuador
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The Carter Administration rebuffed today a second attempt by Israel to sell to Ecuador 24 fighterbombers equipped with American engines.

title: Ballet: Danes Are Back With Bounce
description: LEE, Mass. HAT WONDERFUL small touring ensemble that calls itself Eight Soloists From the Royal Danish Balletwhich appeared here in 1976returned Tuesday night for the official opening of the Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival.

title: 2 EUROPEAN LEADERS APPEAL FOR PROGRESS ON TRADE AT GENEVA
description: LUXEMBOURG, July 6A strong call for Western Europe to insure that substantial progress is made toward freer world trade this year in the Geneva talks to liberalize trade came today from two plominent European leaders.

title: CURB ON U.S. ENVOY'S TALK DEFENDED BY TASS WRITER
description: MOSCOW, July 6 (AP)The Soviet press agency Tass, defending the decision not to let Ambassador Malcolm Toon give a Fourth of July talk over Soviet television, declared today that the Soviet mass media would not be made available for a noisy campaign by antidetente forces.

title: Marxist History
description: VIVA LA REPUBLICA, a documents feature directed by Pastor Vega; screenplay (In Spanish with English subtitles and In English) by Mr. Vega. Victor Casaus, Julie Garcia Esanosa. Jesus Mai and Mirita Lores; editor, Miss Lores; Produced by the Cuban Film Instituter distributed by Transcontinental Films. Running time: 91 minutes. At the Jean Renoir Cinema, 100 Seventh Avenue. This film has not been rated.

title: Overpaying Found, On Trips by Aides Of Port Authority
description: Auditors of State Comptroller Arthur Levitt have uncovered Instances, in which officials of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey took expensepaid outoftown trips at economy rates,.but were reimbursed at firstclass rates.

title: Hudson Valley Unit Usurped by State On Hospital Plans
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 6The State Health Department moved today to impose its own plan for closing maternity wards in a seli encounty area north and west of New York City after the regional health planning body failed to devise its own plan.

title: A.&P. Earnings for Quarter Rose 6.3% on a Sales Increase of 2.9%
description: The Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company reported yesterday a gain of 6.3 percent in net income for the first fiscal quarter ended May 28 on a sales gain of 2.9 percent. The figures were about in line with the estimates of John L. Scott, chairman, at the annual shareholder meeting in Chicago last June 17.

title: McEnroe Loses As Upsets Mark Newport Tennis
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 6 (UPI)In flurry of secondround upsets, John McEnroe, the Wimbledon sensation, was ousted from the $50,000 Hall of Fame grass tennis tournament today.

title: Roosevelt ENTRIES Horses listed In order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing RESULTS OTB payers subject to 5% Municipal tax.
