title: A Broker Makes Island Life His Stock and Trade
description: THIS BAD ENOUGH when your marriage breaks up, but when the bottom drops out of your business too, things can look mighty bleak, as they did not so long ago for Bagley Reid. A Richmond, Va., native who came to New York and counted on his spot in Wall Street underwriting to provide more than just creature comforts, Mr. Reid found his carefully constructed good life suddenly collapsing in 1974.

title: CHILD PORNOGRAPHY BILL WITHDRAWN BY SPONSOR
description: ALBANY, July 6A controversial bill that, while outlawing the use of children in pornographic movies would also make illegal some legitimate sex educadim books, was recalled from Governor Carey's desk today by its sponsor.

title: Bridge
description: Although American experts frequently. make their presence felt in major European tournaments, the converse is unfortunately not true. By an inhospitable regulation of the American Contrnct Bridge League. foreign players are barred from the Spingold knockout teams in Chicago later this month, and from the two other major national team contests.

title: For Septuagenarians and Septuplets, a Lucky Day
description: How lucky can you get? Today is the seventh day of the seventh month of the 77th year of this century. It's 7/7/77.

title: Kidnapped Egyptian Is Found Slain
description: CAIRO, July 6 (AP)  A former Egyptian Minister of Religious Affairs, kidnapped three days ago by members of a fanatic Moslem cult that preaches sacred terror, was found murdered today in a villa near the Giza pyramids, the police said.

title: Yates Victor in Recount
description: A primary election recount confirmed the victory of Assemblyman Charles B. Yates of Edgewater Park, in his bid to unseat State Senator Edward J. Hughes Jr., Democrat of Cinnaminson. The recount by Superior Court Judge Alexander Wood showed that Mr. Yates had defeated Senator Hughes by 352 votes in the Democratic primary. The Senator had requested the recount.

title: Gold Auction by I.M.F. Raises $52 Million at $140.26 an Ounce
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (Reuters)The International Monetary Fund today raised $52 million in the I I th of its series of gold auctions for a special trust fund to aid the world's poorest nations.

title: Home Repair Q & A
description: Q. have noticed for some time that a few of the lamps in my house flicker after they have been on for while. We have aluminum wiring in the house, but it was pigtailed by an electrician recently. Is there any thing that should be done about this? M.P., Merrick, L.I.

title: WIRETAP TESTIMONY IS ORDERED BY U. S.
description: NEW HAVEN, July 7Two agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation identified by local policemen as having been witnesses to an extensive illegal wiretapping operation were ordered by the Justice Department today to testify on their knowledge of the operation.

title: NEW CLEANAIR PLAN TO CURB AUTO FUMES IS SUBMITTED BY CITY
description: New York City's longdelayed alternative airpollutioncontrol plan, based on tougher enforcement of existing parking regulations and relying on the auto industry and the Federal Government to produce cleaner cars, was submitted to the state yesterday.

title: Company Agrees to Drop Curb on Bathroom Visits
description: IMLAY CITY, Mich., July 6 (AP)The Hamill Manufacturing Company has agreed to stop rquiring assembly line workers to raise their hands for permission to go to the bathroom, a union spokesman said today.

title: Senator Says an S.B.A. Deal Smells
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)A Small Business Administration official today defended the agency's dealings with a former $36,000ayear executive of the agency who was awarded a Government contract under a program for disadvantaged businessmen.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Rizzo's SST Idea Fought
description: Representative James J. Florio, Democrat of New Jersey, called Mayor Frank Rizzo of Philadelphia a prime candidate for the bad neighbor of the year award for suggesting the Concorde jet should land at Philadelphia International Airport.

title: SOUTH AFRICANS SAY U. S. SLOWS PROGRESS
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, July 5Despite efforts by the Carter Administration to allay fears that it intends to press for a oneman, onevote solution to the racial impasse here, South African officials maintain a strongly antagonistic attitude toward the Administration, insisting that its pronouncements are hindering black advancement by generating a backlash in the dominant Afrikaner population.

title: Family Money: Insuring Against Fire Loss
description: SNEARLY as Sidney Milstein can tell, the fire started in the electric garagedoor opener. It fed on the door itself, some boxes and papers that were stored in the garage, got to the gasoline tank of the station wagon with an explosive roar, and raced through two bedrooms and the living room of the ranch house Mr. Milstein owns In Closter, N.J. before the firemen got the flames out.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Wednesday.

title: Detroit Aides Strike
description: DETROIT, Thursday, July 7Union bargainers reached a tentative contract agreement with the city of Detroit early today, apparently ending a oneday strike by nearly 8,000 municipal employees.

title: Fireman Wins Court Suit
description: A Hackensack firefighter won a twoyear battle to overturn a 47day suspension imposed when he threatened to refuse to work under an acting lieutenant, but then reported for work as usual. The Appellate Division of Superior Court said there was no evidence that the fireman, Richard Winner, had carried out his threat to refuse to take orders. He had said he thought he was more qualified than the acting lieutenant.

title: Smoking Linked To Earlier Onset Of Menopause
description: Women who smoke are likely to undergo menopause at a younger age than nonsmokers, according to the findings of two studies involving more than 3,500 middleaged women in seven countries.

title: REP. MAHON OFTEN SAYS HE MI RETIRE1
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., July 6 (AP)Representative George Mahon, Democrat of Tens, who has served longer in the Hotise. of Representatives than any of his fellow Congressmen, announced today that he would not seek reelection in 1978.

description: DividendsWEDNESDAY, JULY 6, 1977

title: Meehan to Compete With Spear, Leeds
description: Competition between two leading stock specialists M. J. Meehan & Company and Spear, Leeds & Kelloggis expected to begin next Monday in 19 leading New York Stock Exchange issues, Wall Street sources said yesterday.

title: Canada Orders Inquiry Into Mounted Police Activities
description: OTTAWA, July 6The Canadian Government ordered a fullscale inquiry today into charges that the Royal Canadian Mounted Police had resorted to illegal breakins and other activities'in carrying out security investigations.

title: People and Business
description: The Hertz Corporation's superstar, 0. J. Simpson, tripped himself slightly when he issued an invitation recently to one William Schechter of Garden City, N.Y. to join the Hertz No. I Club. As it turned out, Mr. Schechter is director of public relations at archrival Avis Inc. The Avis executive declined the offer.

title: CARTER EXPERIMENTS WITH NEWS PARLEYS
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Last Friday, halfdozen columnists lounged around the White House swimming pool, having what was billed as an informal chat with President Carter.

title: Forgettable People
description: Mysterious volcanic island during a search for a lost American explorer in The People That Time Forgot. What Is really needed, it soon becomes obvious in the film that landed at local theaters yesterday, is a creative script, imaginative direction and acting and some levity to lift this vehicle out of its comic book trappings.

title: Smoking Linked To Earlier Onset Of Menopause
description: Women who smoke are likely to undergo menopause at a younger age than nonsmokers, according to the findings of two studies involving more than 3,500 middleaged women in seven countries.

title: Frederic Coudert 3d Weds Peggy Benenson
description: The marriage of Peggy Ann Benenson of New York to Frederic R. Coudert 3d of New York and Oyster Bay, L.I., a member of the internetkrial law firm of Coudert Brothers, took place yesterday afternoon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Lipson, brother and sisterinlaw of the bride. Justice Myles J. Lane lof the State Supreme CourtAppellate Division, performed the ceremony.

title: Poll Finds That Most Jerseyans Think State Is Good Place to Live
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J. July 6From Benjamin Franklin to Woody Allen unflattering comments have been made about New Jersey. The state has been pictured as a haven for gangsters and corrupt politicians, a cultural wasteland and a crowded, pollutionchoked industrial state.

title: Palestinians Tell of Blast
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 6  A Palestinian Marxist group, the Democratic Front for the Liberation of Palestine, said today that guerrillas in one of its cells inside Israel had set off the blast at Petah Tiqva.

title: Gulf Energy Source
description: The Public Service Electric and Gas Company said it had acquired rights for offshore gas and oil drilling on six tracts in the Gulf of Mexico. James P. Randel, president of the Energy Development Corporation, a subsidiary of the utility, said that development would take at least three years, and that it could be seven years before gas and oil could be pumped to New Jersey. Some drilling may begin before the end of the year, he said.

title: GENERIC DRUGS BILL GAINS IN ALBANY VOTE
description: ALBANY, July 6The State Senate passed a bill today to stimulate the use of generic drugs instead of brandnamed ones that are now routinely prescribed by physicians.

title: China Wants Total Pullout By U.S. From Taiwan
description: TOKYO, July 6 (AP)The Chinese Government says American military installations as well as troops must be withdrawn from Taiwan and the Taiwan Strait before it will consider full diplomatic relations with the United States.

title: Inflation and Joblessness Slowing Unification of Europe
description: LUXEMBOURG July 6 West Europe's postwar quest for unity appears to be flagging, even as the Continent is at a milestone on the road to closer economic cooperation.

title: Advertising
description: So far this year N. W. Ayer ABH Internaticnal has won four new accountsabout $20 million in billingseach representing very different industries and all requiring speculative presentations. This agency selection procedure, once frowned uponthe creating, and presenting of either a marketing strategy or rough advertising for the specific prospective clienthas become common practice.

title: Welcoming the OnePiece Mattress
description: The mattress industry is finally responding to decadeold consumer demands for a comfortable mattress that can be used on a lowslung base without a box spring.

title: Ron Leibman to Play Comic in Bellow Play
description: Ron Leibman, who recently played Richard III in Shakespeare's play at the Actors Studio, will next portray a standup comic in The Last Analysis, the only fulllength play by Saul Bellow. The production will be staged at the Berkshire Festival in Stockbridge; Mass., from July 20 to July 31. The cast will also include Doris Belack and Jill O'Hara.

title: Market Place
description: Insiders at the Cummins Engine Company have recently sold shares in this leading independent manufacturer of diesel engines for trucks, but there is little indication that their selling indicates disenchantment with company prospects.

title: Agricultural Cooperative Ordered To Give Freight Records to I.C.C.
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 6 (AP)A Federal judge in Massachusetts has ordered the Four Seasons Cooperative, an agricultural cooperative, to turn over its records to the Interstate Commerce Commission, the I.C.C. announced today.

title: 2 WOMEN'S BANKS OBTAIN APPROVAL TO ORGANIZE
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (UPI) The Federal Government today granted preliminary approval of applications to open two national banks to be managed and directed primarily by women.

title: Dow Declines by 5.86 to 907.73; Some Industrial Issues at 77 Lows
description: Selling pressure on such bluechip issues as the papers, steels and chemicals pushed the stock market broadly lower yesterday as some of these basic industrial issues dropped to their poorest prices of 1977.

title: GOVERNOR IS OPPOSED TO BLUELAW REVIVAL

title: Disney's 'Rescuers,' Cheerful Animation
description: WITH "ANNIE" already established as one of the bigger hits on the Broadway stage, the arrival of "The Rescuers"the first animated feature from the Walt Disney organization since 1973could make this the year of the transcendent orphan. Like Little Orphan Annie, Penny, the small heroine of "The Rescuers," is parentless and subject to all sorts of evil designs by people, who fortunately, are so incompetent that they are virtually self-destruct mechanisms."The Rescuers," which opened yesterday at the Cinerama Two and other theaters, is efficiently short, charming, mildly scary in unimportant ways, and occasionally very funny. It's a perfect show for the very, very young who take their cartoons seriously.The screenplay, based on two stories by Margery Sharp, is principally about the efforts of two do-gooding New York mice, Bernard and Miss Bianca, members of something called the Rescue Aid Society, to rescue Penny after she's been kidnapped by a certain Madame Medusa. The last, who runs Madame Medusa's Pawn Shop Boutique, has stolen the child and whisked her off to Louisiana because Penny is the only person small enough to crawl into a pirate's cave there and retrieve a diamond as big as a baseball.I doubt that even small children will pay too much attention to the story, which, as it should be, is simply the excuse for a series of marvelously improbable adventures. There is, for example, the hectic journey that Bernard, whose voice and something of his personality are supplied by Bob Newhart, and Miss Bianca (voice by Eva Gabor) take to Louisiana via Albatross Air Charter Service. The "equipment," as it's called in timetables, is a very tired albatross named Orville who hasn't yet mastered takeoffs or landings.In the Devil's Bayou in Louisiana there are split-second escapes from Madame Medusa, a fine, flame-haired Gorgon for whom Geraldine Page supplies the voice and comic presence, and encounters with various swamp types, including a dragonfly named Evinrude who runs a local boat service.With periodic timeouts for obligatory songs of an especially forgettable nature, "The Rescuers" moves quickly and without fuss from one episode to the next, never creating a sense of any real dread or fear. The animation is pretty in a conventional fashion that may be as fascinating to children as the bold innovations of someone like Ralph Bakshi are to the rest of us."The Rescuers" doesn't belong in the same category as the great Disney cartoon features ("Snow White and The Seven Dwarfs," "Bambi," "Fantasia") but it's a reminder of a kind of slickly cheerful, animated entertainment that has become all but extinct.

title: Gingerly, the Arts Focus on Fascism
description: LONDONHO'S. AFRAID, of Virkinia Woolf? Nobody. Who's afraid of a resurgent fascism? Everybody. Or so I deduce. Arriving in London and settling down to.some coffee and a copy of the morning Times, I come across a review of a new book that takes something of a revisionist attitude toward Hitler. Its author means to dismiss the notion that Hitler was merely's monster or quite possibly mad; he is ready, the reviewer tells us, to serve as the Flihrer's correcting angel, the avenger of Nuremberg's lies. The reviewer admires much about the book. It is abl sorbing and highly talented. He is also, quite understandably, skittish as a kitten with it: it is disingenuous and ultimately perverse. A worrisome business.

description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)  The Pakistani Ambassador, Sahabzada YaqubKhan, met today with Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance to explain the policies of Pakistan's new military government, the State Department said. Since the coup the State Department has refrained from expressing concern about the end of democratic rule in Pakistan and the imprisonment of many Pakistani political leaders.

title: Colombian Aviation Aide Slain
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, July 6 (AP)Two men riding a motorcycle shot and killed a Colombian aviation official today as he was caught in a traffic jam on his Way to work, the police reported. They Said that Osiris Maldonado, a retired air force colonel serving as chief of operations for the Civil Aeronautics Board, was being driven to his office when the two assassins cut off his automobile, shot him and his driver and then sped off. The driver was hospitalized in good condition.

title: Horse Shows
description: Preliminary Jumpers, Division ANileswaY Farm's Impact.

title: Billlntended to Bar Forced Retirement Advances in Albany
description: ALBANY, July 6Employers in New York State would be prevented from forcing any worker to retire solely because of age under terms of a bill passed by the State Assembly today with only three dissenting votes.

title: U.S. Jury Reopens Investigation Of Tax Fraud Charges Against G.M.
description: DETROIT, July 6 (AP)A Federal grand jury today reopened its investigation of tax fraud charges against the General Motors Corporation following a Federal judge's decision not to halt the investigation.

title: About New york
description: The condominium apartments of Galleria, which cost up to $1.2 million each for an unfinished, unfurnished but breathtaking swath of glasswalled duplex rooms in the sky over East 57th Street are Stanley Thea's to market to the very rich.

title: Fire Cuts Water Flow To Maryland Counties
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)About 1.2 million persons in Washington's Maryland suburbs were urged today to stop washing dishes, clothes and themselves, today after an early morning fire in a filtration plant cut pumping volume.

title: Hers
description: EVERAL MONTHS AGO I started diary, thus quietly joining a long line of men and women who seek to find wisdom, perspective, and insight by jotting down the thrust of their daily life. It was not my first attempt.

title: NEW OCEANS POLICY STUDIED BY CARTER
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The Carter Administration is considering a major reorganization of the Federal Government's policy on management of oceans as the animal and mineral harvest from the sea has produced new economic and political problems.

title: Librarian Is to Prepare Ford Presidential Papers
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)William J. Stewart, a librarian, was appointed yesterday to begin preparing the release of Gerald R. Ford's Presidential papers.

title: Masback, Princeton Miler, Wins $1,500 Scholarship
description: PRINCETON, N.J., July 6Craig Masback, Princeton's star miler, was one of 14 trackmen to receive $1,500 National Collegiate postgraduate scholarships in recognition of athletic and academic achievements today.

title: New Fighting in Lebanon Raises ArabIsraeli Tension
description: CAIRO, July 6  The increased fighting in southern Lebanon has aroused new fears that the confrontation between the Palestine Liberation Organization and Lebanese rightwing Christians may turn into another ArabIsraeli war.

title: A Misalliance That Succeeds
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, MASS. ISALLIANCE, one of Shaw's later plays, is one of his most free and unexpected. It has its themeslove, youth and age, parents and childrenbut it is not really about them. There are moments when it doesn't seem to be about anything, but it is. With its twirling shifts, its paradoxes, its sometimes incoherent ramblings, it is about movement itself. It is Shaw writing his sword'spoint comedy as music rather than prose.

title: Calumet's Alvdar Wins by 31/2 Lengths: Triple for Cauthen
description: The days of wine and roses may be on their way back for Calumet Farm, the Kentuckybased stable that dominated racing 15 to 20 years ago. At .least that was the impression Alydar, a rangy, chestnut colt, gave many in a crowd of 17,255 at Belmont Park yesterday as he scored by 3 lengths in the $36.825 Great American Stakes.

title: Sant'Angelo Simplifies His Life, His Home
description: IORGIO DI SANT'ANGELO became plain Giorgio Sant'Angelo a year ago. It was just to make life simpler. At about the same time, he took a larger step in the same direction.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: Selling Off Some Quilted Memories

title: Tariff Aimed at Japan Bearings
description: BRUSSELS, July 6 (UPI)The Commission of the European Common Market recommended today that a 15 percent antidumping tariff be imposed on imports of ball bearings and tapered roller bearings from Japan. But it said the tariff Ph ould be held in abeyance as long as Japan keeps a promise to increase the export price of the bearings.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: CAMDEN, July 6Last year the nation celebrated its Bicentennial and the 200th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence. Today academicians, students and the general public gathered on the Camden campus of Rutgers University to celebrate the tricentennial of another remarkable document dedicated to democracy.

title: Italian Scores Knockout
description: VIESTE, Italy, July 6 (AP)Natale Vezzoli of Italy knocked out Ethem Oezakalin, a TurkishGerman, in the 11th round and retained his European junior lightweight boxing title tonight.

title: Jenkins Triumphs On Mr. Demeanor
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., July 6Rodney Jenkins scored his first jumper triumph of the Lake Placid horse show today just as the clouds disappeated and the sun emerged.

title: 9 Percent Drop in Crime Is Reported by F.B.I.; Bitter Cold Winter Cited
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP)The coun try's crime rate dropped 9 percent in the first three months of this year as against the same 1976 period, the largest quarterly reduction in the 19 years the Federal Bureau of Investigation has issued crime reports, the bureau said today.

title: How to Get There
description: The best route o Tanglewood from New York City, according to the Berkshire Hills Conference, is the Taconic State Parkway to Route 23, Hillsdale, N. Y. Take Route 23 to Great Barrington, Mass., at the first traffic light turn left onto Route 7, and follow it to Stockbridge, where you turn left onto Route 102. Then turn right at the blinking light onto Route 183 to Tanglewood.

title: New Face: Charles Repole
description: If you're going to play a leprechaun, you might as well start out looking like Charles Repole, who is nothing if not elfin. Short, bouncy and bigeyed, radiating a kind of fey innocence, Mr. Repole would seem to have been born for the role of Og, the gentle Irish sprite who animates Finian's Rainbow. He arrived a bit too late for the original, which had its Broadway premiere in 1947, the year he was born, but he is making up for all that in the current revival of the E. Y. (Yip) HarburgBurton Lane musical at the Jones Beach Theater in Wantagh,

title: Cosmos Name Firmani Pilot
description: Eddie Firmani, who has had a love affair with soccer on three continents, was named coach of the Cosmos yesterday. He replaces Gordon Bradley, who relinquished the position to resume his duties as vice president in charge of player personnel and development.

title: Services Back to Normal With End of Detroit Strike.,
description: DETROIT, July 7 (UPI)Bus service. and garbage collection returned to nearly normal today when 8,000 city worker ended an unexpected oneday strike and prepared to vote on a tentative threeyear contract agreement.

title: U.S. and Soviet: Time of Testing
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Carter Ad I ministration, which concedes that it did Knot expect the sharp reaction its policies evoked in the Soviet Union, believes that it is entering a crucial period that will test the United Stateg contention that, despite continuing problems, the two superpowers can still make progress in a number of key areas.

title: 5 Killed, 71 Injured in Danbury Federal Prison Fire
description: DANBURY, Conn., July 7  Fire and fumes swept through a locked, overcrowded cellblock at the Federal mediumsecurity prison here early today, killing five inmates and leaving 71 others injured in a nightmare of confusion and panic. Authorities said the fire was believed to have been set deliberately.

title: ExDetective Sentenced
description: William O'Rourke, a former New York City Police Department detective, was given a threeyear prison sentence yesterday for bribery in the second degree and attempted bribery after being found guilty of seeking to get two police officers to change their testimony. in a weapons charge against Daniel J.. Marino, who served a prison sentence for this offense.

title: Dance: Brazilian Troupe Appears at City University Mall
description: HE CAPOEIRAS of Bahia, with their raw, colorful energy, will undoubtedly become familiar to larger and larger audiences in the near future. On Wednesday evening, this rhythmic group of singers and dancers appeared at the Graduate Center Mall of City University at 33 West 92d Street, as part of the Clark Center for the Performing Arts summer festival.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, JULY. 8, 1977

title: PORT AGENCY EXTENDS BAN ON THE CONCORDE
description: In spite of pressure from a Federal ap peals court to fix Concorde noise standards with dispatch, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey voted yesterday to extend indefinitely its 13monthold temporary ban on Concorde landings at Kennedy International Airport.

title: Tips on Tickets
description: Tickets to concerts at Tanglewood range from $5 to $15. They may be bought at the box office, open daily from 10 A.M. to 6 P.M., or through Ticketron. Tickets to sit on the lawn are $4 and go on sale two hours before the concert. Box office: (413) 6371600.

title: Dorsett Faces Charges Of Assault in Dallas
description: DALLAS, July 7 (AP)Tony Dorsett, the Dallas Cowboys heralded firstround draft ?? has been charged with two counts of simple assault stemming from ?? incident in a Dallas discotheque last week.

title: Newark's Parking Ban Cuts Congestion and Stirs Anger
description: While controversy over a parking ban continues in Manhattan, the neighboring city of Newark has been successfully limiting its parking for two years, according to Newark and Federal officials.

title: ASSEMBLY PASSES BILL SOUGHT BY INSURERS
description: ALBANY, July 7A bill that wouldraise the ceiling on interest rates paid, by people who borrow against the cash. value of their insurance policies won narrow approval in the Assembly early Thins morning.

title: Park Gets Pop With Less Fizz
description: This summer's Dr. Pepper Central Park Music Festival, which began Wednesday and continues through Aug. 27, is a shorter, blander descendant of the Schaefer Music Festival. The Dr. Pepper format represents a grudging compromise between the forces that have battled over pop concerts in the southeastern corner of Central Park for several years.

title: Plans for $2 Million OpenAir Market Under Queensboro Bridge Are Approved
description: Plans to build a $2 million openair market under the Manhattan end of the Queensboro Bridge were unanimously approved yesterday by the New York City Council.

title: Siamese Twins Separated In an Unusual Operation
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP)Siamese twin girls, joined by what doctors called an extremely rare connection from near the breastbone to the pelvis, were successfully separated at Children's Hospital June 23 in an operation apparently without precedent.

title: Canada Dismisses Atom Agency Head In Wake of Losses
description: OTTAWA, July 7The dismissal of the head of the Government nuclear agency, Atonic Energy of Canada Ltd. was announced today in the aftermath or heavy financial losses on the sale of reactors in deals involving mysterious payments of millions of dollars to agents abroad.

title: Washington Bids Beame Dissolve And Take Over Poverty Council
description: The Federal Government has directed Mayor Beame to dissolve and take over the functions of the Council Against Poverty, the central agency responsible for coordinating the city's antipoverty program. It has threatened to cut off all support to the entire $39 million program.

title: U.S. Jury Indicts ExHead of Parent Of John's Stores
description: Gerald Sprayregen, a New York businessman, was indicted yesterday for allegedly carrying out a scheme to misappropriate more than $2 million from a nowbankrupt company that operated 200 John's Bargain Stores.

title: ADM. EMMET, 895 DIES; SERVED IN TWOWARS
description: Rear Adm. Robert R. M. Emmet, who helped plan the logistics for the invasion of North Africa in World War II, died Wednesday at the Keener Air Force Base Medical Center, Biloxi, Miss. He was 89 years old and a resident of Miami Beach.

title: JANET ALEXANDER WITTER
description: Janet Alexander Witter, a naturalist and photographer who made her home in San Anselmo, Calif., died Tuesday in Roosevelt Hospital. Mrs. Witter, the wife of Wendell W. Witter, a retired investment banker, and the widow of Henry Clay Alexander, who was chairman of the board of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York, was 67 years old.

title: Arab Captives in Gaza Say Israelis Beat Them but Don't Use Torture
description: The following dispatch, by Bernard Edinger, was submitted to the Israeli military censors, who requested under Israeli law that 166 words be deleted on the ground that they disclosed army interrogation techniques. The rest is as submitted to the censor.

title: Belize: Always the Crisis Spot
description: HISTORYBelize, the former British Crown Colony of British Honduras, has been a sore spot in BritishGuatemalan relations since the 19th century. Spanish sailors were the first Europeans to see it in the early 16th century, but British loggers, who arrived more than a century later, became the permanent settlers. Both Mexico and Guatemala, its immediate neighbors, expressed interest in Belize over the years, though no serious Mexican claims have been made on Belize's territory in recent times. Even as it became a crown colony in 1862, Guatemalans claimed it as theirs, citing voluminous data from the Spanish conquest and saying that the British lost their rights to the territory by failing to comply with Article 7 of an 1859 treaty. In this, the British agreed to build a road that would give Guatemala access to the sea in the north. Britain finally did build a crude road in 1948, but for the Guatemalans the gesture came too late. In Guatemala at the moment, there are no that show Belize's existence.

title: Joyce Levin Has Bridal With William C. Kuhn 2d
description: The marriage of Joyce Spence Levin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William D. Levin of Great Neck, L.I., to William Cleveland Kuhn 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kuhn of Costa Mesa, Calif., took place yesterday. The ceremony was performed at the home of the bride's parents by the Rev. Genevieve Henderson of the nondenominational Unity Church in New York.

title: Revolutionary War Heroine. Finally Is Given Recognition
description: Margaret Corbin took over her husband's cannon after he fell mortally viounded, and vainly tried to defend Fort Washington against the British 200 years ago, then faded into oblivion and was nearly forgotten.

title: Modest Increase in Money Supply Leaves Credit Market Unchanged
description: The nation's basic money supplymade lip of currency and checking account balancesrose a modest $100 million in the week ended June 29, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday.

title: Pentagon Hopes to Deploy Neutron W eapons by 1979
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Defense Department plans to deploy in Europe within the next 18 months the socalied neutron bomb, a tactical nuclear weapon designed to kill enemy troops with radiation, if Congress and President Carter give their approval for production of the device.

title: Around The Earth In 100 Maps
description: Journey over all the universe In a map, without the expense and fatigue of traveling, without suffering the inconvenience of heat, cold, hunger and thirst, Cervantes wrote in Don Quixote.

title: ,Country Dining Is About 60 Minutes From Broadway
description: Country dining conjures up an image of far more than just eating a meal nutside the city where hamburgers and fast foods proliferate just as they do in the city. Country dining means gracious dining off the beaten path in bucolic settings that will slow the city dweller's quickening pulse and quicken the slowing esthetic sense. The New York Times has asked its regional food critics in Connecticut. Long Island, New Jersey and Westchester to report on several country dining restaurants each, to be found not more than an hour drive from New York City. They have found dining places of dif. Went types and menus but with this in common: good food and restful atmosphere. Here they explain why this tripwhichever one you are planning to ntakeis necessary.

title: Bridge:
description: New York enthusiasts, accustomed to a July tournament, will find the one beginning today slightly different. It will be a sectional instead of a regional tournament and play will be at the Statler Hilton Hotel instead of the New York Hilton.

title: AUTO OUTPUT IS EXPECTED TO FALL 14% DURING WEEK
description: DETROIT, July 7Domestic auto plants are scheduled to build 167,354 cars this week, 14 percent fewer than a week earlier, according to Ward's Automotive Reports.

description: Musical Theater

title: Publishing: Fourth Of July
description: ULY IS THE MONTH of Ron Kovic's Born on the Fourth of July. His searing personal Vietnam and antiVietnam story comes out in a paperback edition from Pocket Books, a year after its hardcover publication by McGrawHill.

title: MAGAZINE,WRITERS ALLEGE NEWS SERVICEC.I.A. LINK.
description: WASHINGTON, July 7(UPDPenthouse magazine is preparing an article for its August issue alleging intimate ties between the Copley News Service and the Central Intelligence Agency, was learned today.

title: Hof fa Inquiry Has Collapsed, U.S. Aides Say
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The inquiry into the disappearance of James R. Hoffa, former president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, has collapsed, Federal officials close to the case said today. The investigation has cost the Federal Bureau of Investigation more than $1 million over the last two years.

description: TOP WEEKEND FILMS

title: PANEL FAILS TO ACT ON HOSPITALS REPORT
description: A consultant's report commissioned by Mayor Beanie's special panel on city finances recently recommended the sale or leasing of all the city's public hospitalsa highly controversial stepbut the mayoral panel went out of business last week without adopting the recommendation.

title: Wisconsin Swears in New Governor
description: MADISON, Wis., July 7Martin James Schreiber, the man who has been in the shadow of former Gov. Patrick J. Lucey for the last six and a half years, was sworn in today as this state's 40th Governor.

title: PORT AGENCY EXTENDS BAN ON THE CONCORDE
description: In spite of pressure from a Federal appeals court to fix Concorde noise standards with dispatch, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey voted yesterday to extend indefinitely its 13monthold temporary ban on Concorde landings at Kennedy International Airport.

title: U.S. Began Study Of Jail Fire Perils Late Last Month
description: Just 12 days ago, Norman A. Carlson, director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons, ordered a national review of measures aimed at preventing fires such as the one at the Danbury penitentiary yesterday, an aide said.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The International Business Machines Corporation said yesterday that would appeal Tuesday's ruling by the Canadian Federal Court that I.B.M. had infringed on five Xerox Corporation copier patents.

title: Aide to ExSpeaker Carl Albert Denies Working for South Koreans
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Suzy Park Thomson, who worked for former House Speaker Carl Albert for five years, said today that she was not an agent for the South Korean Government and had never received either money or instructions from Tongsun Park or the Korean Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Malawi Leader Dismisses Cabinet and Other Aides
description: BLANTYRE, Malawi, July 7 (Reuters)President H. Katnuzu Banda of Malawi has dismissed his entire Cabinet and all deputy ministers and parliamentary secretaries, the Malawi News Agency reported today.

title: POSIDENT MAY HELP BYRNE IN CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Carter Administration is getting excellent vibrations': about Governor Byrne's reelection chances, and the President may go into Jeriey to help him, New Jersey's Democratac state chairman, Richard J. Coffee, saicrtoday after a series of White House meetings.

title: Jets Offer Domres a Spot as New Players Report
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.L. July 7From obscure colleges and places whose names appear only in the sport pages, rookies and free agents trickled to the opening of the Jets training camp today.

title: CARTER STUDY TAKES MORE HOPEFUL VIEW OF STRATEGY OF U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Carter Administration, in its first comprehensive study of global power relationships, has found the United States and Soviet Union in rough strategic balance and sees future trends as more favorable and less ominous than the Ford Administration thought.

title: Soviet Holds Suspect in June Blast
description: MOSCOW, July 7The security police ?? the unusual step today of announcing, the arrest of a suspect charged with having set off a bomb outside a Moscow hotel last month.

title: Business Held Less Opposed to Ending Gains Tax.
description: WASHINGTON, July 7W. Michael Blumenthal. Secretary of the Treasury. said today that business leaders were less opposed to taxing capital gains at ordinary income tax rates than was commonly supposed.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a typographical error, some words were omitted from a sentence in an article in The Times yesterday on studies linking women who smoke and early menopause. The sentence should have read: The average age for menopause in women who have quit smoking was found to fall between that of light smokers (half a pack a day) and that of women who never smoked.

title: Egyptian Cult Plans. Terror Drive
description: CAIRO, July 7Members IA an underground organization of relious extre mists who killed a former cabibet minister Monday and set off two explosive charges in public places last night, proclaimed a campaign of terror today against the Government and against President Anwar elSadat.

title: Ohio Utility Draws Criticism on Gas In Energy Crisis
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, July 7An Ohio Senate. investigating committee has charged Columbia Gas System Inc. with mishandling natural gas supplies during 1976 and contributing to the energy crisis in Ohio last winter.

title: Curbs on Interracial Sex and Marriage Divide South African Leaders
description: JOHANNESBURG, July 7South Afri can laws that forbid sex, and marriage between whites and blacks have become a source of division within the Government, with senior officials clashing pub:. liclv over calls for their repeal.

title: Republicans Seeking County Fund Stall Issues in Albany Legislature
description: ALBANY, July 7Negotiations on the major remaining issues of the legislative session stalled today as the Senate Republican leadership continued to hold out for a $40 million program of state aid to the 57 nonNew York City counties.

title: People and Business
description: Charles A. Carlson Jr., who has been president of the Lukens Steel Company for the last year, was elected yesterday vice chairman of the Coatesville, Pa., company. At the same time, William E. Mullestein, chairman and chief executive officer, announced that he would retire from active company management in August 1978.

title: Chinese Air Force Fighter Pilot Defects to Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, July 7A Chinese Air Force pilot broke away from the squadron he was leading on a routine patrol mission today and defected to Taiwan, outracing pursuing jet fighters into Taiwanese airspace.

title: Invasion of Gypsy Moths Prompts State Query on Spraying Program
description: TRENTON, July 7Startled by an unexpected migration of gypsy moths from northern Pennsylvania, the State Department of Agriculture is about to canvass 60 to 80 municipalities in New Jersey to determine whether they want to take part in a spraying program next spring to protect their trees.

title: TIMES ERRED IN 75 ARTICLE INVOLVING NATHAN LEWIN
description: In the January 22, 1975 edition of The New York Times, an article appeared dealing with Bernard Bergman, a nursing home operator, and his appearance before a Senate subcommittee. The article noted, among other things, that Mr. Bergman was represented by Nathan Lewin, a Washington attorney.

title: Red Smith
description: A passel of meaty young animals who hope to be gainfully employed by the New Yotk Jets for the rest of the year presented their credentials to Walt Michaels, the new coach, last night. Not long ago the idea of opening training camp on July 7 would have been preposterous, but in football nothing remains unchanged for long. For example, the chances are that none of the players who shaped up Hofstra University, and perhaps none of the coaches, ever saw a field goal or a point after touchdown made with dropkick, although this used to be preferred as faster and more accurate than the placekick and is still a legal method of scoring under the rules. For the benefit of young clients, it may even be desirable

title: Recent Supreme Court Rulings Have Set Back Women's Rights
description: WASHINGTON, July 7In rulings with consequences for thousands, perhaps millions, of women, the Supreme Court in its 197677 term handed down decisions counter to the thrust of women's rights advocates on critical matters ranging from abortion to seniority. The rulings will especially affect prospects of women in the job market, innidng it harder both to get jobs and to keep them.

title: U.S Taking Over Regulation of Rents At Lincoln Towers
description: The Federal Government has taken over rent regulation at one of New York City's largest apartment developments, Lincoln Towers in Manhattan, and is prepared to authorize sharply higher rent rises in lease renewals than many of the tenants would have faced under the city rent rules, which have been superseded.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Thomas E. Mullaney reports on the views of Bert Lance, director of the Office of Management and Budget, on the state of the nation's economy: Pleased, but not satisfied. Page D5.

title: SUPPORT PETITIONS FILED BY CANDIDATES
description: Seeking to dramatize a claimed comeback from a first term in which he presided over a city that tottered close to default, Mayor Beame filed more than 100,000 signatures in support of his reelection yesterday.

title: New Customs in an Old House
description: Rainbows are appearing In the old United States Custom House on Bowling Green these days, and sculptures are starting to climb the marble walls.

description: Stock prices edged higher yesterday as selected energy issues continued to gain and a smattering of strength appeared in the recently battered blue chips.

description: DETROIT, July 7The jury of nine men and three women in the Ann Arbor Veterans Administration Hospital case began on June 29 to consider the fate of Leonora M. Perez and Filipina B. Narciso, who are charged with poisoning nine patients in the summer of 1975.

description: PHILADELPHIA, July 7The Mets tonight reached some depths reminiscent of their hapless beginnings in the early 1960's'as they lost again to the Phillies, 64, for their eighth straight defeat.

description: PHILADELPHIA, July 7 (AP)A Redd.; al District Court ruled today that the National Labor Relations Act does not apply to lay teachers in religious schools.

title: Notes on People

Mr. Shack, who as head of the A. P. A. offices in Miami represented Miss Bryant for 16 years, is the husband of Ruth Shack, a Dade County Commissioner who introduced and marshaled passage of an ordinance guaranteeing equal rights for homosexuals in hiring and housing. The law was repealed by a Bryantled referendum campaign.

The oneday wonders have vanished, as expected, after the second round of the 106th British Open golf championship and, also as expected, the established American pros have reclaimed their turf.
