title: Texaco Ordered to Stop Using Gas From Federal Leases in Refinery
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Federal Power Commission today charged Texaco Inc. with violating the Natural Gas Act of 1938 in using gas from Federal offshore leases in a refinery. It ordered the company to halt the practice.

title: San Juan Racing Is Discussing Sale Of One or More of Its Divisions
description: The San Juan Racing Associationowner of a $45 million race track in Puerto Rico, eight radio stations in the United States and a professional soccer team known as the Washington Diplomatsdisclosed yesterday that it was discussing the sale of one or more divisions.

title: Mauritanian Envoy in Paris Is Shot
description: PARIS, July 7 (AP)Two young gunmen fired six bullets at the Mauritanian Ambassador to Paris through the back window of his chauffeurdriven car near his residence this morning and fled on foot. The 36yearold envoy, Ahmed Ould Ghanahallah, was hit in the jaw, arm, shoulder and thigh but was reported out of danger at the American Hospital in Netullv.

title: WATER SHORTAGE WORSE IN MARYLAND SUBURBS
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP)Officials in two suburban counties declared today that a water shortage had reached emergency proportions and ordered major businesses and industries to close.

title: Yugoslavia Expels 4 Frenchmen
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, July 7 (AP)Yugoslav authorities said they expelled four Frenchmen today because they had planned to protest Soviet human rights violations at the conference here on the 1975 Helsinki accords. They were Jean Edern Hallier, a novelist; Jean Marie Deosiste, writer and philosopher; Francois Denegroni, a sociology writer, and Ilias Yannakakes, social history professor at Lille University.

title: Suspect Turns Himself In
description: The fourth and final suspect in the kidnapping and murder of the 19yearold nephew of Mayor Steve Cappiello of Hoboken has turned himself in, the police said.

title: Ice Break,
description: LONDON, July 7 (Reuters)  Sir Michael Tippett, widely considered Britain's greatest living composer, was given a rapturous ovation here tonight after the world premiere of his opera The Ice Break, a work with a sizable American flavor both in theme and production,

title: Fluke and Blues Dominate Catches in Nearby Waters
description: AREA A  Captain Andy's Marina at Margate, N.J., reports a fine run of bluefish in the 10to12pound range in 60 to 65 feet of water off Great Egg Inlet. Green lures are a hot item. recently with trollers using Bengal Lancers and Bengal Bananas. Fluke fishing is excellent in Margate Bay. The Lighthouse Marina at Barnegat reported that earlier this week, six fishermen brought in 49 blues weighing more than 500 pounds. Cap Colvin at Point Pleasant reports that blues are still 30 miles off shore, but that catchei of 5 to 12 pounds have been made by fishermen willing to go out that far. In Barnegat Bay, weakfish and blacks have been caught in good numbers with crabs and squid.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed in order of post positions

title: Lunch for Empress Interrupted By Shout of Down With Shah
description: A luncheon at the Pierre Hotel honoring Empress Farah of Iran was interrupted yesterday by a woman screaming, Down with the Shah, while outside more than 1,500 demonstrators slowed Fifth Avenue traffic.

title: Caesars Palace Chosen As NortonYoung Site
description: The site of the Ken NortonJimmy Young heavyweight boxing match on Nov. 5 was announced yesterday as Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, Nev. The purse, an estimated $3.25 million, will be the largest in history for a nontitle fight.

title: Parties Name a President for India
description: NEW DELHI, July 7The speaker of the lower house of Parliament appeared assured today, of election as President of India as the governing Janata Party nominated him and all opposition parties concurred.

title: Purcell Sets Record
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July 7 (UPI)A cart piled high with petitions containing 97,248 signatures for Francis T. Purcell, Presiding Supervisor of Hempstead, was presented to the Nassau County Board of Elections today.

title: PERTH AMBOY FACES WATER CUTOFF CRISIS
description: PERTH AMBOY, July 7This city of 39,000 across the Arthur Kill from Staten Island may have to take drastic action soon unless its water supply is restored, Fredy J. Mazurek, the community's Director of Economic Development, said today following the state's closing of the city's wells last Friday because of contarhination.

title: JUNE RETAIL SALES SOMEWHAT WEAKER; APPAREL SECTOR OFF
description: Some signs of erosion in retail sales appeared last month, particularly women's apparel and men's wear, according to reports issued yesterday by 15 of the country's largest retailers.

title: 10 JOURNALISTS ARE NAMED WALTER BAGEHOT FELLOWS
description: Ten journalists have been selected as Walter Bagehot Fellows in Economics and Business Journalism at the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism., the university announced yesterday.

title: indicated Earnings Hold Steady at Dow
description: The Dow Chemical Company, the first in the chemical industry to report indicated results for the second quarter, said yesterday evenings would be about the same as the $155 million, or 84 cents a share, realized in the June quarter of 1976, Sales are estimated at about $1.5 billion, up 10 percent from the $1.4 billion for the three months ended June 30, 1976,

title: British in Contact With P.L.O.
description: LONDON, July 7 (Reuters)British officials have had unofficial contacts in London from time to time with members of the Palestine Liberation Organization, a Foreign Office spokesman said today. But he added that British ministers had stressed that the Government would not be able to extend offiical recognition to the P..LO. until it recognized, the existence of Israel.

title: F.P.C. Right to Help In Legal Fees Upset
description: Reversing an earlier appellate ruling, a Federal appeals court has decided that the Federal Power Commission lacks the authority to help pay legal fees incurred by conservationists or other parties who intervene in proceed: pgs before the regulatory agency.

title: Winfield Pact for 4 Years
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 7 (AP)Dave Winfield's new contract with the San Diego Padres is for four years and totals $1.25 million, it was learned today. Previously, the new pact was reported to be for $1.3 million over three years.

title: Hijacker's Victim Has No Grudge
description: The first man shot in last Monday's 10hour bus hijacking said yesterday that he had no desire for revenge and that he hoped nothing in the incident would serve to spread hatred.

title: Fair Play for Both Sides
description: Taxexempt foundations should not be encumbered by unnecessary restrictions if they are to boldly undertake imaginative programs in areas neglected by the timid or pragmatic political establishment.

title: Pop Music: Manhattan Transfer Outdoors
description: HE SCHAEFER Festival of popular music in Central Park is no more, but the Dr. Pepper Festival, which began Wednesday evening, bears more than a passing resemblance to it. Ron Delsener is still the producer, the tickets are still cheap though at $4 for orchestra seats, they are reflecting the inflationary spiraland the concerts still begin early, at 6 or 6:30 P.M.

title: 70 Percent of U.S. Rivers Below Normal Last Month,
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP)The Unit;., ed States Geological Survey reported today that 70 percent of the nation's streams and rivers had less than normal flows of water in June, although there were fewer record lows than in May.

title: The Pop Life
description: HAT WILL BECOME of Crystal Gayle? For a while she both benefited and suffered from the fact that she is Loretta Lynn's younger sister. Benefited in the sense that she got valuable exposure touring with Miss Lynn and publicity from the fact of her relationship; suffered in that she had to work doubly hard to prove herself on her own.

title: Restaurants
description: Mimi Sheraton

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: LUDWIG KAPHAN
description: Ludwig Kaphan, a retired high school principal, died Wednesday at his St Petersburg, Fla. home. He was 90 years old.

title: U.S. and Soviet: Time of Testing
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Carter Administration, which concedes that it did not expect the sharp reaction its policies evoked in the Soviet Union, believes that it is entering a crucial period that will test the United States contention that.

title: SURVEY SHOWS ADVANCE IN CONSUMER CONFIDENCE
description: Two measures of consumer attitudesa consumer confidence index and a buying plans indexturned up sharply in June, the Conference Board reported yesterday.

title: Howard University Aide May Head Peace Corps
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Top officials of Action, the volunteer agency of the Federal Government, are believed to have recommended the appointment of Dr. Carolyn Payton, director of counseling at Howard University, as director of the Peace Corps.

title: CREDITOR LANDS STRETCH ZAIRE'S DEBT PAYMENTS
description: PARIS, July 7 (AP)  Eleven major creditor countries of the African nation of Zaire said today they had agreed to stretch out the nation's payments on the largest part of the debt.

title: Koussevitsky Night Opens Tanglewood
description: There may well be a special emotional flavor to tonight's opening concert of the Tanglewood Festival in Lenox, Mass, Leonard Bernstein, who will lead the Boston Symphony, soloists and chorus in Bach's Magnificat and Haydn's Lord Nelson Mass, is dedicating the evening to the memory of Serge Koussevitsky  a conductor whose long association with the symphony, its summer home at Tanglewood and Mr. Bernstein as well has already become something of a Berkshire legend.

title: Giants Sign Jeter for 3 Years
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., July 7Gary Jeter, the defensive lineman who is the Giants No. 1 draft choice, signed three oneyear contracts with the National Football League team today and said he was happy with what I got.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TOMORROW, July

title: BritishGuatemala Cocktail Party Ends 2Day Flurry Over Eelize
description: WASHINGTON, July 7  Britain and Guatemala confronted each other in both Central America and Washington today in their continuing dispute over the British territory of Belize, but by the end of the day their latest crisis appeared to have dissolved into an amicable cocktail party.

title: Advertising
description: When he's talking about what he's doing with his magazine, Carll Tucker. the 25yearold president of the Saturday Review Magazine Corporation, uses the word aggressive a lot.

title: Italian Journalist Is Shot, Fourth in Two Months
description: ABANO TERME, Italy, July 7 (AP)A reporter for the Venice newspaper Gazzettino was shot and wounded in the legs today in the fourth such attack on an Italian journalist in two months, the police reported.

title: FOUR ARRESTED ON USURY IN BRONX VICTIM'S HOME
description: A loan shark and three henchmen were arrested yesterday at the home of a Bronx dentist who was being shaken down for a gambling debt, the police said.

title: Beame in Bid to Carey
description: Mayor Beame has asked Governor. Carey to get permission from the Federal Government to call off an onerous courtordered parking ban in midtown Manhattan. A spokesman for the Governor said the Mayor's letter was being studied.

title: Curb Sought on Labels on OverCounter Pain Killers
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (UPI)Scientists reviewing nonprescription pain relievers said today that although aspirin did relieve pain and inflammation caused by arthritis the labels on such products should not say that they were for the treatment of that disease because that could lead people to selfdiagnose their illnesses incorrectly.

title: 7 Gets a Heavy Play on 7/7/77
description: Luck beat the odds at Belmont Park yesterday, 7/7/77, when three horses carrying the number seven made it to the winner's circle.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: By CATHERINE M. BYRNE

title: CHINESE DELEGATION HERE DURING 22DAY TOUR OF U.S.
description: A 12member delegation from the Chinese People's Institute of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in China is here this week for tours and meetings as part of a 22day visit to the United States.

title: Clash Expected Over Plan To Sell Iran Radar Planes
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (Reuters)  The Defense Department today notified Congress of a proposed $1.2 billion sale of seven controversial radar planes to Iran, setting the stage for a bitter legislative battle.

title: Eagleton Institute Widening PollTaking To the Many Facets of New Jersey Life
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, July 7The Eagleton Institute of Politics at Rutgers University, which has probed the political awareness of New Jerseyans for several years, is now attempting to hold a mirror up to the many other facets of life in the state.

title: Hoffa Inquiry Has Collapsed, U.S. Aides Say
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The inquiry into the disappearance of James It Hoffa, former president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, has collapsed, Federal officials close to the case said today. The investigation has cost the Federal Bureau of Investigation more than $1 million over the last two years.

title: ALASKAN OIL SEEN ADDING TO OUTPUT IN U.S. IN JULY
description: Alaskan oil production is apparently beginning to show up in United States crude oil output figures, according to the latest weekly report released yesterday by the American Petroleum Institute.

title: Millions in Hughes Cash Assets Were Dissipated, Tax Aide Says
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 7A new mystery in the affairs o the late Howard It Hughes has come to light with the disclosure in court documents filed in Wilmington, Del., that about $600 million in cash went out of the industrialist's liquid assets account in the last I0 years of his life.

title: Commodity Spot Market Index Advances to 207.1 From 206.7
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 207.1 from 206,7 the preceding week.

title: Broadway
description: AMMY DAVIS JR. will return to Broadway, where he has not been since he did Golden Boy in 1964, for a while next spring. He will appear in Stop the World, which sounds like Stop the World, I Want to Get Off, and in fact is its updated version. The original Stop the World, written by Anthony Newley and Leslie Bricusse, and starring Mr. Newley, was here in 1962, and for this new version Mr. Newley and Mr. Bricusse will add at least one song and perhaps tinker with the book. The producer will be Hilly Elkins.

title: Upstate Prison Inmates Strike Against Conditions
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 7Prisoners at the Green Haven Correctional Facility struck today to protest prison conditions and the Legislature's asserted inaction on measures that would change the parole and temporaryrelease program and the method of computing time off for good behavior.

title: Nancy Ellen Forman, Student, Is Wed to Dr. Stephen Gould
description: Nancy Ellen Forman, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Charles Forman of New Rochelle, N.Y., was married yesterday at the home of her parents to Dr. Stephen E. Gould of Boston. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip R. Gould of New York. Rabbi Amiel Wohl performed the ceremony.

title: Art People
description: Grace Glueck

title: Carey Rejects 19 Pension Items
description: ALBANY, July 7Governor Carey informed legislative leaders today that he would accept only three of the 22 pension items that had been buried within a bill intended to implement the state's labor agreements with its employees.

title: N.B.A. Owners Will Meet on Nets
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., July 7Larry O'Brien, the commissioner, has called the National Basketball Association owners into an emergency session regarding the territorial controversy that has developed between the Knicks and the Nets. The meeting will be held next Wednesday at the O'Hare Hilton Hotel in Chicago.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a typographical error, some words were omitted from a sentence in, an article in The Times yesterday on studies linking women who spoke and early menopause. The sentence should have read: The average for menopause in women who have quit smoking was found to fall between. that of light smokers (half a pack a day) and that of women who never smoked.

title: Washington Bids Beame Dissolve Poverty Council and Assume Role
description: The Federal Government has directed Mayor Beame to dissolve the Council Against Poverty and to take over the functions of the agency, which is responsible for coordinating the city's antipoverty program. The, Government has threatened to cut off all support to the entire $39 million program.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: CEMETERIES SINGLE MI. Ararat, Farming dale, Perpetual care Included $175. 516022.7235

title: Belmont Racing
description: RESULTS

title: Jersey Gets Rich Pace Off Ground
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., July 7The talk among horsemen at the Meadowlands this week has been the sky's the limit. It came as no surprise, therefore, that post, positions for next Tuesday night's $425,000 Meadowlands

title: Amid the Darkness and Smoke, Scenes of Bravery and Anguish
description: DANBURY, Conn, July 7'I saw smoke coming out, and I saw all the heads at the windows, and my mind was saying: This can't be happening, this isn't real.

title: 100 Bills Affecting Women Are Still Before Congress
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Over 100 bills and resolutions that would affect women have been introduced in the 95th Congress. Legislation that is still pending includes:

title: GOVERNOR SIGNS BILL ON GAS
description: ALBANY, July 7Governor Carey today signed into law a bill that nullifies any franchise arrangement under which an oil company forces one of its gasolinestation operators to sell that company's tires, batteries or automobile accessories or prohibits him from selling the products of another company.

title: Alaska Pipeline Reopens After Break Is Repaired
description: ANCHORAGE, July 7 (AP)Oil re sumed moving through the transAlaska pipeline today, about 64 hours after section of pipe broke Monday and forced a shutdown of the 800mile line. The mishandling of frigid liquid nitrogen apparently caused the break in an Lshape section of pipe, according to sources at the Alyeska Pipeline Service Company

title: ANATOLY A. SKOCHILOV
description: MOSCOW, July 7 (Reuters)Anatoly A. Skochilov, Communist Party secretary of Ulyanovsk Province on the Volga River, has died after a long illness, the party daily, Pravda, reported today. He was 65.

title: Pakistani Military Rulers Name New Civilian Aides
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan Juy 7Pakistah's new Military rulers announced some key appointmente today as they moved to restore a national confidence shaken by the turmoil of recent

title: Emerson, Lake and Palmer Go Classical
description: A 70piece symphony orchestra will be performing in Madison Square Garden tonight and tomorrow night. Each of the instruments is individually amplified with a special pickup, and the sound, projected out into the hall by the stateoftheart publickidress system used at the Montreal Olympic Games, should be both the loudest and the clearest of any symphony orchestra in the world.

title: SOYBEAN PRICES OFF ON RAIN IN MIDWEST
description: Unexpected rains over 65 percent of Iowa and showers also in Minnesota and Wisconsin led to further heavy selling of soybean futures contracts yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. For the fourth session in a row, the oldcrop months of July and August dropped the daily limit of 30 cents a bushel.

title: Court Limits Subpoenas of Records
description: In an opinion that some prosecutors said would hamper their investigations into whitecollar crime, the New York State Court of Appeals ruled yesterday that a grand jury could not compel witness to surrender possession of business records to a prosecutor.

title: OPEC to Meet Next Week.
description: STOCKHOLM, July 7 (UPI)  The economic commission of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries met today in preparation for a meeting next week of OPEC's oil ministers. OPEC Secretary General Ali Mohammed Jaideh of Qatar said the meeting is not going to discuss oil prices. Mr. Jaideh said a fullscale OPEC conference, to open in Sweden July 12, will center around the question of indexingattuning oil prices to inflation and the competitiveness of oil compared with other energy sources.

title: New Viaduct in Newark
description: A $10 million highway viaduct was opened in Newark to relieve traffic congestion along Route 22. The 1.3 mile steelandconcrete viaduct willr.Ve used for eastbound traffic over Meelier Avenue, Empire Street, Frelinghuysen Avenue and a Conrail yard.

title: The Arts Move Outdoors
description: NOW THAT the first big festivalfilled weekend of the summer is behind us, it is time perhaps to consider and savor the many attractions around the metropolitan area that combine entertainment with the out of doors and will remain with us for the next two Months.

title: Nabokov's Body Is Cremated
description: VEVEY, Switzerland, July 7 (AP)The remains of Vladimir Nabokov, the writer, were cremated here today in a quiet ceremony attended by his family and a few friends. He died Saturday at his hotel home in Montreux at the age of 78.

title: Nation Facing Crucial Decisions Over Policies on Communications
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Fundamental changes in the way that Americans communicate are forcing the Federal Government to make policy decisions that could alter the fortunes of the nation's largest communication organizations and the lives of most citizens.

title: Prosecutor Goldstein, on the Merits
description: The main obstacle to insuring that only highly qualified persons are appointed to the office of United States Attorney was summed up recently by Attorney General Griffin Bell when he told the American Law Institute: The law places the nomination responsibility and power with the President. The power to advise and consent rests with the Senate. In practice, however, the Senate proposes and the President advises and consents.

title: A Bronxville Man, 32, Is Killed As He Tries to Scale the Eiger
description: LAUTERBRUNNEN, Switzerland, July 7 (AP)An American fell 600 feet to his death while trying to scale the western face of 13,036foot Mount Eiger in the Bernese Alps.

title: Art: Prints on the Menu
description: HE MUSEUMS are serving summer fare again, collations consisting mainly of salads with little meat and no potatoes. Salads can be refreshing, of course, and if you don't expect a fullscale meal, you'll enjoy Childe Hassam as Printmaker: A Selection in Various Media, on view (through Sept. 11) in the delightfully airconditioned prints and drawings gallery of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Kickbacks Admitted
description: Raymond Graber, a former Hempstead Town official, pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor charge of soliciting.. political contributions on government properly before the start of his trial on that charge. Judge Alfred F. Samenga of Nassau County Court sentenced the former official to a oneyear conditional discharge. He could have received a jail sentence of one year, a $1,000 fine, or both.

title: Jazz: Classy Laurindo Almeida Trio at Hopper's
description: Laurindo Almeida, the Brazilian guitarist, is something of a stranger in New York jazz circles. This is partly because he lives and works primarily, in California, but even more because he is basically a Classical guitarist whose relationship with jazz stems from a period in the late 40's when he was a featured soloist with Stan Kenton's orchestra.

title: Iowa Judge Rules Banks May Charge Higher Rates For BankAmericard Use
description: DES MOINES, July 7 (AP)Federally chartered outofstate banks can legally charge their Iowa BankAmericard customers higher interest rates than state law allows, Polk County District Court Judge Harry Perkins has ruled.

title: Member of Inquiry Into Bribery Scandal Seeks Nixon Tapes
description: WASHINGTON,. July 7A Republican member of the House ethics committee, Representative Bruce F. Caputo of Westchester, said today that he would ask the committee to seek access to White House tapes in search of information on an alleged coverup of the Korean bribery scandal here.

title: Dividends
description: THURSDAY, JULY 7, 1977

title: U.S. Suing Enderle Metal
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (UPI)  The Enderle Metal Products Company of Los Angeles and Arthur L. Enderle, its general manager, were charged today with cont spiring with other unnamed concerns to fix wholesale prices of furnace pipe fit tings. The Justice Department charged in a criminal information filed in the District Court in San Francisco that the conspiracy began in January 1975.

title: Our Debt to Indochina's Refugees
description: America's doors have been virtually closed since January to Indochinese fleeing the Communist regimes of Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia. Even temporary havens are denied them by Japan, Taiwan, Singapore and other Asian nations because the promise of later settlement elsewhere is no longer forthcoming. About 100,000 refugees remain in limbo in Southeast Asia, mostly in Thailand, and more than 6,000 of them are barred even from leaving the small boats in which they fled from Vietnam.

title: Environment: Fresh Worries
description: Environmentalists jubilation over the accession of the environmentally minded Carter Administration is now being matched by their dismay over proposals of the Presidents reorganization team to downgrade the Council on Environmental Quality. A state of optional courses of action on this News was presented to the PresiAnalysis dent by aides yesterday for a decision by July 15.

title: Baltimore Firemen End Slowdown
description: BALTIMORE, July 7 (AP)Firetighters have voted overwhelmingly to end a sixday job action and return to duty after, the city warned them of possible layoffs and fines. The slowdown by Baltimore City Firefighters Local 734 cost the city an estimated $100,000 in overtime pay when the firemen, protesting wage cutbacks, answered only ambulance and emergency calls, refused to do routine housekeeping and filing, and reported to sick call at the start of their shifts.

title: Venezuelan Debt at $3.7 Billion
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, July 7 (UPI)Venezuela's debt to foreign lenders will total more than $3.7 billion by the end of this year, Finance Minister Hector Hurtado, said today. Debt service costs II are expected to total $960 million.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: Basically, kids come in three camping models: carryalong, anchored and catchmeifyoucan. There is a form of camping suitable for each stage of the youngster's mobility, and the secret of harmonious outdoor living lies in keying your camping style to what your kids can handle.

title: ExAssemblyman Guilty Of Defrauding Union
description: Former Assemblyman Michael J. Capanegro of Queens was convicted late yesterday on Federal charges that he had embezzled $29,000 from Local 1101 of the Communications Workers of America in 1971 and 1972 when he was a lawyer for the union.

title: Antiques
description: HE FLAG EXPERTS Boleslaw and Marie  Louise D'Otrange Mastai reviewed the history of the American flag and their own formidable collection brilliantly in a book published in 1973. For many readers, however, the book seemed an appetizer for the sort of museum show the couple had proved should now be nossible.

title: Lance on the U.S. Economy: Pleased, but Not Satisfied
description: WASHINGTONOutside the massive gray Executive Office Building on Pennsylvania Avenue, the weather was sultry try earlier this week. Salubrious conditions, by contrast, prevailed inside the ancient structure of highceilinged

title: Spite Fence
description: VALLEY STREAM, L.I., July 7The spite fence. which has kept the Alexander's store here in virtual quarantine from the adjacent Green Acres Shopping Center for a decade, came down today.

title: Agriculture in France Now Solidly Profitable
description: CANAPLES, France  When Jean Gaffet inherited his 120acre farm almost a generation ago, he cast a cold, hard look at his holdings the land, some animals, a tractor and that was about itand decided he would have to reorganize things drastically if he was going to carve out a better living than his parents had.

title: CARTER STUDY TAKES MORE HOPEFUL VIEW OF STRATEGY OF U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Carter Administration, in its first comprehensive study of global power relationships, has found the United States and Soviet Union in rough strategic balance and sees future trends as more favorable and less ominous than the Ford Administration thought.

title: Studying the Eerie Light of Earthquakes
description: A recently compiled collection of photographs of earthquake light flares. in the sky in Japan, combined with reports from visiting scientists of the strange lightingup of the sky during the massive earthquake in Tangshan, China, last year, have led researchers to begin scientific investigation of the phenomenon.

title: Stage: Three penny Opera
description: N ITS MOVE from Lincoln Center to Central Park, Richard Foreman's version of the Bertolt BrechtKurt Weill Threepenny opera emerges lightened and somewhat simplified. In a way, this to the good. The original indoor production had a number of virtues but it was heavily mannered, frequently choked and only partly successful.

title: Raymond Burns, Former Chairman Of Bums Security Agency, Was 91
description: Raymond J. Burns, who with his father founded Burns International Security Services, died yesterday at Roosevelt Hospital. He was 91 years old.

title: New Face: Annie Cordy
description: There's a scene in High Street, a BelgianFrench movie playing at the Quad Cinema, in which Mimi, a madwoman who is tormented by memories of the seizure of her Jewish husband and the death of her child during World War II, finds a moment of joy in a country field outside Brussels. She breaks into a tentative dance, nothing more than a single skip, her arms thrust toward the sky, but it's clearly a step out of the madness that has circumscribed her life for a quarter of a century.

title: 3 Indicted on Fraud
description: Three former employes of the Mount. Carmel Guild of Newark were indicate Thursday for allegedly defrauding the charitable organization of more than $15,000.

title: Skokie'
description: SKOKIE, Ill., July 7The handful of swaggering Chicago Nazis who keep planning to march in this peaceful suburb may not look like much of a threat, but to the large Jewish community in Skokie they are seen as a clear and present danper, a menacing and painful reminder of the deaths of six million Jews at the hands of Hitler's Germany.

title: $301,375 in Questionable Payoffs Uncovered by Clark Equipment
description: WASHINGTON, July 7  The Clark Equipment Company has uncovered questionable payments totaling $301,375 in addition to the $85,000 it reported last summer, according to a company filing made available today at the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, JULY 8, 1977

title: Deaths
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 1543??? UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 13900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 9.5300; NASSAU CO. ??? 747.0500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 4691800; CONNECTICUT (203) ???.

title: 2 TO SPEND 45 WEEKENDS IN JAIL FOR FRAUD SCHENE.
description: Sentences of 45 weekends in were imposed yesterday in Federal Dig,: trict Court in Manhattan on a former bank official and an accountant wh had admitted their involvement in kickback scheme involving $2.3 ??? in fraudulent bank loans.

title: The U.N. Today
description: July 8, 1977

title: 46 Yachts Set Sail on Sound In 80Mile Invitational Regatta
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., July 7Under steel blue sky and into a fiveknot breeze, 46 yachts plowed acros the starting line today in The New York Times New YorkNew London Invitational Sail Regatta, the final event in the East Coast Harbor Festival.

title: Retirement on Short Notice
description: New York State law prohibits employers from discriminating against anyone less than 65 on grounds age, which is to say it permits employers to require retirement after 65. By eliminating the number 65, the State Assembly has now decided, at a stroke, prohibit all mandatory retirement programs, to throw pension and other contractual arrangements into financial and actuarial confusion, to raise yet another barrier to the operation of business in the state, and to delay immeasurably younger persons from obtaining jobs and promotions.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: GOV. DU PONT OF DELAWARE IS OVERRIDDEN ON BUDGET
description: DOVER, Del., July 7 (UPI)The Democrats triumphed in their first major confrontation with Gov. Pierre S. du Pont, but only after pulling a senator from vacation in Ohio to cast the deciding vote.

title: Isabelle's Unveiling Proves a Smash
description: UPTON, L.I., July 7Brookhaven National Laboratory took the wraps off a piece of Isabelle today. It evidently hopes that a glimpse of her will spur Congress to provide $173 million more to see the rest of what could become the world's most powerful subatomic proton smasher.

title: The Standings
description: Friday, July 8, 1977

title: Newark's Parking Ban Cuts Congestion and Stirs Anger
description: While controversy over a parking ban continues in Manhattan, the neighboring city of Newark has been successfully limiting its parking for two years, according to Newark and Federal officials.

title: Jewish Group Closes Argentine Office, Cites Threats
description: The American Jewish Committee, after operating for 29 years in Argentina, is closing its office in Buenos Aires and protesting antiSemitic and antiAmerican threat* against its chief representative and his family.

title: M. HALSEY THOMAS, 74, ARCHIVIST AT PMNCEMN
description: PRINCETON, NJ., July 7M. Halsey Thomas, the first man to serve as archivist at Princeton University and a noted historical editor, died today at the Prince. ton Medical Center after a long illness. He was 74 years old.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: Suburban high schoolsalways the bellwether of American education appear to be abandoning the freewheeling Do Your Own Thing philosophy of the 1960's. A survey by Edward B. Fiske, The Times's education editor, found a spreading reaction against the cafeteria school that let students elect most of their courses, often to the detriment of the hard subjects, such as mathematics, science, foreign languages and classical literature.

title: TV Producers Seek Talk Show for Youlig
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 7 (AP) Two television producers are trying to build a weekly halfhourtalk show around Andrew Young, the American representative to the United Nations, one of his associates said, and Andy Young is willing to go along with if they can work it out.

title: Investigation of Slaying
description: The Atlantic County Prosecutor's office said organized crime might have been involved in the executionstyle slaying of a tailor in Pomona.

title: Books: Warm Light on Yiddish Stage
description: HE MANY THOUSANDS of homeowners in their suburban shtetls who never understood why their Jewish immigrant

title: Mayor Beame's Smoggy View
description: The socalled airpollution and autocontrol plan that was finally put forward by the city this week after more than three years of litigation is only the latestand most transparenteffort by Mayor Beanie to delay and if possible to evade altogether any really effective city action to clear up the intolerable traffic mess that is contributing so severely to the strangulation of New York.

title: Port Authority Is Moving to Modify Policies on Travels of Its Officials
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said yesterday that it would review and modify its expense account policies, which have come under criticism in the last few days.

title: Gordon Pairing Takes Medal In Golf Playoff
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., July 7The West Course at Winged Foot Golf Club has been too exacting for many golfers, including some of the best and strongest young men in the game. But it was just right today for Ken Gordon, a 61yearold official of the United States Golf Association, and his 37yearold partner, Eric Gleacher, as they won the medal in the 41st, annual John G. Anderson Memorial tournament.

title: Reuschel, the Cubs
description: Rick Reuschel, bidding to become the National League's starting pitcher in the AllStar Game at Yankee Stadium on July 19, gained his 12th victory yesterday as the Chicago Cubs opened a fourgame series at home against St. Louis with a 20 triumph.

title: U.S. and Soviet Meet On Chemical Weapons
description: GENEVA, July 7 (Reuters)The United States and the Soviet Union began round of private talks here today on possible joint move toward an international agreement banning the most dangerous chemical weapons.

title: Books of The Times
description: HERE seem to be two models of political autobiography coming off the line in this country. The first might be called the Statesman, even though the author rarely is one. It is a dull, dignified, sensible tourdoor sedan.

title: Sheriff Gets a Standing Ovation At His Arraignment in Mobile
description: MOBILE, Ala., July 7 (AP)Shiriff Torn Purvis, cheered as he entered a Federal courtroom, pleaded not guilty along with nine of his officers today on charges of plotting the ambush slaying of an inmate shot down in a jail escape. Trial for the 10 was set for Sept. 12.

title: Hunter Stops Indians, 82, With a 4Hitter
description: The Yankees are streaking, the Catfish is winning, and Thurman keeps on catching. All was right last night with the stormy world of George Steinbrenner, Billy Martin and their firstplace ball club, which joined the Red Sox in exceeding one million tin home attendance this season'.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: HE PHIL OCHS Memorial Celebration took place at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum in May of last year, one month after the folk singercomposer's suicide. The warn tribute by friends and fellow musicians was taped by public television station WHYYTV/PhiladelphiaWilmington, and a 90minute television treatment of the event can be seen tomorrow on Channel 13 at 9 P.M.

title: Saratoga Summer For the City Ballet
description: The gentle ladies with their parasols who once favored the spas, avenues and racecourses of fashionable Saratoga Springs, N.Y., would probably feel at home gazing across the sloping, sunlit lawns of the Saratoga Performing Arts Center. What they would have made of the New York City Ballet's astringent neoClassicism is hard to guess. But admirers of the choreographer George Balanchine are likely to provide a good deal of 20thcentury fervor this weekend when the company returns to its summer home. The men are spirited, the women leggy, and the style is contemporary. The center itself is only 11 years old. But the ghosts linger from a splendid gilded past.

title: Dominican Pilot: McNamara
description: LOS ANGELES, July 7 (AP)John McNamara, dismissed earlier this season as manager of the San Diego Padres, has been hired to manage Licey in the Dominican Republic, a club backed by the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Out of Doors
description: MONTAUK, L. HE BRISK northwest wind dropped to a zephyr with the setting sun, an osprey's rasping cry sounded from the twisted oaks on the far shore, and muskrat plowed a furrow through the calm water at the edge of the reeds before me.

title: Tannis A. Puckhafer Is Wed to Steven D. Bauers
description: Tannis Alecia Puckhafer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Richard Puckhafer of North Tarrytown, N.Y., was married yesterday to Steven Dean Bauers, son of Mr. and Mrs. Russell James Bauers of Campo and Santee, Calif. The Rev. Craig Rennebohn performed the ceremony in the chapel of the Plymouth Congregational Church in Seattle, where the bride is an analyst with the SeattleFirst National Bank, and her husband is engaged in urban redevelopment.

title: Landes Files Petitions With Nassau Election Board
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July 7Despite the disappearance of his designating petitions with 14,000 signatures,. Assemblyman Irwin J. Landes today submitted what appeared to be the requisite number of signatures to qualify as a candidate for Nassau County Executive.

title: Dollar Continues Its Slide in New York and Europe
description: The dollar continued to slide against most other world currencies in foreign exchange trading yesterday in New York and abroad, according to the Associated Press. However, it did manage to continue a slight comeback in Tokyo against the Japanese yen for the second day.

title: The Secrecy Czar
description: Admiral Stanfield Turner, the director of the Central Intelligence Agency, is reliably reported to be proceeding at flank speed with his efforts to persuade Congress to create a czar with direct control over the entire intelligence community, including agencies now a part of the Defense and State Departments.

title: Market Place
description: The National Semiconductor Corporation, long troubled by competitive pricing in major product lines, surprised the stock market with earnings in excess of Wall Street estimates in the final quarter of its fiscal year ended May 31.

title: Some Notable People Did Time in Danbury
description: The Danbury Federal Prison has held some notable prisoners in recent years, including several of the men convicted in connection with the Watergate breakin and the Revs. Daniel and Philip Berrigan, who gained prominence for their opposition to United States involvement in Vietnam.

title: Scout Ahead and Be Prepared
description: The best way to succeed in camping, is to get there before the kids do. If at all possible, stalk out a new place before you let the family loose in it. That way, you'll become aware of any local hazards, convenient rest spots for the hike and the perfect frog pond to camp near or stay away from in mosquito season.

title: New Bond Issues
description: Thursday, July 7, 1977

title: British Unions Shattering Accord on Pay Restraint
description: DOUGLAS, Isle of Man, July 7Britain's system of voluntary wage restraints, the instrument with which the Labor Party Government has tried to restore economic wellbeing, lay in ruins today as a result of rebellions by several major I trade unions.

title: Yale Senior Slain in Scarsdale; Boyfriend Surrenders to Priest
description: SCARSDALE, July 8A 20yearold Yale senior, the daughter of a Manhattan lawyer, was fatally bludgeoned with a claw hammer in a bedroom in her family's sprawling Tudor home early yesterday. A young man described as her boyfriend, a Yale graduate who had been staying at her home and who was depicted as an outstanding student and an allAmerican boy, surrendered later to an upstate priest and confessed, the authorities said.

title: Ecevit's Failure in Turkey May Bar Cyprus Solution
description: ATHENS, July 8The failure of Bulent Ecevit and his Social Democrats to form a new government in Turkey could seriously hamper efforts to settle the problem of Cyprus, according to analysts throughout this region.

title: Former Gulf and Western Council Is Given Prison Stay on an Appeal
description: The former general counsel of Gulf and Western Industries Inc. has appealed his sentence for check forgery and will remain out of prison until at least next

title: Dow Jones Net Gains Despite Observer Loss
description: Dow Jones & Company reported yesterday a 42 percent profit increase for the second quarter despite a loss of $627,000, or 4 cents a share incurred for the recent discontinuance of The National Observer last Sunday.

title: Pennsylvanians Indicted In Polluting of River
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 8 (UPI): Five Burks County residents and two concerns were indicted today on charges stemming from the alleged discharge of chemical wastes into the Delaware River Iasi spring in violation of pollution contro; and harbors laws.

title: Watkins Glen Is Alive With a Roar In Preparation for a Big Weekend
description: WATKINS GLEN, N.Y., July 8The Glen National Bank on Franklin Street burned five weeks ago, and the 60room Jefferson Hotel, just across the main thoroughfare of this Finger Lakes town of 2,800, has been closed since November.

title: Red Sox Reactivate Evans
description: BOSTON, July 8 (AP)  Dwight Evans, the Boston Red, Sox slugging rightfielder sidelined with a rightknee injury since June 23, was reactivated today before the club took off for Milwaukee on the start of an 11game trip. To make room on the 25player rooster for Evans, the Red Sox returned Dave Coleman, an outfielder and first baseman, to Pawtucket of the International League.

title: The Birds and the Bugs
description: Becoming a true friend of the environment has made me appreciate bugs. In return, bugs appreciate me I have this straight from the bug's mouth, as it were. A mosquito named Louis told me so in writing.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Local consumer assistance offices atfiliated with the State Division of Consumer Affairs saved consumers across the state more than $1.2 million in the first five months of this year by resolving 7,040 cases, Adam K. Levin, director of the state office, said yesterday.

title: Albania Warns China Against U.S. Ties
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, July 8 (UPI)Albania has sharply criticized its ally, China, warning that closer ties with the Uited States are a mistake and lecturing reking on MarxismLeninism,

description: W.Y.R.A.

title: Roots of Writing Traced Back More Than 10,000 Years
description: Archeologists have long believed that the invention of writing occurred about 5,200 years ago when the ancient Sumerians of Mesopotamia developed a system using picturelike symbols inscribed on clay tablets.

title: Mauritania Official Blames Algeria in Attack on Envoy
description: PARIS, July 8 (Reuters)Mauritania's Foreign Minister blamed Algeria today for yesterday's attempted assassination of the Mauritanian ambassador in Paris:

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times in the last week.

title: 3 AGENCIES INQUIRING INTO DANBURY BLAZE
description: DANBURY, Conn., July 8Three separate agencies conducted inquiries today in an effort to sort out conflicting reports on the cause of the fire that killed five prisoners Thursday morning at the Federal prison here.

title: Mother Recalls Anger and Conflict Of Boy Held in Fire Fatal to 42
description: SUPERIOR, Wis.They think I set that fire, Andrew Zinmer, sounding surprised and anguished, told his mother and his lawyer from his hospital bed in Nashville the other day.

title: Women's Parley Opens in Albany
description: ALBANY, July 8The New York State women's meeting opened here today with more than 5,000 women registered for the threeday conference.

title: Curtis Sells Holiday To Publisher on L.I.
description: INDIANAPOLIS, July 8The Curtis Publishing Company has sold Holiday magazine to Sheldon Shane, a Floral Park, L.I./ publisher of another established travel magazine called Travel.

title: Nothing Inscrutable About China When It States Policy on Taiwan
description: HONG KONG, July 8 Unlike in the United States, where official spokesmen seem endlessly available to comment on anything be it consequential or trivial, getting an official response in China to a breaking news story can

title: ENTRIES
description: Horses listed In order of post Positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: ExplosionCloses AlaskanPipeline; 1 Dead, 6 Hurt
description: ANCHORAGE, July 8A powerful explosion and fire ripped through a pump station on the TransAlaska oil pipeline about 38 miles south of Fairbanks this afternoon. One man was killed and at least six persons were injured.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: PITTSBURGH, July 8The Westinghouse Electric Corporation said today that efforts to settle out of court antitrust suits filed against 29 uranium producers had not produced any meaningful proposals.

title: Albany Leaders Agree to a Rise In Aid to Jobless and Businesses
description: ALBANY, July 8Legislative leaders and Governor Carey announced agreement this evening on a measure giving economic incentives to businesses, raising unemployment and disability benefits and mandating disability payments to pregnant workers.

title: Britain Reinforces Its Troops in Belize and Invasion Jitters Subside
description: BELIZE, July 8Invasion jitters subsided today in this poor, isolated vestige of the British Empire as troops hurriedly ferried here from across the Atlantic took up key defense positions near the Guatemala border.

title: PILOT CALLS UNREST WIDESPREAD IN CHINA
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, July 8The Chinese fighter pilot who defected to Taiwan yesterday said today that the China he had left behind was a land of widespread discontent and disillusionment over frequent purges and political shifts.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Due to a typesetting error, a Washington dispatch in The Times Wednesday omitted the name of a participant at a meeting of American Jewish leaders with President Carter. The list should have included Matthew Schoenwald, chairman of the American Trade Union Council for Histadrut.

title: MITE HOUSE BACKS SUBSIDY FOR ADOPTING UNWANTED CHILDREN
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The Carter Administration plans to endorse next week legislation that would provide Government subsidies to families that adopt hardtoplace children.

title: Broadcasts Attacking U.S. Stepped Up
description: MOSCOW, July 8Leonid I. Brezhnev advised foreign ambassadors today to report Soviet policies to their governments objectively so as to create an atmosphere of good will. While he criticized no ambassador or country by name, Soviet broadcasts during the day Sharply stepped up their attacks on the United States.

title: S.B.A. Halts Minorities Program Pending Study of Alleged Abuses
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP)The head of the Small Business Administration, acknowledging that whites have profited from a Government program designed to help blacks begin in business, today ordered a temporary halt in the program.

title: Gullikson Twins Prevail
description: NEWORT, R.I.; July 8 (AP)Tim and Tom Gullikson teamed today in the $50,000 Hall of Fame Tennis championships and defeated the secondseeded doubles pair.

title: Dollar Weakens in Tokyo Despite Official Support; Gold Moves Up in Europe
description: Heavy buying of dollars by the Bank of Japan helped steady the falling United States currency in Tokyo foreign exchange trading yesterday, The Associated Press reported.

title: Mass Transit Discord in New Jersey
description: Governor Byrne of New Jersey has confused to the point of incomprehensibility the efforts of the Port Authority to pay for masstransit improvements with tolls on its Hudson River crossings. He has vetoed the minutes of the last two meetings of the Authority's commissioners; paralyzing the conduct of business and weakening the Authority's ability to use tolls in the very way the Governor says he believes they should be used.

title: Happy Birthday
description: NICE, France, July 8Marc Chagall, the most renowned living painter, celebrated his 90th birthday here last night at a concert sponsored by the French Government and played by some of the world's leading musicians.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, JULY 9, 1977

title: Commonwealth Sets Up Rhodesia Sanctions Group
description: LONDON, July 8 (Reuters)A 10nation Commonwealth working group to examine ways of tightening sanctions against Rhodesia, particularly in the supply of oil and petroleum products, was set up today, the Commonwealth secretariat announced.

title: Bar Holdup Charged
description: A 21yearold Bronx man was arraigned in White Plains Criminal Court on charges he had attempted to rob a downtown bar and its 14 patrons. Thursday night with an unloaded pistol.

title: Southeast Asians to Seek Better Ties With Reds
description: SINGAPORE, July 8 (Reuters)Foreign ministers of the nonCommunist Association of Southeast Asian Nations agreed today to work for peaceful relations with the Oommunist states in Indochina. At the same time they attacked Communist insurgents in their own countries and called them a threat to Asian security.

title: Dawdling on Concorde in New York
description: Governor Carey has not had to threaten a veto to otgain compliance with his wishes from the Port Authority's commissioners. Knowing that thousands of the Governor's constituents on Long Island object to giving the supersonic Concorde even a brief noise test at Kennedy Airport, the Authority has postponed once again a decision either to go forward with such testing or to ban Concorde landings on the basis of other evidence.

title: Beach Stays Closed
description: The bayside beach at Point O'Woods. on Fire Island will remain closed this., weekend because of water pollution,: Dr. Mahfouz Zaki, the Suffolk County Director of Public Health, announced..., The beach has been closed since June 27. Four other bayside beaches that had. been closed on that date were openedJuly 1. The morepopular beaches on, the ocean side of the 32milelong Fire Island were not affected by the order.

title: SEGREGATION TRIAL TO REOPEN IN QUEENS
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn agreed yesterday to reop'en on July 25 the trial challenging segregation at Andrew Jackson High Schcol in Queens and to widen its scope to include evidence that communities in Nassau County were responsible for the segregation.

title: NEGLIGENCE CHARGED IN KIDDER PROSPECTUS
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged Kidder, Peabody & Company, a major New York securities firm, with negligently underwriting two securities issues it had not thoroughly investigated.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Happy Birthday
description: NICE, France, July 8Marc Chagall, the most renowned living painter, celebrated his 90th birthday here last night at a concert sponsored by the French Government and played by some of the world's leading musicians.

title: Diplomat of Prewar School
description: Walter C. Dowling was one of the State Department's prewar generation of welltrained diplomats who emerged onto the international scene after World War II.

title: Rich Jersey Pace Lacks a ShooIn
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., July 8 Talk of next Tuesday's $425,000 Meadowlands Pace began building along the New Jersey track's backstretch today, with horsemen exchanging stories about the problems and achievements of theit respective entries. No one, however, seemed ready to Race pick a sure winner from the collection of twodozen 3yearolds who are to compete in two eliminations worth $106,250 apiece. The first five finishers from each heat will become eligible for the $212,500 finale in the richest race ever held for thoroughbreds or standardbreds.

title: Personal Investing
description: When the American Electric Power Company came to market recently with $198 million worth of common stock, the utility accomplished a notable feat on two counts. It was the largest sale of electric utility common stock ever, as well as being the biggest such sale ever made through a rights offering to stockholders.

title: Mets Fall After LastDitch Rally, 54
description: True, the Mets lost again last night at Shea Stadium. But Manager Joe Torre's men staged a twoout uprising in the ninth inning that had a crowd of 10,770 in a frenzy before the Montreal Expos walked off the field a little shakily with a 54 victory.

title: GUILTY OWNERS FACE NURSINGHOME CURB
description: ALBANY, July 8Nursinghome operators convicted of felonies in connection with the operation of their homes would automatically lose their licenses under bill that passed both houses of the Legislature today and went to Governor Carey for his certain signature.

title: JOBLESS RATE RISES; WHOLESALE PRICES SHOW A SHARP DROP
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Although the number of Americans with jobs increased for the eighth straight month in June, the unemployment rate edged upward to 7.1 percent of the labor force from 6.9 percent for May, the Government reported today.

title: Yale Senior Slain in Scarsdale; Boyfriend Surrenders to Priest
description: SCARSDALE, July 8A 20yearold Yale senior, the daughter of a Manhattan lawyer, was fatally bludgeoned with a claw hammer in a bedroom in her family's sprawling Tudor home early yesterday. A young man described as her boyfriend, a Yale graduate who had been staying at her home and who was depicted as an outstanding student and an allAmerican boy, surrendered later to an upstate priest and confessed, the authorities said.

title: FEDERAL AGENTS RAID SCIENTOLOGY CHURCH
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, carrying buzz saws, sledgehammers, crowbars and search warrants, entered offices of the Church of Scientology here and in Los Angeles this morning in an attempt to recover hundreds of documents allegedly stolen by church operatives from Government files.

title: U.S. Refuses to Comment
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The State Department, apparently seeking to avoid any problems with Peking, refused to comment today on a statement by the defecting Chinese pilot that he hoped for American intercession in China on behalf of his family.

title: A Soggy Ending for a Different Regatta
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 8A diflerent kind of yacht race, one involvingold boats and those not so old, but all using the wind for power, came to a soggy conclusion here today after an overnight run of 80 miles up Long Island Sound from Larchmont, N.Y.

title: Chicago's Council Adopts Strict Pornography Limit
description: CHICAGO, July 8 (UPI)Chicago's City Council has adopted an ordinance has would virtually eliminate theestab lishment of new adult bookstores, peep shows, strip tease establishments, Xrated theaters and other."adult establishments.

title: Drop in Wholesale Prices Fails To Cheer Market
description: Wall Street's bag of worries outweighed positive news on the wholesale price front yesterday to send the Dow Jones industrial average slightly lower. But natural gas stocks boomed in a bull market all their own.

title: O'Brien Backs Knicks
description: Larry O'Brien, commissioner of the National Basketball Association, came to the support of the Knicks yesterday regarding the Nets contention that exclusive territorial rights are illegal.

title: MICHAEL J. PINTO
description: Michael J. Pinto, a construction executive, died Thursday at Community Hospital in Glen Cove, L.I. He was 65 years old and lived in Sea Cliff, L. I.

title: Dutch National Ballet Has Come of Age Fast
description: AMSTERDAMOf the two countries since World War II to have become converted to the joys of classic dancethe Netherlands and Germanyit is surely the Netherlands that is the more unlikely. Germany at least had a whole string of opera houses, each of which demanded at the very least, the services of an opera ballet. The Netherlands had no such easy point of departureits dance constituency had to be built from scratch.

title: Circumscribing School Aid
description: The Vatican's call this week for more government aid to parochial schools around the world followed by 11 days United States Supreme Court ruling that seemed to illustrate the complexities of trying to increase assistance to this na

title: A Conversation With Ralph Ellison
description: The following is adapted from an interview with Ralph Ellison conducted last winter by Ishmael Reed, a novelist and poet. Quincy Troupe, a poet and anthologist, and Steve Cannon, a producer, at Mr. Ellison's home here. Mr. Ellison, a novelist and essayist, is Albert Schweitzer Professor of the Humanities at New York University.

title: Kentucky Miners Rally In 51Week Coal Strike
description: WHITLEY CITY, Ky., July, 8 (AP)About 300 miners, relatives, union offcars and sympathizers gathered today on a picnic ground to hear United vine Workers officials promise victory in strike that has lasted almost a year. The U.M.W. presented a check for $5,000 to the 153 striking miners.

title: Emerson, Lake and Palmer+ 60 Rock
description: The opening performance Thursday night of Emerson, Lake and Palmer's threenight run at Madison Square Garden had all the elements of a major rock eventeager anticipation, a lavish stage show and cheering crowds. But in the end, it didn't serve to disturb seriously the impression made by the group's latest album, Works, Vol. 1. Keith Emerson seems the most interesting of the three, followed by Greg Lake, with Carl Palmer and the trio's concerted efforts in a dead tie for last.

title: Albany Leaders Agree to Increase In Aid to the Jobless and Businesses
description: ALBANY, July 8Legislative leaders and Governor Carey announced agreement this evening on a measure giving economic incentives to businesses, raising unemployment and disability benefits and mandating disability payments to pregnant workers.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Minor Quake in Alaska
description: PALMER, Alaska, July 8 (UPI)A minor earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 4.5 on the Richter scale and an epicenter 35 miles west of Anchorage occurred today, the Alaska Tsunami Warning Center said. No damage was reported.

title: Glen Cove, LI., Lawns Go Thirsty After Polluted Wells Are Closed
description: GLEN COVE, L.L, July 8  Four of this city's seven wells have been closed because their water was found to contain suspected carcinogens, and Mayor Vincent Suozzi said the minor emergency measures, instituted yesterday, would be continued.

title: SCOTTSBORODIALOCUE DESCRIBED BY WRITER
description: WINCHESTER, Tenn., July 8 (AP)John McGreevy, a scriptwriter, testified today that he invented the television dialogue in which the main witness in the 1930s Scottsboro Boys trial was called a whore, a bum and a perjurer.

title: Quebec Government Withdraws Bill To Make French Sole Language
description: QUEBEC, July 8 (UPI)The government of Quebec withdrew today language legislation that Englishspeaking Quebecers say was designed to suppress the uese and teaching of English in the province.

title: Yanks Beat Orioles, 75, Led by Munson, Gullett
description: BALTIMORE, July 8For Don Gullett and Reggie Jackson, their visit to Memorial Stadium tonight brought less grief than the trip they made here last April. Thurman Munson, on the other hand, produced as much grief for the Orioles as he did on the earlier visit.

title: Cairo Arrests the Leader Of Moslem Extremist Cult That Killed ExMinister
description: CAIRO, July 8 (UPI)The Egyptian Government today announced the arrest of the leader of a sect of Moslem extremists that abducted and killed a former cabinet minister.

title: People in Sports
description: Alan Steelman, the former Texas Congressman now living in Virginia, said yesterday he was calling off plans to purchase the Oakland A's from Charles O. Finley and move them to Washington as a National League team.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Wellington Mara must be chuckling. When the owner of the New York Giants moved his football team to the Meadowlands in New Jersey, most New York chauvinists howled in protest, as if the Giants were being relocated in the Wyoming wilderness. But now that the Nets, an alleged team in the National Basketball Association, intend to miss their foul shots in a Meadowlands arena yet to be determined economically feasible much less constructed, the sense of distance suddenly has shrunk. Michael Burke, the

title: Mass Confusion Reigns in Legislature as Session Nears  End
description: ALBANY, July 8"Point of order! Point of order! Assemblyman Alfred A. DelliBovi was on his feet. No one seems to know what's going on here. What are we doing? When are we leaving Albany?

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, JULY 9, 1977

title: New Tippett Opera Is Choreographed by Raines
description: It may seem perverse to bring a black American choreographer to Covent Garden for the world premiere of British opera. Walter Raines, the first black choreographer to work at the Royal Opera House, is not well known here and has never staged dances in a major opera house before.

title: Roots of Writing Traced Back More Than 10,000 Years
description: Archeologists have long believed that the invention of writing occurred about 5,200 years ago when the ancient Sumerians of Mesopotamia developed a system using picturelike symbols inscribed on clay tablets.

title: BRIG. GEN. HARRIS JONES, 84, IS BURIED AT WEST POINT
description: Brig. Gen. Harris Jones, former dean of the academic board at the United States Military Academy at West Point, N.Y., who died in Asheville, N.C. on July 1, was buried at West Point on Thursday. He was 84 years old.

title: PRESIDENT AND FORD MAY STUMP IN STATE
description: TRENTON, July 8The possibility loomed today that last year's major rivals` for the Presidency would be involved in another campaign this fallthe New Jer. sey Governorship election.

title: Unlikely Figures in Murder Case
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 8The bright red hair of Bonnie Jean Garland was a familiar sight in front of the Yale Glee Club, as she often stood crafting the notes of the solo parts that she was given.

title: Some Small Steps Toward Peking
description: Chinese officials have been telling American visitors former Chief of Naval Operations Elmo Zumwalt is the most recentthat the Carter Administration must sever the umbilical cord that binds the United States to the Nationalist Government on Taiwan. It is an issue on which the postMao leadership has become increasingly strident. Secretary of State Vance's address on Asian policY last week emphasized respect for China's strong commitments to independence, unity, and selfreliance, and reiterated the basic tenets of Washington's China policy, but it offered no specific proposals for giving effect to the stated desire of the Administration to normalize relations with the People's Renublic.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If the old man can do it, so can I. Marc Chagall, when he was told that Paul Paray, 91 years old, preferred to conduct a gala concert in Nice for the artist's 90th birthday at night rather than in the afternoon. [9:6.]

title: Organ Transplant Controversy: A Gift of Life or Lifetime I. 0. U.?
description: On June 4, 1969, Odevia Field of East Orange, N.J., received some flowers and a card that read: Dear Morn, A year ago you gave me the greatest present in the world. Thank you. Love, Kenny.

title: State, Still Finding PCB's, Retains Ban on Use of Perth Amboy Water
description: TRENTON, July 8The Department of Environmental Protection reported today that new tests showed the continued presence of carcinogens in the Perth Amboy water supply. Consequently, said Raymond Barg, chief of the department's Bureau of Potable Water, the state's ban on use of Perth Amboy's wells and water filtration plant will continue:

title: Pakistan Strongman Says He Hopes Bhutto Will Run in. October Election
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, July 8 (AP)PaOstan's new leader, Gen. Mohammad ulHaq, said today that the military overthrew the government to avert a civil war but that the army wanted the depoSed Prime Minister, Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, to orapete in the promised October election.  tai iris first full interview as martiallaw commander, the army chief of staff said he 'decided at 5 P.M. on Monday to seize control of Pakistan under a contingency plan he and his commanders had prepared early in the period of political turmoil that erupted four months ago.

title: OldCrop Soybean Futures Drop for Fifth Session; Unexpected Rain a'Factor
description: Oldcrop soybean futures declined yesterday for the fifth straight session on the Chicago Board of Trade.
