title: Syrian Troops in Lebanon Set Up Posts Around Palestinian Camps
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 30Syrian soldiers of the Arab League's peacekeeping force set up gun positions today around Palestinian refugee camps here, under new plans to place controls over the guerrillas in this country.

title: I.R.S. Inquiry Could Help New York In Campaign Against Topless Bars
description: New York got its first topless bar in 1967. Since then these licensed drinking spots with nude dancers have become a multimilliondollar business, and law enforcement officials say the business has fallen largely under the control of organized crime,

title: ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: Not too long ago, anyone could put up a blockbuster in New York and no one felt that he had the right and duty to tell the builder that it was terrible. Now neighborhood groups, professional organizations, community boards, city agencies and architectural watchdogs either possess that right or take it upon themselves, and new construction is increasingly the subject of public attention and debate.

title: Dietz, Klecatsky Capture Single Sculls in Canada
description: ST. CATHERINES, Ontario, July 30 (AP)Jim Dietz and Dr. Larry Klecatsky Olympic rowing veterans and members of the New York Athletic CluL, scored victories today in the finals of the Royal Canadian Henly Regatta. The finals were held in ideal weather conditions on the Henley course.

title: Recruiters Admit Inflating Lists
description: ALBANY, N.Y.. July 30 (AP)To meet cittotal for the allvolunteer Army, computer records were systematically padded with phantom enlistees, recruiting officers admitted today at a Congressional ? here.

title: Quebec Government Is Proposing A Ban on Use of Strikebreakers
description: MONTREAL, July 30The Quebec government has paid a political debt to labor but has further alienated management with legislation that would forbid companies from using strikebreakers to continue operations during strikes or lockouts.

title: Golden Tonka, Retriever, Becomes FirstObedience Champion in U.S.
description: Moreland's Golden Tonka, U.D., is the first obedience trial champion in the United States: Tonka was shown in the east and on July 23 won more than the required 100 points at the Nita Nee show in Centre Hall, Pa.

title: Saratoga Takes Center Stage On Blend of Past and Present
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., July 30 Each year about now, company drops in on this quiet little town. Some say the custom began when 7.000 British troops led by Gentleman Johnny Burgoyne were warmly received by the natives at nearby Schuylerville. The re suiting Battle of Saratoga paved the way for last year's Bicentennial bash and this year's bumper sticker:

Connors performed the ceremony in Scarsdale's Immaculate Heart of Mary Roman Catholic Church.

title: PARES PLAN EXTENDS FRESH AIR PROGRAM
description: POUGHQUAG, N.Y.  Last year when Alexander Cruz arrived at Franklin Roosevelt Jr.'s farm, he was expecting to see horsedrawn plows. He began learning immediately, and not just about

title: Atomic Power Delay Is Seen in California; Waste Problem Cited
description: LOS ANGELES, July 30Calling the Federal nuclear waste management program a disaster area, California's energy agency has predicted that it will be at least 1985 before there is firm footing for further atomic power development in this state.

title: Old Brooklyn Navy Yard Builds and Repairs Ships Though There Are No Dreadnoughts on Its Ways
description: Its work on battleships is a thing of the past, but with giant tankers, huge barges and other deepwater craft under construction and repair the old Brooklyn Navy Yardnow an industrial pirkstill retains much of its oldfashioned nautical flavor.

title: Some African States Want Whites to Stay
description: While Rhodesian black nationalist leaders are outwardly delighted by the rising white emigration from Rhodesiaeach departure further strains the capacity of the Salisbury Government to battle guerrilla insurgentssome look beyond black rule and acknowledge that for the independent country to have an efficient economy from the start, some whites must remain. The nationalists mixed feelings are shared by many blacks in power elsewhere in Africa. Where the dictates of postcolonial nationalism would suggest that whites, reminders of en unhappy colonial past, be expelled, the low level of education and technological skills left to the blacks by the colonizers would require them to stay.

title: Germans Are Flocking to a Movie Showing Rise and Fall of Hitler
description: BONN. July 30There were a few guffaws in the audience (luring the opening scenes of the Hitler film, showing the dictator awkwardly mugging and posturing, but when the lights went on after the final sequence, with Berlin reduced to rubble, the spectators filed out silently.

title: The Spanish Piano School And Its Star Pupil
description: Unlike Germany and France, Spain never developed an extensive repertory for the harpsichord and piano, a continuous tradition that began in the 17th century and proceeded without interruption to the present. As in England, periods of keyboard composition were sporadic as other instruments and Musical forms occupied composers attentions. For brief time, however, in the years prior to the First World War, Spain did produce three composers who devoted much of their creative energies to the pianoIsaac Albeniz (18601909), Enrique Granados (18671916) and, to a lesser extent, Manuel de Falla (18761946). Some recent recordings of their best efforts put a sharper perspective on what they accomplished in the field.

title: Swoon Swept, Johnny D. Win at Belmont
description: Just when followers of favorites were becoming convinced choices were going to sweep Belmont Park's ninerace program yesterday, along came William C. Partee's Swoon Swept to win the first division of the $54,000 Lexington Handicap. The payoff was $84 for $2.

title: From France, the Cuisinart

title: Clover Is a Clever Solution For the City Greensward

If you are getting tired of struggling, why not try Trifolium repensmore commonly known as white Dutch clover?

description: ROME, July 30Italy is taking steps to improve and expand its secret service to combat crime and terrorism.

title: Scientology Minister Jailed For Refusal to Answer
description: WASHINGTON, July 30 (AP)  A Church of Scientology minister has been sent to jail for refusing to answer questions before a Federal &rand jury looking into the church's activities.

title: Linda Babcock Sets Bridal for Sept. 17
description: The engagement of Linda Knight Babcock to Kendrick R. Wilson 3d has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. John B. Babcock of Millbrook, N.Y. Mr. Wilson's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Wilson Jr., reside in South Norwalk, Conn. The wedding is planned for Sept. 17.

title: Cuevas to Defend Title
description: LOS ANGELES, July 30 (UPI)Jose (Pipino) Cuevas of Mexico City, the youngest welterweight boxing champion in history, will defend the World Boxing Association 147pound crown against a Canadian veteran, Clyde Gray, next Saturday at the Olympic Auditorium. Cuevas, 19 years old, will be making the third defense of the title he won last July in Mexico by knocking out Angel Espada in two rounds. He has a 215 record with 19 knockouts.

title: JORDAN'S STAND SUPPORTED BY A DEMOCRATIC SENATOR
description: WASHINGTON, July 30Senator Gary Hart, Democrat of Colorado, today supported Vernon E. Jordan Jr., executive director of the National Urban League, declaring that the Government was not doing enough for the urban poor.

title: Another People's Method
description: PARISOn February 18, 1978, former British Prime Minister Edward Heath told me in London: On my first visit to China, in the summer of 1976, I went to Kunming in the south. They were n the process of attacking a local official by public posters and insults.

title: UNDER MY WINGS EVERYTHING PROSPERS
description: 216 pp. New York: Doubleday & Co. $7.95.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: One of the most beautiful photographs ever made, Atget's romantic view of swooning trees in the garden of Versailles, is hung next to a purely utilitarian aerial reconnaissance view of bombpocked fields in the exhibition The Landscape in Photography at the Prakapas Gallery, East 71st Street (through Aug. 5).

title: WILSON DENIES REPORTS THAT HE WAS SPIED ON
description: LONDON, July 30 (AP)  Sir Harold Wilson said today that newspaper reports that he had been bugged by a Government agency while he was the Labor Prime Minister were incredible, and he would have known if he was under surveillance. But he called for an inquiry.

title: Councilmen Call for New Contract On Hot Dog Sales in Central Park
description: City Councilmen Robert F. Wagner Jr. and Henry J. Stern called on the Parks Commissioner yesterday to cancel a fiveyear contract awarded to a single vendor to sell hot does in Central Park.

title: Outfielder's 3 Hits Bat In 5 Runs
description: The lively ball is alive and well. A total of 14 runs and 24 hits attested to its preserfce yesterday at Shea Stadium, where the San Diego Padres outdid the Mets in runs, 86; hits, 16 to 8. and errorc, 3 to 0.

title: Is Senses In the Realm Of Pornography?
description: To Western audiences, In the Realm of the Senses, which is graphically explicit in its depiction of an obsessive sexual affair, may seem both tediously repetitive and ultimately pornographic. True, recordbreaking crowds have descended upon the Plaza theater, where the filmseized by United States Customs last fall before it could be shown at the New York Film Festivalhas at last opened; yet, many people have undoubtedly been surprised and confused by what they have found.

title: The Tennis Clinic
description: Perhaps the most rudimentary truth in tennis is that to play well you must hit the ball well. So average players will spend hours honing their hitting technique.

description: The International Commission of Jurists, in a study to be published in Geneva, asserts that the Government of President Ferdinand E. Marcos of the Philippines is cmtinuing its martial law rule to perNtuate tilt& personal power of the President and his collaborators and to increase the power of the military to control Philippine society.

title: State Police in Kentucky Ordered To Eliminate Height Requirement
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 30 (AP)The Kentucky state police have been ordered to eliminate a minimum height requirement that two women contended constituted discrimination.

title: Queens Power Failure Affects 1,000 Users
description: About 1,000 Consolidated Edison customers in Howard Beach, Queens, were without power for an hour yesterday, authorities reported. A Con Edison spokesman said a feeder problem had caused the power, failure, which lasted from 8 A.M. to 9:07 A.M. Only 500 customers were affected at first, but problems in bringing back service to the first 500 caused a power failure for another 500 area residents, the utility said.

title: Alabama Sheriff Indicted; Crime Rate Is Denounced
description: TUSKEGEE,, Ala., July 30 (UPI)Lucius D. Amerson, Alabama's first black sheriff since Reconstruction, was indicted yesterday by a grand jury that denounced his office for what it called Macon County's unenviable crime rate.

title: A Suburb of Denver To Recycle Water For Crop Irrigation
description: NORTHGLENN, Colo., Juiy 30 (AP)It's an old problem in the arid West: Doe water go to cities and towns or use in homes and industry or to farmers who need it to irrigate crops?

title: THE KONICA C35EF. WITH BUILTIN POPUP FLASH.
description: The Konica C35EF is a professionalfeature camera as easy to use as an instantload. Because it automatically sets correct exposures for you.
